question: What does the 'Unavailable' button do in the Unity Application?
reference_answer: The 'Unavailable' button allows you to go unavailable in a call queue. It is only usable when you are assigned to a call queue as an agent and have a call center license assigned. If you have unavailable codes set up for your call center enterprise, you will be presented with a menu offering those codes as options when you click on Unavailable (Break/Lunch/Bathroom…).
reference_context:
Document 8: summary: Define and describe the actions of the menus and buttons at the top of the Unity Application
text: # Define and describe the actions of the menus and buttons at the top of the Unity Application

At the top of the Unity, application are buttons used to control calls and user settings. Some buttons will only appear if the user has an appropriate license.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000AK8j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o6E7)  
* **Unavailable:**Allows you to go unavailable in a call queue.  
**NOTE:**Only usable when you are assigned to a call queue as an agent and have a call center license assigned. If you have unavailable codes set up for your call center enterprise, you will be presented with a menu offering those codes as options for when you click on Unavailable (Break/Lunch/Bathroom…)
* **Available:**Allows you to go available in the call queues.  
**NOTE:**Only usable when you are assigned to a call queue as an agent and have a call center license assigned.
* **Wrap-up:**This allows you to set yourself into a wrap-up state.  
**NOTE:**Only usable when you are assigned to a call queue as an agent and have a call center license assigned.
* **Release:**Hang up on your current call. If you are receiving an incoming call, this button turns into an Answer button.
* **Dial:**Bring up your dial window. Enter a valid phone number or extension and click OK to have Unity dial the number using the phone attached to your user.
* **Transfer:**Enter an extension or phone number and have your call blind transferred to that caller.
* **Hold:**Place your active call on hold. When you have a selected call on hold, this button becomes Retrieve. Click Retrieve to bring your call off hold.
* **Conference:**Click this when you have multiple active calls on hold. The conference button will bring all of the held calls together. You can also use this to bring an active call and a held call together as well.
* **Voicemail:**Activate your voicemail on your phone.
* **Recording:**Change the recording options that you’re currently using or turn your recording feature on or off.
* **Reports:**Access reports to run on your agents or call centers.
* **Settings:**Access your services and settings.

question: What is the default path to Unity log files?
reference_answer: C:\Program Files (x86)\Unity Clint\Log
reference_context:
Document 6: summary: This is the guide on how to get Unity log files.
text: # This is the guide on how to get Unity log files.

1. Navigate to the install folder for Unity, by default this is C:\Program Files (x86)\Unity Clint\Log
2. Locate the folder with the most recent date.
3. Right-click on the folder, select**Send To**,and choose**Compressed Zip folder**.
4. Send the zip file to support.

question: What is the feature Shared Call Appearance (SCA) and what does it allow a user to do?
reference_answer: Shared Call Appearance (SCA) allows a user to have more than one device assigned to their user account. When a call comes in for that user (including calls to a call group or call center), all the devices assigned to that user will ring. The user can then answer the call from any of the devices.
reference_context:
Document 1: summary: Defines the feature Shared Call Appearance (SCA) and walks through how to configure it.
text: # Defines the feature Shared Call Appearance (SCA) and walks through how to configure it.

Description
-----------  
Shared call appearance (SCA) allows a user to have more than one device assigned to their user account. Examples of additional devices include a second desk phone, such as a Polycom VVX250 or a soft phone such as the NextivaONE. When a call comes in for that user (including calls to a call group or call center), all the devices assigned to that user will ring. The user can then answer the call from any of the devices.  
***Because the line is shared across multiple devices, only one device can be in use for that line at a time.***  
Some common reasons why an SCA would be used:  
* Have a phone in the office and a phone at home
* To make calls with a different caller ID (i.e. multiple store locations)
* Answer a co-worker's calls
* Place a call on hold and pick it up in another location
+ Call parking may be a better option if you need to move a call between more than two phones regularly  
All Nextiva packages allow up to 5 additional devices assigned to a single user, and our Enterprise and Ultimate packages allow up to 35 additional devices assigned to a single user.  
For the NextivaONE Application Nextiva auto-creates several shared call appearance instances. Deleting these will affect your ability to use NextivaONE depending on the instance you delete.  
* **UserID\_btbc\_mb**- Mobile Version of NextivaONE
* **UserID\_btbc\_tablet**- Tablet version of NextivaONE
* **UserID\_****btbc\_desktop**- Desktop version of NextivaONE
* **UserID\_btbc\_connect**- Website version of NextivaONE  
Be aware that if you are using the Busy Lamp Field (BLF) feature, additional configuration will need to be done by the Nextiva Support team for the device.  
For instructions on how to configure this feature, choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in.  
| [image.png](#NP3) | [image.png](#Platform) |
| --- | --- |  
Setup
-----  
1. Login to the Platform voice portal as an administrator.
2. Click on the**Users**button.
3. Hover over the user to adjust and click on the vertical ellipses,then select**Voice Settings**from the dropdown menu.
4. Click **Call Routing**on the left-hand side of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nbrI)
5. Scroll down and click on**Shared Call Appearance**to expand the section.  
**NOTE:** The Nextiva app be present as a Shared Call Appearance.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nbrm)
6. Adjust the main settings for Shared Call Appearance
7. **Allow click-to-dial from all devices for this user**- All devices will ring for click to dial calls.
8. **Alert all devices when a group page or announcement is sent**- Group page will ring to all devices, not just the primary.
9. **Allow active calls to be retrieved or pulled to other devices -** Allows for calls to be pulled between the primary and shared devices.
10. **Allow multiple calls at the same time from any device -**REQUIRES ENTERPRISE LICENSE. Allows multiple devices to be used on the same line at the same time.
11. **Allow calls to be put on hold and picked up on any other device** - Lets calls be put on hold and retrieved from another shared device.
12. **Allow others to bridge or join an active call from any other device**- Allows people to join an active call from a shared device.
13. **Bridge Warning Tone**- Notice that someone has joined from a shared device.
14. If any changes were made, click**Save**.
15. Scroll down and click**Add appearance**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nbvp)
1. Select the device or MAC address.
2. In the **Name of Line/Port** field enter a unique alpha-numeric identifier for the device, such as the MAC address and user extension combined (i.e. 64167F237742x1002)
3. Check the boxes to control the shared call appearance options
* **Make this device active**- Enable the user on the shared device.
* **Allow calls to originate from this device**- Let this shared device make outbound calls for this user.
* **Allow calls to be terminated using this device**- Let this shared device answer inbound calls.
16. Click**Save**.  
---  
Setup
-----  
1. Login to the 3.0 voice portal as an administrator.
2. Hover over**Users**at the top of the page and click on**Manage Users**.
3. Click on the user to configure.
4. Scroll down and click on**Routing**to expand that section.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nawm)
5. Click on **Shared Call Appearance** to view and edit the settings and devices. If you have the Nextiva app included in your licenses, there will be some devices already added.
6. Adjust settings for all shared devices.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nayD)
* **Alert Everywhere For Click-to-dial**- Ring all phones when the user uses a click to dial feature.
* **Alert Everywhere For Group Paging**- Instead of auto answering a group page call on the primary device, all devices on this user will ring requiring a group page call to be answered.
* **Allow Call Retrieve From Another Location**- Allows a call that was placed on hold to be picked up from any shared device.
* **Multiple Call Arrangement**- REQUIRES ENTERPRISE UPGRADE. This allows the line to be in use on more than one device at a time.
* **Enable Call Park**- Enables notification of parked calls on all shared lines instead of just the primary phone.
* **Allow bridging between locations**- Allows a shared device to join an existing call.
* **Bridge Warning Tone**- Warning tone that someone joined the line from a different device.
7. Click**Save**.
8. Click the **+** button to add another device.
9. Fill out the fields:  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nb8X)
* **User Device**- Select the MAC address of the device to use. Any device listed as NoGoodMacxxxxxxxx is a generic SIP device.
* **Line/Port** - Enter a unique alpha-numeric identifier for the device, such as the MAC address and user extension combined (i.e. 64167F237742x1002).
* **Enable This Location**- Allow the device to be used as a shared line for this user.
* **Allow origination from this location**- Allow the device to make outgoing calls for this user.
* **Allow termination to this location -**Allow the device to be able to answer inbound calls to this user.
10. Click**Save New Appearance**.

conversation_history.content: I am trying to understand more about this feature called Shared Call Appearance (SCA).
I see! I can certainly help explain that. What specifically would you like to know about it?
So what is it and what can it do?

Shared Call Appearance (SCA) is a feature that allows multiple devices to share the same phone number or extension. This enables users to make and receive calls from any of these devices as if they were using a single phone. It's particularly useful for people who want to use their office number across different locations or devices.

question: Which models support WiFi?
reference_answer: The Cisco CP 8861 and 8865
reference_context:
Document 5: summary: Configure a WiFi connection for the Cisco CP 8861 and CP 8865.
text: # Configure a WiFi connection for the Cisco CP 8861 and CP 8865.

The Cisco CP 8861 and 8865 are the only models sold by Nextiva that support WiFi.  
Configure WiFi from startup
---------------------------  
The devices should prompt to configure WiFi upon startup if there is no ethernet connection.  
1. Power on the device, do NOT have an ethernet cable plugged in.
2. The device should prompt with an option to scan for Wi-Fi networks, if it does not [click here](#Settings).
3. Push the **Wi-Fi Scan**softkey.
4. Using the directional pad, highlight the desired network from the list and press the**Select** softkey.
5. If the network is secure, using the directional pad, scroll down to the**Passphrase** field.
6. Enter the WiFi password.
7. Press the**Connect** softkey.
8. The device will connect to the WiFi network, and a WiFi symbol will appear in the upper right-hand corner of the screen if successful.  
---  
Configure WiFi from Settings
----------------------------  
1. Press the**Settings** button on the phone.
2. Scroll down and select**Network Configuration**.
3. Scroll down and select**Wi-Fi****Configuration**.
4. Use the left/right directional keys to turn WiFi on.
5. Press**Set**.
6. Scroll down and select **Wi-Fi profile**.
7. Press the**Scan**softkey.
8. Using the directional pad, highlight the desired network from the list and press the**Select** softkey.
9. If the network is secure, using the directional pad, scroll down to the**Passphrase** field.
10. Enter the WiFi password.
11. Press the**Connect** softkey.
12. The device will connect to the WiFi network, and a WiFi symbol will appear in the upper right-hand corner of the screen if successful.

question: What is the maximum number of additional devices that can be assigned to a single user with the Enterprise package?
reference_context:
Document 1: summary: Defines the feature Shared Call Appearance (SCA) and walks through how to configure it.
text: # Defines the feature Shared Call Appearance (SCA) and walks through how to configure it.

Description
-----------  
Shared call appearance (SCA) allows a user to have more than one device assigned to their user account. Examples of additional devices include a second desk phone, such as a Polycom VVX250 or a soft phone such as the NextivaONE. When a call comes in for that user (including calls to a call group or call center), all the devices assigned to that user will ring. The user can then answer the call from any of the devices.  
***Because the line is shared across multiple devices, only one device can be in use for that line at a time.***  
Some common reasons why an SCA would be used:  
* Have a phone in the office and a phone at home
* To make calls with a different caller ID (i.e. multiple store locations)
* Answer a co-worker's calls
* Place a call on hold and pick it up in another location
+ Call parking may be a better option if you need to move a call between more than two phones regularly  
All Nextiva packages allow up to 5 additional devices assigned to a single user, and our Enterprise and Ultimate packages allow up to 35 additional devices assigned to a single user.  
For the NextivaONE Application Nextiva auto-creates several shared call appearance instances. Deleting these will affect your ability to use NextivaONE depending on the instance you delete.  
* **UserID\_btbc\_mb**- Mobile Version of NextivaONE
* **UserID\_btbc\_tablet**- Tablet version of NextivaONE
* **UserID\_****btbc\_desktop**- Desktop version of NextivaONE
* **UserID\_btbc\_connect**- Website version of NextivaONE  
Be aware that if you are using the Busy Lamp Field (BLF) feature, additional configuration will need to be done by the Nextiva Support team for the device.  
For instructions on how to configure this feature, choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in.  
| [image.png](#NP3) | [image.png](#Platform) |
| --- | --- |  
Setup
-----  
1. Login to the Platform voice portal as an administrator.
2. Click on the**Users**button.
3. Hover over the user to adjust and click on the vertical ellipses,then select**Voice Settings**from the dropdown menu.
4. Click **Call Routing**on the left-hand side of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nbrI)
5. Scroll down and click on**Shared Call Appearance**to expand the section.  
**NOTE:** The Nextiva app be present as a Shared Call Appearance.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nbrm)
6. Adjust the main settings for Shared Call Appearance
7. **Allow click-to-dial from all devices for this user**- All devices will ring for click to dial calls.
8. **Alert all devices when a group page or announcement is sent**- Group page will ring to all devices, not just the primary.
9. **Allow active calls to be retrieved or pulled to other devices -** Allows for calls to be pulled between the primary and shared devices.
10. **Allow multiple calls at the same time from any device -**REQUIRES ENTERPRISE LICENSE. Allows multiple devices to be used on the same line at the same time.
11. **Allow calls to be put on hold and picked up on any other device** - Lets calls be put on hold and retrieved from another shared device.
12. **Allow others to bridge or join an active call from any other device**- Allows people to join an active call from a shared device.
13. **Bridge Warning Tone**- Notice that someone has joined from a shared device.
14. If any changes were made, click**Save**.
15. Scroll down and click**Add appearance**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nbvp)
1. Select the device or MAC address.
2. In the **Name of Line/Port** field enter a unique alpha-numeric identifier for the device, such as the MAC address and user extension combined (i.e. 64167F237742x1002)
3. Check the boxes to control the shared call appearance options
* **Make this device active**- Enable the user on the shared device.
* **Allow calls to originate from this device**- Let this shared device make outbound calls for this user.
* **Allow calls to be terminated using this device**- Let this shared device answer inbound calls.
16. Click**Save**.  
---  
Setup
-----  
1. Login to the 3.0 voice portal as an administrator.
2. Hover over**Users**at the top of the page and click on**Manage Users**.
3. Click on the user to configure.
4. Scroll down and click on**Routing**to expand that section.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nawm)
5. Click on **Shared Call Appearance** to view and edit the settings and devices. If you have the Nextiva app included in your licenses, there will be some devices already added.
6. Adjust settings for all shared devices.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nayD)
* **Alert Everywhere For Click-to-dial**- Ring all phones when the user uses a click to dial feature.
* **Alert Everywhere For Group Paging**- Instead of auto answering a group page call on the primary device, all devices on this user will ring requiring a group page call to be answered.
* **Allow Call Retrieve From Another Location**- Allows a call that was placed on hold to be picked up from any shared device.
* **Multiple Call Arrangement**- REQUIRES ENTERPRISE UPGRADE. This allows the line to be in use on more than one device at a time.
* **Enable Call Park**- Enables notification of parked calls on all shared lines instead of just the primary phone.
* **Allow bridging between locations**- Allows a shared device to join an existing call.
* **Bridge Warning Tone**- Warning tone that someone joined the line from a different device.
7. Click**Save**.
8. Click the **+** button to add another device.
9. Fill out the fields:  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000ARoX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nb8X)
* **User Device**- Select the MAC address of the device to use. Any device listed as NoGoodMacxxxxxxxx is a generic SIP device.
* **Line/Port** - Enter a unique alpha-numeric identifier for the device, such as the MAC address and user extension combined (i.e. 64167F237742x1002).
* **Enable This Location**- Allow the device to be used as a shared line for this user.
* **Allow origination from this location**- Allow the device to make outgoing calls for this user.
* **Allow termination to this location -**Allow the device to be able to answer inbound calls to this user.
10. Click**Save New Appearance**.

question: What are the call recording options available in the Nextiva Unity client?
reference_answer: The call recording options available in the Nextiva Unity client are: Always, On Demand, Never, Always with Pause/Resume, and On Demand with User Initiated Start.
reference_context:
Document 7: summary: Control call recording in the Nextiva Unity client.
text: # Control call recording in the Nextiva Unity client.

**Call Recording will only appear in Unity if a recording license is assigned to your user.**  
The recording button in the Unity client is used to adjust and control call recording while on a call. While not on a call, you can right-click on the button to adjust your user's call recording settings.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A8M7&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oGDn)  
Recording options:  
* **Always -**Every call will be recorded
* **On Demand**-Records entire call if feature access code to start recording is used. Once recording is enabled, it cannot be turned off. You can use pause and resume to pause parts of the call.
* **Never**-Calls will not be recorded at all
* **Always with Pause/Resume**-Records the entire call, does allow feature access codes to pause and resume recording.
* **On Demand with User Initiated Start**-Records the call from when the feature access code to start recording is used. You can also use pause and resume to pause parts of the call. If recording is stopped and started again, a new recording file is created.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A8M7&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oGDO)  
If call recording is set to either**Always with Pause/Resume, On Demand,** or**On Demand with User Initiated Start,**the recording button can be used while on a call to control call recording, and the Status portion of the active call table will reflect the current recording state.  
If set appropriately, while on a call, click the recording button. The status message for the active call will update to reflect if the call is being recorded, if recording is paused, or if it is not recording.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A8M7&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000007LfrA)

question: How do you add another party to a conference call in the Nextiva Unity application?
reference_answer: To add another party to a conference call, place your conference on hold by clicking any of the conferenced callers and clicking the Hold button. Then, click the Dial button to call out to another party. Once the call is connected, click the conference button again and confirm to add the third caller to the conference.
reference_context:
Document 11: summary: Manage conferencing through the Nextiva Unity application.
text: # Manage conferencing through the Nextiva Unity application.

| Unity is a call control application, not a softphone. It is used to control the primary device assigned to your user in the Nextiva voice portal. It cannot make calls on its own. | |
| --- | --- |  
When wanting to create a conference, you will need to be on an active call with other calls either on hold or already in a conference. Once you are ready to bring your callers together, click the conference button.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000AK3t&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o66X)  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000AK3t&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o66c)  
You can also add another party to your conference. You will want to place your conference on hold by clicking any of the conferenced callers and clicking the Hold button. After, click the Dial button to call out to another party. Once the call is connected, click the conference button again. This will cause a prompt to display, asking if you would like to add your third caller to the conference. Hit Yes, and the caller will be added.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000AK3t&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o66m)  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000AK3t&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o66w)
**Features:**  
* You can also add another party to your conference. You will want to place your conference on hold by clicking any of the conferenced callers and clicking the Hold button. After, click the Dial button to call out to another party. Once the call is connected, click the conference button again. This will cause a prompt to display, asking if you would like to add your third caller to the conference. Hit Yes, and the caller will be added.
* You may repeat this process to continue adding participants to your conference.**NOTE:** You may only add as many calls to your conference as your phone supports or the system allows.
* You can also click on a caller you have on a conference and hang up on them individually by clicking on the Release button.

question: What are the different types of transfers that the T44W supports?
reference_answer: The T44W is capable of both a blind (cold) and attended (warm) transfer.
reference_context:
Document 15: summary: Guide for using basic features within the T44W.
text: 1. Press the **Transfer** soft key during the call.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yVwr)
2. Dial the number or extension you wish to transfer to.
3. Press the **Call** soft key.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yTwg)
4. Once the third-party answers and is ready to receive the transfer, press the **Transfer** soft key.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yWBN)  
---  
Conference Call
---------------  
1. Press the **Conf** soft key during the live call
2. Dial the number or extension.
3. Press the **Send** soft key
4. To join/merge the calls once everyone is ready, press the **Conf** soft key again.
5. Select the **End Call** soft key to disconnect all parties or the **Split** soft key to separate the calls again.

Document 14: summary: Guide for using basic features within the T44W.
text: 1. Press the **Transfer** soft key during the call.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yVwr)
2. Dial the number/extension you wish to transfer to.
3. Press the **B Transfer** soft key to complete  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yIYE)

Document 13: summary: Guide for using basic features within the T44W.
text: # Guide for using basic features within the T44W.

The T44W device screen provides several buttons to navigate more features:  
**Line keys** (marked with the yellow arrows) allow for multiple configurations to perform different actions such as monitoring other extensions (busy lamp field), custom call parking, and simultaneous call management (line mirroring)  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yVdV)  
**Soft keys** (highlighted in green) give contextual options depending on how you interact with the phone. When idle, the soft keys offer generic options such as Call History, DND (Do Not Disturb), or the Settings menu. During a live call, the soft keys change to offer more call control (transfer, hold, etc).  
Below are steps to both [transfer a call](#Transfer) and start a 3-way [conference call](#Conference_Call).  
---  
Transfer Steps
--------------  
The T44W is capable of both a [blind (cold)](#Blind_Transfer) and [attended (warm)](#Warm_Transfer) transfer.

question: How long does it take for NextivaONE to change your presence to Offline?
reference_answer: NextivaONE will automatically change your presence to Offline after 20 minutes of inactivity (10 minutes of inactivity to change to Away, and another 10 minutes of inactivity to change to Offline).
reference_context:
Document 12: summary: Common issues identified with the NextivaONE application.
text: # Common issues identified with the NextivaONE application.

Starred teammates are not displaying under the Favorites tab on the left
------------------------------------------------------------------------  
The teammate will only appear under Favorites if there was a prior Team Chat initiated with the teammate. If no internal chat has happened with this teammate, the teammate will not appear on the favorites list.  
---  
The "clear All" button in the top right corner of the All Communications, Calls, and Voicemail tabs doesn't work
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  
This button only clears out the applied filters. It does not clear the actual calls/messages. New features and functionality can be requested. See[How to Submit Feedback or Request New Features](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/How-to-Submit-Feedback-or-Request-New-Features)for instructions.  
---  
When switching the Presence status to Busy the app doesn't audibly ring
-----------------------------------------------------------------------  
By design when the app is busy, the app will NOT audibly ring, though the call pop will still be present. If you do not wish to receive calls, use the **Do Not Disturb** status. If you wish for calls to still ring, mark yourself as **Available**.  
---  
Presence Changes to Away or Offline
-----------------------------------  
NextivaONE will automatically change your presence to **Away** after 10 minutes of inactivity. After an additional 10 minutes of inactivity, this will again automatically change to **Offline**.  
---  
MacOS Using iPhone Camera/Microphone
------------------------------------  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5kn&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000007MCKp)  
NextivaONE users on MacOS who also have an iPhone may have their phone become their default camera or microphone for the application. This is due to an Apple app called Continuity.  
Customers who have this enabled will either have to select a different camera every time they join a meeting, or will have to disable theContinuity Camera in Handoff within their iPhone settings.

question: What are the different types of transfers that the T44W supports?
reference_answer: The T44W is capable of both a blind (cold) and attended (warm) transfer.
reference_context:
Document 14: summary: Guide for using basic features within the T44W.
text: 1. Press the **Transfer** soft key during the call.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yVwr)
2. Dial the number/extension you wish to transfer to.
3. Press the **B Transfer** soft key to complete  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yIYE)

Document 15: summary: Guide for using basic features within the T44W.
text: 1. Press the **Transfer** soft key during the call.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yVwr)
2. Dial the number or extension you wish to transfer to.
3. Press the **Call** soft key.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yTwg)
4. Once the third-party answers and is ready to receive the transfer, press the **Transfer** soft key.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yWBN)  
---  
Conference Call
---------------  
1. Press the **Conf** soft key during the live call
2. Dial the number or extension.
3. Press the **Send** soft key
4. To join/merge the calls once everyone is ready, press the **Conf** soft key again.
5. Select the **End Call** soft key to disconnect all parties or the **Split** soft key to separate the calls again.

Document 13: summary: Guide for using basic features within the T44W.
text: # Guide for using basic features within the T44W.

The T44W device screen provides several buttons to navigate more features:  
**Line keys** (marked with the yellow arrows) allow for multiple configurations to perform different actions such as monitoring other extensions (busy lamp field), custom call parking, and simultaneous call management (line mirroring)  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5eL&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003yVdV)  
**Soft keys** (highlighted in green) give contextual options depending on how you interact with the phone. When idle, the soft keys offer generic options such as Call History, DND (Do Not Disturb), or the Settings menu. During a live call, the soft keys change to offer more call control (transfer, hold, etc).  
Below are steps to both [transfer a call](#Transfer) and start a 3-way [conference call](#Conference_Call).  
---  
Transfer Steps
--------------  
The T44W is capable of both a [blind (cold)](#Blind_Transfer) and [attended (warm)](#Warm_Transfer) transfer.

question: What are the default credentials for logging into the admin interface of a Cisco SPA series device?
reference_answer: Username: admin Password: cisco
reference_context:
Document 18: summary: How to manually provision a Cisco SPA series device.
text: # How to manually provision a Cisco SPA series device.

SPA 303, 504, 508
-----------------  
The SPA 525 has a different layout and a different set of instructions, [click here](#SPA525) to jump to the 525 instructions  
1. [Add the device](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Add-a-Device) to the account as a Generic SIP device. Ensure you document the SIP Username, Authentication Name, and Authentication Password.
2. Obtain the IP address by pressing the menu key (looks like a page with the top right corner folded) and pressing option 9.
3. On a computer on the same network as the phone open a browser and navigate to the phone's IP address. The phone has to be on the same local network as the computer for this to work.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5ZV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006J0kf)
4. In the upper right-hand corner of the page click**Admin Login**.  
If prompted the default credentials are:  
Username: admin
Password: cisco  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5ZV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006J0kz)
5. Click**Advanced**on the upper right-hand side of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5ZV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006J0lJ)

* **SIP Port:** 5062
* **SIP Transport:** TCP

* **Proxy:** prod.voipdnsservers.com:5062
* **Outbound Proxy:** prod.voipdnsservers.com:5062
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5ZV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000006rQtl)
* **User ID:** SIP Username of the user (obtained from the user device settings)
* **Password:** Device Password of the user (obtained from the user's device settings)
* **Auth ID:**Authentication Name of the user (obtained from the user device settings)

question: How do you add another party to your conference in the Nextiva Unity application?
reference_answer: To add another party to your conference, place your conference on hold by clicking any of the conferenced callers and clicking the Hold button. Then, click the Dial button to call out to another party. Once the call is connected, click the conference button again and confirm to add the third caller to the conference.
reference_context:
Document 11: summary: Manage conferencing through the Nextiva Unity application.
text: # Manage conferencing through the Nextiva Unity application.

| Unity is a call control application, not a softphone. It is used to control the primary device assigned to your user in the Nextiva voice portal. It cannot make calls on its own. | |
| --- | --- |  
When wanting to create a conference, you will need to be on an active call with other calls either on hold or already in a conference. Once you are ready to bring your callers together, click the conference button.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000AK3t&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o66X)  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000AK3t&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o66c)  
You can also add another party to your conference. You will want to place your conference on hold by clicking any of the conferenced callers and clicking the Hold button. After, click the Dial button to call out to another party. Once the call is connected, click the conference button again. This will cause a prompt to display, asking if you would like to add your third caller to the conference. Hit Yes, and the caller will be added.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000AK3t&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o66m)  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000AK3t&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o66w)
**Features:**  
* You can also add another party to your conference. You will want to place your conference on hold by clicking any of the conferenced callers and clicking the Hold button. After, click the Dial button to call out to another party. Once the call is connected, click the conference button again. This will cause a prompt to display, asking if you would like to add your third caller to the conference. Hit Yes, and the caller will be added.
* You may repeat this process to continue adding participants to your conference.**NOTE:** You may only add as many calls to your conference as your phone supports or the system allows.
* You can also click on a caller you have on a conference and hang up on them individually by clicking on the Release button.

question: What happens when you block a number in NextivaONE?
reference_answer: Callers will hear a notice that the number they are trying to reach is not accepting calls at this time.
reference_context:
Document 16: summary: How to block numbers from calling you within NextivaONE.
text: # How to block numbers from calling you within NextivaONE.

You can block numbers from calling you directly in the NextivaONE application. Callers will hear a notice that the number they are trying to reach is not accepting calls at this time. You can [unblock the number](#Unblock_Number) at any time.  
Be aware this will only block calls coming directly to your line and will not affect calls routed to you from a team call group or call center.  
Block Number
------------  
1. Locate the phone number in your call history and click on it.
2. In the contact panel on the right-hand side of the application click the down arrow to the right of the phone number.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5cj&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000007A5Qe)
3. Click**Block number** in the menu that appears.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5cj&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000007AFoA)
4. In the confirmation window that appears click the**Block** button.
5. A notice will appear at the bottom of the application that the number is blocked.  
---  
Unblock Number
--------------  
To unblock a number:  
1. Locate the phone number in your call history and click on it.
2. In the contact panel on the right-hand side of the application click the down arrow to the right of the phone number.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5cj&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000007ADJK)
3. Click**Unblock number** in the menu that appears.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5cj&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000007A75q)
4. In the confirmation window that appears click the**Unblock** button.
5. A notice will appear at the bottom of the application that the number is blocked.

conversation_history.content: I want to block a number in NextivaONE.
Got it. Do you have any specific questions about that?
What happens when you do that?
When you block a number, all calls and messages from that number are automatically rejected.

question: What is the maximum number of alternate numbers that can be assigned?
reference_context:
Document 21: summary: How to configure Alternate numbers and the limitations of alternate numbers
text: # How to configure Alternate numbers and the limitations of alternate numbers

| Alternate numbers allow for up to 10 additional numbers to ring the same inbound path. If a number is assigned as an alternate number, it cannot be used for texting. | |
| --- | --- |
| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| [NP3 Admin Dashboard](#NP3) | [Platform Main Page](#Platform) |  
---  
Setup
-----  
Alternate numbers can be configured on users, teams, or call flows.  
* [Users](#Users_Platform)
* [Teams](#Teams_Platform)
* [Call Flows](#Call_Flows_Platform)

Document 24: summary: How to configure Alternate numbers and the limitations of alternate numbers
text: 1. Login to the voice portal as an administrator.
2. Select**Communication**on the left.
3. Click on**Phone system**.
4. Click on**Call Flows**.
5. Select a call flow to assign an alternate number to.
* **Note:**If the call flow is active, you must deactivate it to add an alternate number.
6. Click**Add phone number**
7. Choose a number from the drop-down menu or set an extension.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Uf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000005MzXb)
8. Click**Save & Continue**.  
---  
Setup
-----  
Alternate numbers can be configured on both users and service instances (Auto Attendant or Call Groups)  
* [Users](#Users_NP3)
* [Service Instances](#Service_Instances_NP3)

Document 25: summary: How to configure Alternate numbers and the limitations of alternate numbers
text: 1. Login to the voice portal as an administrator.
2. Click on**Manage**in the Users tile.
3. Select the user for which you wish to add an alternate number.
4. Select**Phone Number**.
5. Click**Alternate Number +**.
* **Note:**You cannot assign more than 10 alternate numbers.
6. Select the number (or extension, or both) you would like to use for the Alternate Number from the first drop down list.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Uf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lscr)
7. If desired, select a**Ring Pattern**for the alternate number.
8. Click**Save**.
9. Repeat steps 5 through 8 as needed.  
---

Document 22: summary: How to configure Alternate numbers and the limitations of alternate numbers
text: **Note:**A user must have a voice license assigned for these steps to work.  
1. Log in to the voice portal as an administrator.
2. Click on**Users**.
3. Hover your mouse over the user to assign an alternate number and click the vertical ellipses on the right-hand side.
4. Click on**Voice Settings**.
5. In the**Phone Number**section (default landing page) click**Add Number**.
6. Choose a number from the drop-down menu or set an extension.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Uf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lseF)
7. If desired set a different ring tone (ring pattern).
8. Click**Save**.
9. Repeat steps 5 through 8 as needed.  
---

question: What steps are required to move a call from a handset to the desk phone?
reference_answer:
1. Place the call on hold on the handset.
2. Press the line key that is in use on the desk phone.
3. The call will be active on the desk phone.
reference_context:
Document 20: summary: How to make calls on handsets paired to a desk phone with the Yealink DD10K
text: # How to make calls on handsets paired to a desk phone with the Yealink DD10K

Separate Calls
--------------  
To use the handset separate from the base, line mirroring needs to be configured. The handset can use any free line instance to make calls. If the handset is using the primary line instance on the desk phone, you will need to select a line instance that is not in use on the desk phone to dial out.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5WH&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005Ia0a)  
---  
Move a call to the desk phone
-----------------------------  
You can move a call from a handset to the desk phone by following these steps:  
1. Place the call on hold on the handset.
2. Press the line key that is in use on the desk phone.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5WH&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005Itw1)
3. The call will be active on the desk phone.  
---  
Move a call to a handset
------------------------  
You can move a call from the desk phone to a handset by following these steps:  
1. Place the call on hold on the desk phone.
2. Open the menu of the handset.
3. Select**Status**.
4. Select**Line Status**.
5. Select**Retrieve**.
6. The call will be active on the handset.

question: How do I move a call from a handset to the desk phone?
reference_answer: You can move a call from a handset to the desk phone by following these steps: 1. Place the call on hold on the handset. 2. Press the line key that is in use on the desk phone. The call will be active on the desk phone.
reference_context:
Document 20: summary: How to make calls on handsets paired to a desk phone with the Yealink DD10K
text: # How to make calls on handsets paired to a desk phone with the Yealink DD10K

Separate Calls
--------------  
To use the handset separate from the base, line mirroring needs to be configured. The handset can use any free line instance to make calls. If the handset is using the primary line instance on the desk phone, you will need to select a line instance that is not in use on the desk phone to dial out.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5WH&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005Ia0a)  
---  
Move a call to the desk phone
-----------------------------  
You can move a call from a handset to the desk phone by following these steps:  
1. Place the call on hold on the handset.
2. Press the line key that is in use on the desk phone.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5WH&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005Itw1)
3. The call will be active on the desk phone.  
---  
Move a call to a handset
------------------------  
You can move a call from the desk phone to a handset by following these steps:  
1. Place the call on hold on the desk phone.
2. Open the menu of the handset.
3. Select**Status**.
4. Select**Line Status**.
5. Select**Retrieve**.
6. The call will be active on the handset.

text: # Headset brands that are compatible with the NextivaONE application.

question: How do you access the Nextiva Analytics Dashboard?
reference_answer: 1. Log in to the voice analytics portal. 2. From the main landing page, click Monitoring at the top of the page.
reference_context:
Document 34: summary: How to read and filter the Dashboard view in the Nextiva Voice Analytics tool.
text: # How to read and filter the Dashboard view in the Nextiva Voice Analytics tool.

Dashboards provide at-a-glance views of KPIs (key performance indicators) relevant to your business. The term dashboard originates from the automobile dashboard where drivers monitor the major functions of the automobile at-a-glance. Dashboards let you know if something is wrong or if something is right with your business. Follow the instructions below to access the Nextiva Analytics Dashboard.  
1. [Log in to the voice analytics portal](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Analytics-Logging-In).
2. From the main landing page, click**Monitoring**at the top of the page.  
After clicking Monitoring, the dashboard appears showing the locations on your account, as well as the inbound, outbound, answered, and missed calls for each location. Additionally, the total talk time for each location is listed to the far right.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Kz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nxkx)  
---  
Configuring The Dashboard
-------------------------  
The dashboard can be configured to display only certain types of calls, such as inbound or outbound calls, or to display only calls for certain locations. Additionally, you can configure the dashboard to only show calls within a specific time period.  
Settings and filters for the dashboard are controlled through the filter menu accessed by clicking the button that looks like on/off switches:  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Kz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nxlM)  
Within the filter menu, you can adjust the following filters:  
| Appearance | Call Types | Report Levels (Location, Call Group, User) | Specific Locations, Call Groups, or Users |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| image.png | image.png | image.png | image.png |  
The changes made are updated live on the dashboard. If you use custom groups and have none created, you will be provided with a link to create a custom group.  
It is also possible to change the date range for the data that displays on the dashboard.  
1. Click the calendar icon.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Kz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nxfe)
2. Choose either a**Relative**or**Custom**date range
* **Relative**will pull all data from the starting time frame to the present. For the monitoring section, this will update automatically approximately every 15 seconds.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Kz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nxn3)
* **Custom**date range will set a specific start and end date and time.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Kz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nxn8)

question: What are the recurrence options for scheduling a meeting in NextivaONE?
reference_answer:
The recurrence options for scheduling a meeting in NextivaONE are:
1. One-time meeting
2. Daily
3. Every weekday (Monday to Friday)
4. Weekly (Once a week on the day of the Date you have selected)
5. Monthly (On the same week and day of the Date you have selected)
6. Yearly (On the Date you have selected)
7. Custom (Allows you to repeat the meeting every X days, where X can be 1-10)
reference_context:
Document 31: summary: How to connect a calendar and schedule a meeting on the NextivaONE desktop and web application.
text: **Date, Time and Recurrence**  
1. As with all Calendar events, you must select a Date, Time, and Recurrence for the meeting.
2. Recurrence options are
1. One-time meeting
2. Daily
3. Every weekday (Monday to Friday)
4. Weekly (Once a week on the day of the Dateyou have selected)
5. Monthly (On the same week and day of the Date you have selected)
6. Yearly (On the Date you have selected)
7. Custom (Allows you to repeat the meeting every X days, where X can be 1-10)  
![SelectRecurrence.PNG](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000086eVZ)  
**Editing Recurring Meetings**  
1. Recurring meetings can be edited in N1 by selecting one of the future occurrences, then clicking **Edit.**  
![SelectFutureRecurrence.PNG](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000086eVy)
2. You can edit the event with the following options
1. This event
2. This and all following events
3. All events in the series  
![EditOptionsFutureRecurrence.PNG](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000086eWD)  
**Participants**  
1. Search for teammates, or enter the email address of people who will be invited to attend this meeting.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002VWPj)  
---  
**Invitations**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002VWQc)  
1. Clicking on the**Invite participants to join you in Nextiva Meetings**will cause an event to appear on the calendar of invited participants.
2. Click the arrow to the right of this option to expand and show meeting information. It will also provide the join link, meeting ID, and dial-in information for the meeting.  
---  
**Location and Details**  
* If using the calendar feature to schedule meetings outside of NextivaONE, the**Location**field allows you to enter the location where the meeting will take place.
* The**Details**field allows you to provide any additional details about the meeting.  
---  
**Advanced Options**  
The more information section allows you to adjust additional meeting options.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000009OXfG)  
**General**  
* **Allow start before host joins**- This option allows members to start and enter the meeting before a host joins the meeting.
* **Record meeting automatically**- This option will cause the entire meeting to be recorded.
* **Add Co-Hosts**- This will allow you to assign co-hosts for the meeting before the meeting starts.  
**Guest Requirements**  
* **Allow only host/co-host to accept guests**- Only the host or co-host can admit guests to the meeting
* **Allow all teammates to accept guests**- Any teammate in the meeting can accept guests
* **Automatically accept guests**- Any guest joining will be automatically allowed to join  
---  
Dial-In
-------  
* When creating a meeting, the dial-in information is displayed by expanding the**Invite participants to join you in Nextiva Meetings**section ([see above](#Invitations)).
* Once a meeting has started, dial-in information can be found by inviting new participants to the meeting.  
1. While in a meeting click the … button on the control bar.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002VWUn)
2. Select **Invite**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000009OXh2)
3. The dial-in information will be displayed on the screen.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002VWVC)  
---  
Meeting Features
----------------  
A scheduled meeting has the same features as a video call. See[Video calling and Screen Sharing](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/NextivaONE-Video-calling-and-Screen-Sharing?r=37&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1) for more information.

Remove an Integrated External Calendar
--------------------------------------  
1. Click the**Calendar**icon on the right-hand side of the page.

2. Click the expand button at the top-right of the panel.

4. Click the red **Disconnect** button on the pop-up that appears.

5. A message appears at the bottom of the window indicating the calendar was disconnected.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002VWPF)  
---  
Schedule a Meeting
------------------  
Currently, no notification appears for scheduled meetings.  
To create a meeting:  
1. Click the**Calendar**icon on the right-hand side of the page
2. Click the**+ (Plus)** icon in the top right-hand corner of the calendar side panel.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000006fafC)
3. Enter a title.
4. Configure remaining meeting options:  
* [Date, Time and Recurrence](#Date_Time_and_Recurrence)  
+ [Editing Recurring Meetings](#Editing_Recurring_Meetings)
* [Participants](#Participants)
* [Invitations](#Invitations)
* [Location and Details](#Location_and_Details)
* [Advanced Options](#More_Information)
5. Click**Create**.

**Participants**

![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Cw&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002VWPj)

1. Clicking on the**Invite participants to join you in Nextiva Meetings**will cause an event to appear on the calendar of invited participants.
2. Click the arrow to the right of this option to expand and show meeting information. It will also provide the join link, meeting ID, and dial-in information for the meeting.  
---  
**Location and Details**  
* If using the calendar feature to schedule meetings outside of NextivaONE, the**Location**field allows you to enter the location where the meeting will take place.
* The**Details**field allows you to provide any additional details about the meeting.

**Advanced Options**  
The more information section allows you to adjust additional meeting options.

**Guest Requirements**  
* **Allow only host/co-host to accept guests**- Only the host or co-host can admit guests to the meeting
* **Allow all teammates to accept guests**- Any teammate in the meeting can accept guests
* **Automatically accept guests**- Any guest joining will be automatically allowed to join

Dial-In
-------  
* When creating a meeting, the dial-in information is displayed by expanding the**Invite participants to join you in Nextiva Meetings**section ([see above](#Invitations)).

1. While in a meeting click the … button on the control bar.

question: What does RTT stand for in the context of a Link Quality Test?
reference_answer: Round Trip Delay Time
reference_context:
Document 36: summary: How to start and read a Link Quality Test (LQT).
text: # How to start and read a Link Quality Test (LQT).

| If you do not have access to OCOM, you will need to work with an ASR/Lead for your team to start or check for updates on a Link Quality Test. |
| --- |  
The **Link Quality** section allows you to run long-term ping tests on a customer's WAN IP. Link Quality tests can be set up on a customer's WAN IP to monitor the connection to their WAN IP. This can be done if we are unable to find any packet loss or jitter when troubleshooting choppy audio.  
To view a link quality test that has been run or is running just double-click on the desired IP address.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Hl&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o966)  
**Link Quality Info**  
* **IP Address** - The WAN IP that is being monitored.
* **User** - This field should always be blank.
* **Expires In (Sec)** - The number of seconds until the expiration of the listed trace.
* **Expiry Date** - The scheduled time for the expiration of the listed trace.
* **RTT** - This stands for Round Trip Delay Time, and measures how long it takes for a packet to be sent from us to the WAN IP and then for the reply to return back to us.
* **Loss Rate (%)** - The percentage of packet loss to this IP address.
* **Last Updated** - The last time the data listed was refreshed.  
Setting Up A Trace
------------------  
1. In order to set up a trace first, your customer will have to have**ICMP Ping**enabled on their router, otherwise, it will show 100% packet loss. Before starting the trace, ping the customer's IP address from your computer, if the request times out, the customer is blocking ICMP responses in their router and we will get no data.  
**NOTE:** If a customer does not want to enable ICMP from all outside sources we have found that OCOM will ping from 208.73.147.142 or 208.73.148.20. *This is subject to change without notice*, it is recommended to allow ICMP from all Nextiva IP addresses.
2. Choose**Add**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Hl&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o97n)
3. Enter the WAN IP address that will be traced into the**IP Address To Ping**field.
4. Set the**Expire Interval**, for 2 weeks.  
**NOTE:** Time can always be added to a test if it needs to run longer. Once the test has ended, the test will no longer be visible.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5Hl&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001o98M)
5. Click**OK.**

Got it! Let's dive into that context.

RTT typically stands for Round-Trip Time.

text: # Headset brands that are compatible with the NextivaONE application.

question: What happens when an account is disabled?
reference_answer: If an account is disabled, it will have a red warning above the subscription renewal date and the disabled reason will be listed in the upper right-hand side of the account info panel. Once the account is disabled, the customer will get an out-of-service error message when people try to call them.
reference_context:
Document 48: summary: Common reasons why an account is disabled or deactivated.  It has the steps that need to be taken to reactivate the account for the following issues: E911 Verification, Non-payment, credit limit exceeded.
text: 1. Check the customer's current credit usage by selecting**Phone Call Credits**from the ACE dropdown.
2. Review which categories of usage make up the customer's usage for the current period. If the**Overage Usage**has charges, you can review the number of minutes used/allowed by navigating back to the main ACE dropdown and selecting**VOIP Bucket Maintenance**.
3. Speak with the customer and review their call history to determine whether or not the usage seems valid or fraudulent. Use the following questions to help:
1. Compared to the last period, is the current usage significantly higher? If yes, did the customer make changes in their activities/call flow that would explain that increase?
2. When looking at the call history, are there periods where an extraordinary amount of calls are made in a short time?
4. If the usage seems fraudulent reach out to a lead and start creating a [case for ASR](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Job-Aid-Advanced-Troubleshooting-ATS-Escalation)to investigate the possible fraud.
* **If the customer needs the account to be enabled while ATS investigates the fraud, you may reset the SIP credentials for the potentially compromised user and work with a lead or supervisor to get the account enabled.**
5. If the usage seems legitimate, the customer should pay the outstanding credit balance through the admin portal, or through the [ad hoc payment tool in salesforce](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Ad-hoc-and-Credit-Payments?r=45&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1) (Note that in NextOS Platform accounts ALL credit usage shows in the**Usage Overage**category). After paying the outstanding credit limit, if the account did not re-enable automatically, please reach out to a lead or supervisor to assist with re-enabling.
* **If the customer does not want to pay their credit balance and requests an increase to their monthly credit limit, reach out to the account manager. If the account is not managed, reach out to a lead.**  
---

Document 47: summary: Common reasons why an account is disabled or deactivated.  It has the steps that need to be taken to reactivate the account for the following issues: E911 Verification, Non-payment, credit limit exceeded.
text: 1. On the account page in Salesforce, confirm the customer is past due in the billing information section. In that section, you can see if the account is past due and the amount they are behind.
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A56T&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000007LQ9x)
2. Advise the customer that they will need to **[pay their past due bill](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Ad-hoc-and-Credit-Payments)**, if they need to update their credit card to do so, follow the[Customer Payment - Payment Method Update](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Payment-Method-Update?r=45&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1)guide to help them update their credit card.
3. After paying the bill, if the account did not re-enable automatically, please reach out to a lead or supervisor to assist with re-enabling.  
---

Document 46: summary: Common reasons why an account is disabled or deactivated.  It has the steps that need to be taken to reactivate the account for the following issues: E911 Verification, Non-payment, credit limit exceeded.
text: All Nextiva customer accounts must have their e911 address verified in order to be activated (or re-activated following a cancellation).
A customer's e911 is the address they have on file for their account that emergency calls will see when called from that account. When a customer calls 911, emergency services will see the address you have set here to respond to, so it’s very important to make sure it’s accurate and updated when needed. This can be different from the billing address on file, and if the customer has multiple sites you will need to make sure the e911 address is set up correctly for each site.  
If you're in a chat with a Customer and they are requesting assistance activating, or re-activating, their account you will need to first verify the Customer's e911 address.  
To verify the customer's e911 address:  
1. Go to <https://tools.usps.com/zip-code-lookup.htm?byaddress>
2. Verify the address using this tool
3. Go into NextOS Voice to the location and verify this information is entered correctly there. Directions for this step can be found [here](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Update-E911-Address).
4. Enter the Account & Address in your team chat.
5. A tech lead or supervisor will reactivate the account
6. Refresh ACE to confirm the account is no longer disabled.
7. Have the customer test to ensure they can log in.
8. Advise this has been completed in the same questions chat  
---

Document 45: summary: Common reasons why an account is disabled or deactivated.  It has the steps that need to be taken to reactivate the account for the following issues: E911 Verification, Non-payment, credit limit exceeded.
text: # Common reasons why an account is disabled or deactivated.  It has the steps that need to be taken to reactivate the account for the following issues: E911 Verification, Non-payment, credit limit exceeded.

We disable accounts for multiple reasons but most commonly:  
1. A new customer's E911 address could not be automatically verified.
2. The account is**7 days overdue**on their bill.
3. The account has exceeded its**credit limit**due to Toll-Free, International, or Bucketed Minute Calls.  
If an account is disabled, it will have a red warning above the subscription renewal date and the disabled reason will be listed in the upper right-hand side of the account info panel. Once the account is disabled, the customer will get an out-of-service error message when people try to call them.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A56T&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000009kLq6)  
---  
Enabling Deactivated Accounts
-----------------------------  
The steps to re-enable an account depend on the reason the account is disabled.  
* [E911 Verification](#E911)
* [Non-Payment](#Non-payment)
* [Credit Limit Exceeded](#Credit_Limit)
* [Failed Credit Risk Check (Max Risk)](#Failed_Credit_Risk_Check)
* [Fraud Suspicion](#Fraud_Suspicion)

question: How do you pick up a call ringing on another extension using directed call pickup?
reference_answer:
1. As a call is coming in on another extension, pick up your phone and dial *97 and press Send.
2. The phone will convey a stutter dial tone prompting you to enter the extension of the user who you would like to pick up the call for.
3. Enter the extension of the user and wait for a moment.
4. The call is picked up on your line, you can talk to the caller.
reference_context:
Document 44: summary: Define and describe how to use directed call pickup to answer a call ringing on a different line.
text: # Define and describe how to use directed call pickup to answer a call ringing on a different line.

| Directed Call Pickup allows a user to pick up a phone call that is coming in on another user’s extension if it has not been answered. There is no additional setup required and is a useful feature if a user needs to pick up a phone call coming into an extension without leaving their own workstation. | |
| --- | --- |  
How To Use
----------  
1. As a call is coming in on another extension, pick up your phone and dial \*97 and press Send.
2. The phone will convey a stutter dial tone prompting you to enter the extension of the user who you would like to pick up the call for.
3. Enter the extension of the user and wait for a moment.
4. The call is picked up on your line, you can talk to the caller.

Document 42: summary: How to use Directed Call Pickup with Barge-In and what restrictions there are with this feature.
text: # How to use Directed Call Pickup with Barge-In and what restrictions there are with this feature.

While[Directed Call Pickup](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Directed-Call-Pickup)allows a user to pick up a call coming into another user's extension if it has not been answered, Directed Call Pickup with Barge-In allows a user to pickup a call or join an active call by "barging in" on the phone call.  
If a call has not been answered, this feature works the same as Directed Call Pickup. If the call is active on the other user, a barge-in occurs, resulting in a three-way call between the caller, the user who answered, and the user who barged in.  
Directed Call Pickup with Barge-in is different than Silent Monitoring, in that the microphone of the user barging in is not muted. To mimic Silent monitoring, users can Barge-in and then immediately mute themselves.  
By default, all users are exempt from being barged in on and a warning tone is played to let the user and caller know that another person has joined the call through barge in. Nextiva Support can modify these settings if desired. Barge-in cannot be utilized on someone who has previously initiated a conference call, and a busy signal will let you know this.  
This feature is not available with Meet-Me Conferencing or with N-Way Calling.  
Using Directed Call Pickup with Barge-In
----------------------------------------  
1. While another user's line is ringing or their line is in use dial \*33.
2. You will hear a stutter tone, then a dial tone.
3. Enter the extension of the user to pick up or barge-in on.
4. You will either pick up the ringing line, or barge-in on the active call.

question: What is the first step to verify that In-Call Service Activation is set up?
reference_answer: Launch CP from ACE.
reference_context:
Document 41: summary: This article describes In-Call Service activation and how to ensure its configured.
text: # This article describes In-Call Service activation and how to ensure its configured.

In-Call Service Activation allows users to transfer and conference calls while using Nextiva Anywhere on a personal phone. This does require Nextiva Anywhere to be configured.  
For steps on how to use this feature see[Using In-Call Service Activation with Nextiva Anywhere](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Using-In-Call-Service-Activation-with-Nextiva-Anywhere?r=45&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1)  
Verify Services Are Setup
-------------------------  
Within the Nextiva Anywhere profile for the user, confirmUse BroadWorks-based Call Control Services is enabled. This can be done in CP for both Platform and 3.0 accounts.  
1. Launch CP from ACE.
2. Navigate to the user level.
3. Click**Call Control**on the left-hand side of the page.
4. Click**Nextiva Anywhere**under the Advanced column.
5. Click on the Phone number configured
6. Ensure**Use BroadWorks-based Call Control Services** is checked.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5EX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mJoJ)
7. Click **OK**.
8. Click**In-Call Service Activation**under the Basic column
9. Verify it is set to **ON.**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A5EX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mJpW)
10. Click **Apply**.

question: What does it mean when the VoIP light is off on the Nextiva X-650 DECT base?
reference_answer: This indicates that one or more accounts on the device are NOT registered.
reference_context:
Document 43: summary: Define what the status lights mean on the Nextiva X-650 DECT base.
text: # Define what the status lights mean on the Nextiva X-650 DECT base.

There are two status lights present on the Nextiva X-650 cordless phone. The top light is the power indicator and the bottom light is the VoIP status indicator.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A59h&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WPkP)  
| Light | State | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Power | Solid | This indicates the device is turned on and has an IP address. |
| Power | Flashing | This indicates the device is searching for an IP address. If this continues:   * Very the cable is plugged in * Move the base to a different port on the network * Swap out the ethernet cable |
| Power | Off | The device has no power. |
| Power and VoIP | Flashing | The device is registering or deregistering a handset |
| VoIP | Solid | Thisindicates that all SIP accounts on the device are registered. |
| VoIP | Off | This indicates that one or more accounts on the device are NOT registered. |

Document 48: summary: Common reasons why an account is disabled or deactivated.  It has the steps that need to be taken to reactivate the account for the following issues: E911 Verification, Non-payment, credit limit exceeded.
text: 1. Check the customer's current credit usage by selecting**Phone Call Credits**from the ACE dropdown.
2. Review which categories of usage make up the customer's usage for the current period. If the**Overage Usage**has charges, you can review the number of minutes used/allowed by navigating back to the main ACE dropdown and selecting**VOIP Bucket Maintenance**.
3. Speak with the customer and review their call history to determine whether or not the usage seems valid or fraudulent. Use the following questions to help:
1. Compared to the last period, is the current usage significantly higher? If yes, did the customer make changes in their activities/call flow that would explain that increase?
2. When looking at the call history, are there periods where an extraordinary amount of calls are made in a short time?
4. If the usage seems fraudulent reach out to a lead and start creating a [case for ASR](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Job-Aid-Advanced-Troubleshooting-ATS-Escalation)to investigate the possible fraud.
* **If the customer needs the account to be enabled while ATS investigates the fraud, you may reset the SIP credentials for the potentially compromised user and work with a lead or supervisor to get the account enabled.**
5. If the usage seems legitimate, the customer should pay the outstanding credit balance through the admin portal, or through the [ad hoc payment tool in salesforce](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Ad-hoc-and-Credit-Payments?r=45&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1) (Note that in NextOS Platform accounts ALL credit usage shows in the**Usage Overage**category). After paying the outstanding credit limit, if the account did not re-enable automatically, please reach out to a lead or supervisor to assist with re-enabling.
* **If the customer does not want to pay their credit balance and requests an increase to their monthly credit limit, reach out to the account manager. If the account is not managed, reach out to a lead.**  
---

Document 47: summary: Common reasons why an account is disabled or deactivated.  It has the steps that need to be taken to reactivate the account for the following issues: E911 Verification, Non-payment, credit limit exceeded.
text: 1. On the account page in Salesforce, confirm the customer is past due in the billing information section. In that section, you can see if the account is past due and the amount they are behind.
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A56T&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000007LQ9x)
2. Advise the customer that they will need to **[pay their past due bill](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Ad-hoc-and-Credit-Payments)**, if they need to update their credit card to do so, follow the[Customer Payment - Payment Method Update](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Payment-Method-Update?r=45&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1)guide to help them update their credit card.
3. After paying the bill, if the account did not re-enable automatically, please reach out to a lead or supervisor to assist with re-enabling.  
---

Document 46: summary: Common reasons why an account is disabled or deactivated.  It has the steps that need to be taken to reactivate the account for the following issues: E911 Verification, Non-payment, credit limit exceeded.
text: All Nextiva customer accounts must have their e911 address verified in order to be activated (or re-activated following a cancellation).
A customer's e911 is the address they have on file for their account that emergency calls will see when called from that account. When a customer calls 911, emergency services will see the address you have set here to respond to, so it’s very important to make sure it’s accurate and updated when needed. This can be different from the billing address on file, and if the customer has multiple sites you will need to make sure the e911 address is set up correctly for each site.  
If you're in a chat with a Customer and they are requesting assistance activating, or re-activating, their account you will need to first verify the Customer's e911 address.  
To verify the customer's e911 address:  
1. Go to <https://tools.usps.com/zip-code-lookup.htm?byaddress>
2. Verify the address using this tool
3. Go into NextOS Voice to the location and verify this information is entered correctly there. Directions for this step can be found [here](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Update-E911-Address).
4. Enter the Account & Address in your team chat.
5. A tech lead or supervisor will reactivate the account
6. Refresh ACE to confirm the account is no longer disabled.
7. Have the customer test to ensure they can log in.
8. Advise this has been completed in the same questions chat  
---
