question: What options are available for searching for invoices when processing a payment for a specific invoice?
reference_answer: Enter either the company name (as shown in ACE), account number, or invoice number to search for the invoices.
reference_context:
Document 122: summary: How to take payments over the phone
text: # How to take payments over the phone

Ad-hoc Payments
---------------  
These are payments either against [credit use](#Credit) or against a [specific invoice](#Invoice). These payments will charge the active card on file. If the customer wants to use a different card, you can use these steps to update the active card: [Customer Payment - Payment Method Update](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Payment-Method-Update).  
Customer payments are now accessed through salesforce using the customer payment tool.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004L8J6)

Document 124: summary: How to take payments over the phone
text: 1. Click the Magnifying Glas next to Account #/Bill Site #.
2. Choose the**Payment for Credit Usage**option.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JE2h)
3. Enter the **company name** (as shown in ACE) or**account number** to search for the account  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JQtj)
4. Click the**Search**button.
5. Check the box next to the billing site to process the payment and click**Select**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JQuS)
6. Enter the amount the customer wants to pay.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JE4i)
7. If the account is deactivated due to exceeding the credit limit, choose**Yes** in the **Enable Account** drop-down menu.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JE5H)
8. Click**Submit**to process the payment.
9. The payment will be processed using the current active card, and, if successful, a receipt number will appear on the screen. If the payment is NOT successful, you can track the reason in Oracle [click here](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Declined-Transactions) for instructions.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JE65)

Document 123: summary: How to take payments over the phone
text: If a customer wants to pay a specific invoice follow these instructions. We can process multiple invoices at a time.  
1. Click the Magnifying Glass next to Account #/Bill Site #.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JEbh)
2. Choose the**Payment for Invoice**option.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDzO)
3. Enter either the **company name** (as shown in ACE), **account number**, or **invoice number** to search for the invoices.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDzn)
4. Click the**Search**button.
5. Check the box next to the invoice(s)the customer wants to pay and click**Select**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JE02)
6. If the account is deactivated due to a missing payment, and the payment the customer is making will bring the account current, choose the option to enable the account from the drop-down menu.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JE0v)
7. Click**Submit**.
8. The payment will process using the current active card, and, if successful, a receipt number will appear on the screen. If the payment is NOT successful, you can track the reason in Oracle [click here](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Declined-Transactions) for instructions.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JE1y)  
---

question: How can I make a payment through the administrator portal?
reference_answer: 1. Log in to the NextOS portal as a billing administrator. 2. From the main page, click Billing on the left-hand side. 3. Click Make a Payment. 4. Choose the amount to pay and the card to charge. 5. Click Pay Now.
reference_context:
Document 125: summary: How to make a payment through the administrator portal.
text: # How to make a payment through the administrator portal.

| Nextiva will automatically charge the credit card on file at the beginning of each billing cycle; however, if you wish to pay early or pay against credit usage, this can be done through the portal. | |
| --- | --- |
| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| [NP3 Admin Dashboard](#NP3) | [Platform Main Page](#Platform) |  
---  
Make a Payment
--------------  
1. Log in to the NextOS portal as a billing administrator.
2. From the main page, click**Billing**on the left-hand side.
3. Click**Make a Payment**.
4. Choose the amount to pay and the card to charge.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4IT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mRKW)
5. Click**Pay Now**.  
---

1. Log in to the NextOS portal as an administrator with billing access.
2. Hover over your name in the upper right-hand corner and click on**My Account**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4IT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mQ8Z)

![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4IT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mQC2)
6. To pay against credit use, either select**Pay off entire credit balance**, or choose an amount from the drop-down menu.

![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JE02)
6. If the account is deactivated due to a missing payment, and the payment the customer is making will bring the account current, choose the option to enable the account from the drop-down menu.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JE0v)
7. Click**Submit**.
8. The payment will process using the current active card, and, if successful, a receipt number will appear on the screen. If the payment is NOT successful, you can track the reason in Oracle [click here](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Declined-Transactions) for instructions.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JE1y)  
---

Document 122: summary: How to take payments over the phone
text: # How to take payments over the phone

Ad-hoc Payments
---------------  
These are payments either against [credit use](#Credit) or against a [specific invoice](#Invoice). These payments will charge the active card on file. If the customer wants to use a different card, you can use these steps to update the active card: [Customer Payment - Payment Method Update](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Customer-Payment-Payment-Method-Update).  
Customer payments are now accessed through salesforce using the customer payment tool.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4K5&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004L8J6)

conversation_history.content: I need to understand the handling of ad-hoc payments.
Sure, I can help with that. What specific aspect are you interested in?
How are those processed?
They are typically processed manually or through a special request.

question: How can I process a payment for a specific invoice over the phone?
reference_answer: If a customer wants to pay a specific invoice follow these instructions. We can process multiple invoices at a time. 1. Click the Magnifying Glass next to Account #/Bill Site #. 2. Choose the Payment for Invoice option. 3. Enter either the company name (as shown in ACE), account number, or invoice number to search for the invoices. 4. Click the Search button. 5. Check the box next to the invoice(s) the customer wants to pay and click Select. 6. If the account is deactivated due to a missing payment, and the payment the customer is making will bring the account current, choose the option to enable the account from the drop-down menu. 7. Click Submit. 8. The payment will process using the current active card, and, if successful, a receipt number will appear on the screen. If the payment is NOT successful, you can track the reason in Oracle for instructions.

Document 125: summary: How to make a payment through the administrator portal.
text: # How to make a payment through the administrator portal.

| Nextiva will automatically charge the credit card on file at the beginning of each billing cycle; however, if you wish to pay early or pay against credit usage, this can be done through the portal. | |
| --- | --- |
| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| [NP3 Admin Dashboard](#NP3) | [Platform Main Page](#Platform) |  
---  
Make a Payment
--------------  
1. Log in to the NextOS portal as a billing administrator.
2. From the main page, click**Billing**on the left-hand side.
3. Click**Make a Payment**.
4. Choose the amount to pay and the card to charge.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4IT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mRKW)
5. Click**Pay Now**.  
---  
Make a Payment  
1. Log in to the NextOS portal as an administrator with billing access.
2. Hover over your name in the upper right-hand corner and click on**My Account**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4IT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mQ8Z)
3. Click the**Billing**link on the left-hand side of the screen.
4. Scroll down and click the**Pay**button on the right-hand side of the screen.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4IT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mQ9N)
5. To pay the full monthly bill click the**Continue**button under the **Subscription fee payment**section on the top of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4IT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mQC2)
6. To pay against credit use, either select**Pay off entire credit balance**, or choose an amount from the drop-down menu.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4IT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mQCg)

question: What are the system requirements for the legacy version of the Nextiva App on Windows?
reference_answer: Windows 8/8.1, or Windows 10 (Classical view only). Additionally, 215 MB Storage Space is required. For voice calls, a sound card, speakers, and a microphone or a headset are required. For video calls, a webcam is required.
reference_context:
Document 121: summary: System requirements for the legacy version of the Nextiva App and links to download the last released version.
text: * Apple iOS 12.0 and newer.
* Android 5.0 and newer.  
#### Mobile Application Installers  
The app can be installed from either the [Apple App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/nextiva-app/id738802901?mt=8) for iOS devices or the [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.nextiva.nextivaapp.android&hl=en)for Android devices.

Document 120: summary: System requirements for the legacy version of the Nextiva App and links to download the last released version.
text: * Mac OS
+ Mac Operating system: Mac OS 10.12 Sierra, Mac OS 10.13 High Sierra, Mac OS 10.14 Mojave, Mac OS 10.15 Catalina, Mac OS 11.0 Big Sur, Mac M1 chip (arm)
+ 125 MB Storage Space
* Windows 8/8.1, or Windows 10 (Classical view only).
+ 215 MB Storage Space
* For voice calls, a sound card, speakers, and a microphone or a headset are required.
* For video calls, a webcam is required.  
**NOTE: VDI (Virtual Desktop Interfaces) environments are not supported.**  
####  
#### Desktop Application Installers  
[Windows](https://dm.nextiva.com/dms/bc/pc/Nextiva_App.bc-uc.win-22.9.33.39.msi)
[MacOS](https://dm.nextiva.com/dms/bc/pc/Nextiva_App.bc-uc.osx-22.9.33.46.dmg)
[Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.nextiva.nextivaapp.android&hl=en)
[APK for Android](https://nextiva.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/MOBILE/pages/1981775934/Android+APK+Nextiva+App+Releases)
[iPhone](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/nextiva-app/id738802901?mt=8)  
---

question: What are the steps to process a payment for credit usage over the phone?
reference_answer:
1. Click the Magnifying Glass next to Account #/Bill Site #.
2. Choose the Payment for Credit Usage option.
3. Enter the company name (as shown in ACE) or account number to search for the account
4. Click the Search button.
5. Check the box next to the billing site to process the payment and click Select.
6. Enter the amount the customer wants to pay.
7. If the account is deactivated due to exceeding the credit limit, choose Yes in the Enable Account drop-down menu.
8. Click Submit to process the payment.

question: What is the default password for resetting a Poly Trio conference phone to factory settings?
reference_context:
Document 129: summary: Steps to factory reset a Poly Trio conference phone.
text: 1. Press and hold**1, 4, 7**for about 5 seconds to obtain the IP address.
2. On a computer on the same network as the phone, open a web browser.The phone has to be on the same local network as the computer for this to work.
3. Navigate to https://[*device IP address*] (i.e.[https://10.1.10.127](https://10.1.10.127/)).  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ovyu)
4. When prompted enter the password, by default, this is**456**.
5. Hover over**Utilities**and select**Phone Backup & Restore**.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005l9eT)
6. Click on**Global Settings**to expand the section.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005lADx)
7. Click the**Restore**button.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005l6FC)
8. On the confirmation window that appears click**Yes**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002W3zI)
9. Reprovision the phone using the steps foundin [Poly IP Series - Provisioning and Configuring](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Poly-IP-Series-Provisioning-and-Configuring)

Document 127: summary: Steps to factory reset a Poly Trio conference phone.
text: If the device does not fully start up, see the[boot menu](https://nextiva2021.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Knowledge__kav/ka0UV0000002gb3YAA/view?ws=%2Flightning%2Fr%2Fafl__afl_Article_Feedback__c%2Fa5YUV0000001tFN2AY%2Fview#Boot_menu)instructions.  
1. Press the**Home**button.
2. Navigate to**Settings**.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005kzGx)
3. Navigate to**Advanced Settings**.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005l74o)
4. Enter the admin password. By default, it is 456 or set by the user.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005l2Ba)
5. Select**Administration Settings**.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005kwpM)
6. Select**Reset to Defaults**.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005lDTZ)
7. Select**Reset to Factory**.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005l8Aa)
8. Press the**Yes**softkey.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Gr&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000005lDYP)
9. Reprovision the phone using the steps found in [Poly IP Series - Provisioning and Configuring](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Poly-IP-Series-Provisioning-and-Configuring)  
---

Document 126: summary: Steps to factory reset a Poly Trio conference phone.
text: # Steps to factory reset a Poly Trio conference phone.

Steps to Factory Reset
----------------------  
A device can be factory reset either from the[physical device](https://nextiva2021.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Knowledge__kav/ka0UV0000002gb3YAA/view?ws=%2Flightning%2Fr%2Fafl__afl_Article_Feedback__c%2Fa5YUV0000001tFN2AY%2Fview#Device_FR)or from the[web interface](https://nextiva2021.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Knowledge__kav/ka0UV0000002gb3YAA/view?ws=%2Flightning%2Fr%2Fafl__afl_Article_Feedback__c%2Fa5YUV0000001tFN2AY%2Fview#WebUI_FR).

Document 128: summary: Steps to factory reset a Poly Trio conference phone.
text: 1. Unplug the phone and plug it back in to restart it.
2. After the light for the mute and speaker buttons goes off, immediately hold down the**1**,**3**, and**5**buttons until the screen displays**Enter Password to Reset Settings**.
3. Enter the admin password.
* **Default Password:**456 (or set by the user on the first boot)
* **NOTE:**If you donot know the password, you can also enter the MAC address of the device (with lowercase letters).
* Use the softkey that shows 1->Aa to change between numbers, uppercase letters, and lowercase letters. Whatever is shown to the left of the arrow is the type of character entered into the phone (i.e. a->1A will cause lowercase letters to be entered).
4. Press the**OK**softkey.
5. If the password is correct, the phone will reboot and restore the factory default settings.  
---

question: How do you enable pairing mode on the Voyager 5200?
reference_answer: On the Voyager 5200, hold the multi-function button down for 4 seconds to enable pairing mode.
reference_context:
Document 139: summary: How to configure the Voyager 5200 with compatible phones.
text: | Before taking calls with a headset: *While the phone is idle, press the Headset button and it will light up Green to show you are now in headset mode. If the phone is not in headset mode, then call control through the headset will be limited.* |
| --- |  
#### USB  
With a Bluetooth connection the volume up and down keys only control the volume in the headset and do not control the phone settings.  
1. Connect a [Pre-Paired *Poly* Bluetooth Dongle](#Pair_Dongle_With_Headset) to USB on Snom phone.
2. The phone should display a message that it detected an accessory plugged into it.  
---

Document 138: summary: How to configure the Voyager 5200 with compatible phones.
text: | Before taking calls with a headset: *While the phone is idle, press the Headset button and it will light up Green to show you are now in headset mode. If the phone is not in headset mode, then call control through the headset will be limited.* |
| --- |  
#### Bluetooth  
With a Bluetooth connection the volume up and down keys only control the volume in the headset and do not control the phone settings.  
1. Press the Settings Key⚙️
2. Select**Preferences**.
3. Select**Audio**.
4. Select **Bluetooth.**
5. Press the**Search**softkey.
6. Select the headset from the results and press the**Pair**softkey.
7. Once paired the device should appear under paired devices.  
---

Document 136: summary: How to configure the Voyager 5200 with compatible phones.
text: #### Bluetooth  
1. Open the device menu by tapping the 3 lines in the upper left-hand side of the screen
2. Tap the**Bluetooth**option.
3. Tap the**Bluetooth Radio**option and confirm it is set to**on**.
4. Press the back arrow towards the bottom of the screen
5. Tap**Manage BT Devices**.
6. Tap**Pair new device**.
7. On the Voyager 5200, hold the multi-function button down for 4 seconds to enable pairing mode.
8. On the CCX 500 select**Poly Voyager 5200**.
9. The headset should now be paired.  
---

Before trying to configure a headset, check[Nextiva Headset and Device Compatibility](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Nextiva-Headset-and-Device-Compatibility) to confirm the headset will work with the device you are using.

Document 133: summary: How to configure the Voyager 5200 with compatible phones.
text: The BT700 that comes with the headset should already be paired to the Voyager Focus 2; however, if a separate dongle is purchased it will need to be paired to the headset. To pair the BT700 with the Voyager 5200 you will need a computer.  
1. On the computer, download and install the [Poly Lens App](https://www.poly.com/us/en/products/services/cloud/poly-lens/app)
2. Plug in the BT700 Bluetooth dongle to a USB port on the computer.
3. Open the Poly Lens App.
4. Click on the BT700 dongle.
5. Update the dongle if there is an available update.
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4C1&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000009P1T0)
6. Click**Pair New Device**.
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4C1&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000009P1SN)
7. To indicate pairing mode, the dongle will flash red and blue.
8. On the Voyager 5200 hold down the multi-function button for 4 seconds to start paring.
9. The dongle and headset will connect.  
---

question: What are the steps to delete an auto attendant or call group?
reference_answer: 1. Log in to the voice portal as an administrator. 2. Hover over Advanced Routing at the top of the page. 3. Click on either Call Group or Auto Attendant. 4. Select the location the service instance is built on. 5. Click the trash can icon next to the user or service instance. 6. In the pop-up window that appears, confirm you wish to delete the auto attendant or hunt group.
reference_context:
Document 130: summary: How to delete an auto attendant or call group
text: # How to delete an auto attendant or call group

| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| --- | --- |
| [image.png](#NP3) | [Platform Home Image](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Call-Flows) |  
---  
Delete an Auto Attendant or Call Group
--------------------------------------  
1. Log in to the voice portal as an administrator.
2. Hover over **Advanced Routing**at the top of the page.
3. Click on either**Call Group**or**Auto Attendant**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4FF&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nd9D)
4. Select the location the service instance is built on.
5. Click the **trash can**icon next to the user or service instance.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4FF&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ndA1)
6. In the pop-up window that appears, confirm you wish to delete the auto attendant or hunt group.

question: Which Poly Edge series devices support WiFi?
reference_answer: Edge E350, Edge E450, Edge E550
reference_context:
Document 131: summary: Setup WiFi on the Poly Edge series devices.
text: # Setup WiFi on the Poly Edge series devices.

The following Edge series devices support WiFi:  
* Edge E350
* Edge E450
* Edge E550  
WiFi Setup
----------  
WiFi setup should be done without an ethernet cable plugged in. If you wish to use the phone on WiFi, a power supply unit should be used instead of ethernet.  
1. Open the settings menu by pressing the button that looks like a house on the phone.
2. Scroll down and select WiFi.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Dd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AAseO)
3. To enable WiFi, press the **right** direction button, followed by the **Save**softkey to enable WiFi.*If WiFi is already enabled, skip to step 6*.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Dd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AAsjn)
4. Select**Reboot**to finish enabling WiFi.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Dd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AAskM)
5. Return to the WiFi menu by pressing the Home button and selecting WiFi from the settings menu.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Dd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AAseO)
6. Press the**Scan**softkey to look for available networks.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Dd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AAsrh)
7. Highlight the network to connect to and press the**Connect**softkey.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Dd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AAssB)
8. Set the**Security**to the correct option if it isn't already configured.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Dd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AAssG)
9. In the**Passphrase** field type the code to access the network. Use the**Encoding** softkey to change between character types (uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers).  
To enter special characters, set encoding to be either uppercase or lowercase letters and use the 1, #, \*, or 0 keys.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4Dd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AAssp)
10. Press the**Connect**softkey.

question: How do you enable pairing mode on the Voyager 5200?
reference_answer: On the Voyager 5200, hold the multi-function button down for 4 seconds to enable pairing mode.
reference_context:
Document 138: summary: How to configure the Voyager 5200 with compatible phones.
text: | Before taking calls with a headset: *While the phone is idle, press the Headset button and it will light up Green to show you are now in headset mode. If the phone is not in headset mode, then call control through the headset will be limited.* |
| --- |  
#### Bluetooth  
With a Bluetooth connection the volume up and down keys only control the volume in the headset and do not control the phone settings.  
1. Press the Settings Key⚙️
2. Select**Preferences**.
3. Select**Audio**.
4. Select **Bluetooth.**
5. Press the**Search**softkey.
6. Select the headset from the results and press the**Pair**softkey.
7. Once paired the device should appear under paired devices.  
---

Document 139: summary: How to configure the Voyager 5200 with compatible phones.
text: | Before taking calls with a headset: *While the phone is idle, press the Headset button and it will light up Green to show you are now in headset mode. If the phone is not in headset mode, then call control through the headset will be limited.* |
| --- |  
#### USB  
With a Bluetooth connection the volume up and down keys only control the volume in the headset and do not control the phone settings.  
1. Connect a [Pre-Paired *Poly* Bluetooth Dongle](#Pair_Dongle_With_Headset) to USB on Snom phone.
2. The phone should display a message that it detected an accessory plugged into it.  
---

Document 136: summary: How to configure the Voyager 5200 with compatible phones.
text: #### Bluetooth  
1. Open the device menu by tapping the 3 lines in the upper left-hand side of the screen
2. Tap the**Bluetooth**option.
3. Tap the**Bluetooth Radio**option and confirm it is set to**on**.
4. Press the back arrow towards the bottom of the screen
5. Tap**Manage BT Devices**.
6. Tap**Pair new device**.
7. On the Voyager 5200, hold the multi-function button down for 4 seconds to enable pairing mode.
8. On the CCX 500 select**Poly Voyager 5200**.
9. The headset should now be paired.  
---

Document 133: summary: How to configure the Voyager 5200 with compatible phones.
text: The BT700 that comes with the headset should already be paired to the Voyager Focus 2; however, if a separate dongle is purchased it will need to be paired to the headset. To pair the BT700 with the Voyager 5200 you will need a computer.  
1. On the computer, download and install the [Poly Lens App](https://www.poly.com/us/en/products/services/cloud/poly-lens/app)
2. Plug in the BT700 Bluetooth dongle to a USB port on the computer.
3. Open the Poly Lens App.
4. Click on the BT700 dongle.
5. Update the dongle if there is an available update.
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4C1&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000009P1T0)
6. Click**Pair New Device**.
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4C1&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000009P1SN)
7. To indicate pairing mode, the dongle will flash red and blue.
8. On the Voyager 5200 hold down the multi-function button for 4 seconds to start paring.
9. The dongle and headset will connect.  
---

reference_answer: The T46U requires the Yealink BT41 Bluetooth dongle
reference_context:
Document 143: summary: Set up the Voyager 4310 or Voyager 4320 headset with phones that we sell.
text: #### Bluetooth  
For Bluetooth-enabled phones, see the instructions found in the article[Cisco CP Series - Connecting a Bluetooth Headset](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Cisco-CP-Series-Connecting-a-Bluetooth-Headset).  
#### USB  
With a USB connection, the MUTE button on the headset will mute the headset but NOT enable mute on the phone.  
1. Plug USB-A end of cable to back of Cisco device
2. Plug USB-C end of cable to bottom of earpiece on Poly Headset
1. You should see a pop-up message on Cisco display letting you know that it detected Accessory
3. To confirm USB connection
1. Press the**Menu**key.
2. Scroll down and select **Status**.
3. Select**Accessories**.
4. The headset should appear in the list.![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4AP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000009kGWu)

6. Select the headset from the results and press the**Pair**softkey.
7. Once paired the device should appear under paired devices.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4AP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AAfXu)  
#### USB  
With a USB connection the volume up and down keys only control the volume in the headset and do not control the phone settings.  
1. Connect the USB cable to the X-885
2. Connect the USB cable to the headset
3. The phone should display a message that it detected an accessory plugged into it.  
---

Document 145: summary: Set up the Voyager 4310 or Voyager 4320 headset with phones that we sell.
text: #### Bluetooth  
You can use a Bluetooth dongle that is already paired to the headset. Use the Poly Lens app on a computer to accomplish this. Once paired:  
1. Plug the USB-A Bluetooth dongle into the USB port on the poly device
2. Turn on the headset that was already paired with the dongle.
3. The phone should indicate it detects the headset.  
#### USB  
The volume keys do not integrate with the phone volume. This will give 2 volume levels that can be controlled independently of each other, headset volume on the phone and headset volume on the headset itself.  
1. Connect the USB-A side of the cable into the Poly device USB port
2. Connect the USB-C side of the cable into the Voyager headset
3. The phone should indicate it detects the headset.  
---

Document 149: summary: Set up the Voyager 4310 or Voyager 4320 headset with phones that we sell.
text: #### Bluetooth  
The T46U requires the Yealink BT41 Bluetooth dongle, with a Bluetooth connection, only the answer key works, the mute and hangup controls do NOT work.  
On the T54W, the mute feature mutes the headset microphone but does NOT enable mute on the phone.  
1. Press **Menu** Key
2. Select **Basic**
3. Select **Bluetooth**
4. Toggle **On** Bluetooth
5. Press **Scan** softkey
6. Enable Pairing Mode on Headset
7. Select **Poly Voyager 4310/4320** from Scan Results
8. The phone will pair to the headset and the headset will appear as a connected device.  
#### USB  
Volume control is local to the headset only and does NOT control the phone settings.  
1. Plug the USB-A end of the cable into the back of the Yealink device
2. Plug the USB-C end of the cable into thebottom of the earpiece on the Poly Headset
3. You should see a pop-up message on the Yealink display letting you know that it detected the Accessory  
---

question: What is required to use Bluetooth on the T46U with the Voyager 5200?
reference_answer: The Yealink BT41 dongle
reference_context:
Document 141: summary: How to configure the Voyager 5200 with compatible phones.
text: #### Bluetooth  
1. Press **Menu** Key
2. Select **Basic**
3. Select **Bluetooth**
4. Toggle **On** Bluetooth
5. The phone should automatically start scanning. If Bluetooth is already enabled on the phone, tap the**Scan**button at the bottom of the screen.
6. Enable pairing mode on the Voyager 5200 by holding down the multi-function button for 4 seconds.
7. Select **Poly Voyager 5200** from Scan Results
8. The headset should be paired to the phone.

Document 140: summary: How to configure the Voyager 5200 with compatible phones.
text: #### Bluetooth  
The mute key on the headset will mute the headset but not enable mute on the desk phone.  
The T46U requires theYealink BT41 dongle to use Bluetooth.  
1. Press **Menu** Key
2. Select **Basic**.
3. Select **Bluetooth**.
4. Toggle **On** Bluetooth.
5. Press **Scan** softkey
6. Enable paring mode on the Voyager 5200 by holding down the multi-function button for 4 seconds.
7. On the phone, select **Poly Voyager 5200** from Scan Results.
8. The headset should be paired with the phone.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A4C1&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AOsLD)  
#### USB  
Instead of using the Yealink BT41 dongle, the Poly BT700 can be used instead. This would be considered a USB connection instead of Bluetooth. With this connection type, the volume controls are local to the headset and do not affect the volume on the phone.  
1. Ensure the BT700 is [paired to the Voyager 5200](#Pair_Dongle_With_Headset).
2. Plug the BT700 dongle into the USB port on the phone.
3. The phone should recognize the device as a headset.  
---

text: #### Bluetooth  
You can use a Bluetooth dongle that is already paired to the headset. Use the Poly Lens app on a computer to accomplish this. Once paired:

2. Turn on the headset that was already paired with the dongle.

#### USB  
The volume keys do not integrate with the phone volume. This will give 2 volume levels that can be controlled independently of each other, headset volume on the phone and headset volume on the headset itself.

2. Connect the USB-C side of the cable into the Voyager headset

question: What are the two common scenarios that require a factory reset on the Panasonic UTG 200B and UTG 300B?
reference_answer: Provisioning a BYOD and Troubleshooting a device issue.
reference_context:
Document 167: summary: Factory reset the Panasonic UTG 200B and UTG 300B.
text: 1. Enable the WebUI
1. Press the**HOME**button on the bottom of the phone.
2. Select the**Settings**softkey at the bottom of the window.
3. Using the silver 5-way navigation pad at the bottom of the phone, scroll down to**Network Settings**and press the**ENTER**key on the navigational pad.
4. Scroll down to the**Embedded Web**option and press**ENTER**. Embedded Web should now show**ON**.
2. Obtain the IP address
1. Press the**HOME**button on the bottom of the phone.
2. Select the**Settings**softkey at the bottom of the window.
3. Scroll to**Information Display**and press**ENTER**.
4. Scroll down to find the IP address.
3. On a computer on the same network as the phone, type the IP address into a browser.
4. Enter the username and password
- **Username:**admin
- **Password:**adminpass
5. Click the**Maintenance**tab at the top of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDUQ)
6. Click**Reset & Restart** on the left-hand side of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDUa)
7. Click**Reset**below the option**Factory Reset**, the second option from the bottom.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDUp)
8. In the window that appears, click**OK**to confirm factory reset.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDSk)  
If you are unsure about when to factory reset a device please see the article[When to Factory Reset](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/When-to-Factory-Reset?r=43&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1).

Document 165: summary: Factory reset the Panasonic UTG 200B and UTG 300B.
text: There are two common scenarios that should require a factory reset:  
* Provisioning a BYOD
* Troubleshooting a **device** issue  
#### Provisioning a BYOD  
If a customer brings a phone to Nextiva that was not purchased from us, it may have settings enabled on it that could cause issues when troubleshooting. If a phone was used with a previous provider, factory resetting it before provisioning is appropriate to ensure that we are working with factory default settings and not custom settings from a previous provider.  
#### Troubleshooting a device issue  
When troubleshooting, factory resetting should only be done **after** isolating the issue to the device and all other forms of troubleshooting have been attempted. We should NEVER start by factory resetting a device.  
* Verify it is not an account issue:
+ Use 3CX or the Nextiva App as an SCA to replicate the problem on your side, if the SCA also has the problem, it's an account setting
* Verify it's not a network issue
+ Try other ports on the network
+ Attempt to set a static IP address on the phone
+ If multiple phones are affected, perform a[Network Check](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Job-Aid-Network-Check?r=43&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1)  
Factory Reset Steps
-------------------  
These devices can be factory reset either from [the device](#FR_from_Device) or [the web interface](#FR_from_WebUI).

Document 166: summary: Factory reset the Panasonic UTG 200B and UTG 300B.
text: 1. Press the**HOME**button on the silver 5-way navigational button on the phone.
2. Select**Settings**from the menu.
3. Scroll down and select**Change Level**from the menu to sign in as an administrator for the phone.
4. Enter**admin**as the User ID and**adminpass**as the Password, and then press the **Enter softkey**at the bottom of the screen or the**ENTER**key on the 5-way.
5. Scroll down and select**Reset**from the menu.
6. Select**Exclude Private Settings**from the menu.
7. Confirm you want to factory reset the phone by selecting**Yes**at the bottom of the screen. After a few seconds, the phone will automatically reboot.  
---

Document 162: summary: Factory reset a Nextiva X-885, X-835, and X-815 desk phone.
text: # Factory reset a Nextiva X-885, X-835, and X-815 desk phone.

Factory Reset Steps
-------------------  
The X-8XX series phones can only be reset from the physical device. If the device will not fully boot up, see [this section](#Boot_Looping).  
1. Press the**Settings**button.
2. Scroll down and select the**Maintenance** option.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A42L&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WXJC)
3. Select**Reset Values**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A42L&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WXJg)
4. Enter the admin password, use the**Edit Mode**softkey to change the type of character being typed in.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A42L&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WXKj)
* **Default password:**0000
* **Provisioned Password:**nextiva
5. Press the check button.
6. The device will factory reset.  
---

Document 163: summary: Factory reset a Nextiva X-885, X-835, and X-815 desk phone.
text: This method should only be used if the above method is not possible. Per the manufacturer, using the method below too many times can cause issues with the device.  
1. Unplug the device from power.
2. Power the phone on.
3. As soon as the phone has power, hold down the # key.  
**NOTE:** It takes approximately 45 seconds for the phone to pull up rescue mode.
4. Once in rescue mode, press 1 to reset settings.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A42L&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000007Lr6q)
5. The screen will go black and the buttons will light up for 3 - 5 minutes while the phone resets.
6. Go through the initial setup of the phone:
* Select the language.
* Select the time zone.
* Select the tone scheme as USA.
7. Re-provision the phone following the steps in[Nextiva X-8xx - Provisioning Instructions](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Nextiva-X-8xx-Provisioning-Instructions)

question: What are the common scenarios that require a factory reset for the Panasonic UTG 200B and UTG 300B?
reference_answer: There are two common scenarios that should require a factory reset: Provisioning a BYOD and Troubleshooting a device issue.
reference_context:
Document 166: summary: Factory reset the Panasonic UTG 200B and UTG 300B.
text: 1. Press the**HOME**button on the silver 5-way navigational button on the phone.
2. Select**Settings**from the menu.
3. Scroll down and select**Change Level**from the menu to sign in as an administrator for the phone.
4. Enter**admin**as the User ID and**adminpass**as the Password, and then press the **Enter softkey**at the bottom of the screen or the**ENTER**key on the 5-way.
5. Scroll down and select**Reset**from the menu.
6. Select**Exclude Private Settings**from the menu.
7. Confirm you want to factory reset the phone by selecting**Yes**at the bottom of the screen. After a few seconds, the phone will automatically reboot.  
---

Document 167: summary: Factory reset the Panasonic UTG 200B and UTG 300B.
text: 1. Enable the WebUI
1. Press the**HOME**button on the bottom of the phone.
2. Select the**Settings**softkey at the bottom of the window.
3. Using the silver 5-way navigation pad at the bottom of the phone, scroll down to**Network Settings**and press the**ENTER**key on the navigational pad.
4. Scroll down to the**Embedded Web**option and press**ENTER**. Embedded Web should now show**ON**.
2. Obtain the IP address
1. Press the**HOME**button on the bottom of the phone.
2. Select the**Settings**softkey at the bottom of the window.
3. Scroll to**Information Display**and press**ENTER**.
4. Scroll down to find the IP address.
3. On a computer on the same network as the phone, type the IP address into a browser.
4. Enter the username and password
- **Username:**admin
- **Password:**adminpass
5. Click the**Maintenance**tab at the top of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDUQ)
6. Click**Reset & Restart** on the left-hand side of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDUa)
7. Click**Reset**below the option**Factory Reset**, the second option from the bottom.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDUp)
8. In the window that appears, click**OK**to confirm factory reset.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDSk)

Document 165: summary: Factory reset the Panasonic UTG 200B and UTG 300B.
text: There are two common scenarios that should require a factory reset:  
* Provisioning a BYOD
* Troubleshooting a **device** issue  
#### Provisioning a BYOD  
If a customer brings a phone to Nextiva that was not purchased from us, it may have settings enabled on it that could cause issues when troubleshooting. If a phone was used with a previous provider, factory resetting it before provisioning is appropriate to ensure that we are working with factory default settings and not custom settings from a previous provider.  
#### Troubleshooting a device issue  
When troubleshooting, factory resetting should only be done **after** isolating the issue to the device and all other forms of troubleshooting have been attempted. We should NEVER start by factory resetting a device.  
* Verify it is not an account issue:
+ Use 3CX or the Nextiva App as an SCA to replicate the problem on your side, if the SCA also has the problem, it's an account setting
* Verify it's not a network issue
+ Try other ports on the network
+ Attempt to set a static IP address on the phone
+ If multiple phones are affected, perform a[Network Check](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Job-Aid-Network-Check?r=43&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1)  
Factory Reset Steps
-------------------  
These devices can be factory reset either from [the device](#FR_from_Device) or [the web interface](#FR_from_WebUI).

question: What are the steps to factory reset a Cisco SPA 112, SPA 122, or SPA 192 ATA device?
reference_answer: 1. Plug in the power adapter 2. Connect an analog phone to the Phone 1 port on the ATA. 3. From the analog phone dial **** 4. You should hear ‘Configuration Option Menu’. 5. Dial 73738#(RESET#) 6. Press 1 to confirm the reset. 7. The device will factory reset and reboot.

text: # Factory reset a Cisco SPA series phone.

----------------------  
1. Press the Menu button![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3eA&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000007LQaT) on the phone.

4. Press the **OK**softkey.

text: # Factory reset a Cisco SPA 112, SPA 122, or SPA 192 ATA device.

Factory Reset Steps
-------------------  
1. Plug in the power adapter
2. Connect an analog phone to the **Phone 1** port on the ATA.
3. From the analog phone dial**\*\*\*\***
4. You should hear ‘Configuration Option Menu’.
5. Dial**73738#**(RESET#)
6. Press 1 to confirm the reset.
7. The device will factory reset and reboot.

text: 1. Press the**HOME**button on the silver 5-way navigational button on the phone.
2. Select**Settings**from the menu.
3. Scroll down and select**Change Level**from the menu to sign in as an administrator for the phone.
4. Enter**admin**as the User ID and**adminpass**as the Password, and then press the **Enter softkey**at the bottom of the screen or the**ENTER**key on the 5-way.
5. Scroll down and select**Reset**from the menu.
6. Select**Exclude Private Settings**from the menu.
7. Confirm you want to factory reset the phone by selecting**Yes**at the bottom of the screen. After a few seconds, the phone will automatically reboot.  
---

Document 167: summary: Factory reset the Panasonic UTG 200B and UTG 300B.
text: 1. Enable the WebUI
1. Press the**HOME**button on the bottom of the phone.
2. Select the**Settings**softkey at the bottom of the window.
3. Using the silver 5-way navigation pad at the bottom of the phone, scroll down to**Network Settings**and press the**ENTER**key on the navigational pad.
4. Scroll down to the**Embedded Web**option and press**ENTER**. Embedded Web should now show**ON**.
2. Obtain the IP address
1. Press the**HOME**button on the bottom of the phone.
2. Select the**Settings**softkey at the bottom of the window.
3. Scroll to**Information Display**and press**ENTER**.
4. Scroll down to find the IP address.
3. On a computer on the same network as the phone, type the IP address into a browser.
4. Enter the username and password
- **Username:**admin
- **Password:**adminpass
5. Click the**Maintenance**tab at the top of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDUQ)
6. Click**Reset & Restart** on the left-hand side of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDUa)
7. Click**Reset**below the option**Factory Reset**, the second option from the bottom.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDUp)
8. In the window that appears, click**OK**to confirm factory reset.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A40j&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000006JDSk)  
If you are unsure about when to factory reset a device please see the article[When to Factory Reset](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/When-to-Factory-Reset?r=43&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1).

Document 165: summary: Factory reset the Panasonic UTG 200B and UTG 300B.
text: There are two common scenarios that should require a factory reset:  
* Provisioning a BYOD
* Troubleshooting a **device** issue  
#### Provisioning a BYOD  
If a customer brings a phone to Nextiva that was not purchased from us, it may have settings enabled on it that could cause issues when troubleshooting. If a phone was used with a previous provider, factory resetting it before provisioning is appropriate to ensure that we are working with factory default settings and not custom settings from a previous provider.  
#### Troubleshooting a device issue  
When troubleshooting, factory resetting should only be done **after** isolating the issue to the device and all other forms of troubleshooting have been attempted. We should NEVER start by factory resetting a device.  
* Verify it is not an account issue:
+ Use 3CX or the Nextiva App as an SCA to replicate the problem on your side, if the SCA also has the problem, it's an account setting
* Verify it's not a network issue
+ Try other ports on the network
+ Attempt to set a static IP address on the phone
+ If multiple phones are affected, perform a[Network Check](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Job-Aid-Network-Check?r=43&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1)  
Factory Reset Steps
-------------------  
These devices can be factory reset either from [the device](#FR_from_Device) or [the web interface](#FR_from_WebUI).

question: What is the default admin password for factory resetting a VVX device?
reference_context:
Document 176: summary: This article walks through when and how to factory reset the VVX 300, VVX 301, VVX 310, VVX 311, VVX 400, VVX 401, VVX 410, VVX 411, VVX 500, VVX 501, VVX 600, and VVX 601 devices.
text: 1. Unplug the phone and plug it back in to restart it.
2. When the screen says **Starting Application Press Cancel to Interrupt** press the**Cancel**softkey.
3. Hold down **1, 3, 5**during the countdown screen until the phone screen displays**Enter Password to Reset Settings**.
4. Enter the admin password.
* **Default Password:** 456
* **NOTE:**If you do not know the password, you can also enter the MAC address of the device (with lowercase letters).
* Use the softkey that shows 1->Aa to change between numbers, uppercase letters, and lowercase letters. Whatever is shown to the left of the arrow is the type of character entered into the phone (i.e. a->1A will cause lowercase letters to be entered).
5. Press the**OK**softkey.
6. If the password is correct, the phone will reboot and restore factory default settings.  
---

Document 176: summary: This article walks through when and how to factory reset the VVX 300, VVX 301, VVX 310, VVX 311, VVX 400, VVX 401, VVX 410, VVX 411, VVX 500, VVX 501, VVX 600, and VVX 601 devices.
text: 1. Unplug the phone and plug it back in to restart it.
2. When the screen says **Starting Application Press Cancel to Interrupt** press the**Cancel**softkey.
3. Hold down **1, 3, 5**during the countdown screen until the phone screen displays**Enter Password to Reset Settings**.
4. Enter the admin password.
* **Default Password:** 456
* **NOTE:**If you do not know the password, you can also enter the MAC address of the device (with lowercase letters).
* Use the softkey that shows 1->Aa to change between numbers, uppercase letters, and lowercase letters. Whatever is shown to the left of the arrow is the type of character entered into the phone (i.e. a->1A will cause lowercase letters to be entered).
5. Press the**OK**softkey.
6. If the password is correct, the phone will reboot and restore factory default settings.  
---

1. Press the**Home**button.

Document 173: summary: This article walks through how to factory reset a Poly Edge device.
text: 1. Press and hold**1, 4, 7**for about 5 seconds to obtain the IP address, MAC address and firmware version.
2. On a computer on the same network as the phone, open a web browser.The phone has to be on the same local network as the computer for this to work.
3. Navigate to https://[*device IP address*] (i.e.[https://10.1.10.127](https://10.1.10.127/)).  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3xV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ovyu)
4. When prompted enter the password, by default, this is user set.
5. Hover over**Utilities**and select**Phone Backup & Restore**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3xV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000842Oy)
6. Click on **Global Settings**to expand the section.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3xV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000842PI)
7. Click the**Restore**button.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3xV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000842Oa)
8. On the confirmation window that appears click**Yes**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3xV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002W3zI)
9. Reprovision the phone using the steps found in[Poly Edge Series - Provisioning Instructions](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Poly-Edge-Series-Provisioning-Instructions).

Document 176: summary: This article walks through when and how to factory reset the VVX 300, VVX 301, VVX 310, VVX 311, VVX 400, VVX 401, VVX 410, VVX 411, VVX 500, VVX 501, VVX 600, and VVX 601 devices.
text: 1. Unplug the phone and plug it back in to restart it.
2. When the screen says **Starting Application Press Cancel to Interrupt** press the**Cancel**softkey.
3. Hold down **1, 3, 5**during the countdown screen until the phone screen displays**Enter Password to Reset Settings**.
4. Enter the admin password.
* **Default Password:** 456
* **NOTE:**If you do not know the password, you can also enter the MAC address of the device (with lowercase letters).
* Use the softkey that shows 1->Aa to change between numbers, uppercase letters, and lowercase letters. Whatever is shown to the left of the arrow is the type of character entered into the phone (i.e. a->1A will cause lowercase letters to be entered).
5. Press the**OK**softkey.
6. If the password is correct, the phone will reboot and restore factory default settings.  
---

Document 170: summary: This article walks through how to factory reset a Poly Edge device.
text: # This article walks through how to factory reset a Poly Edge device.

Steps to Factory Reset
----------------------  
A device can be factory reset either from the [physical device](#Device_FR) or from the [web interface](#WebUI_FR).

Document 172: summary: This article walks through how to factory reset a Poly Edge device.
text: 1. Unplug the phone and plug it back in to restart it.
2. As soon as the headset and speakerphone buttons light up (also the Poly logo first appears at this point), press and hold the **1, 3, and 5** keys down.
3. Enter the admin password.
* **Default Password:** *user set*
* **NOTE:**If you do not know the password, you can also enter the MAC address of the device (with lowercase letters).
* Use the softkey that shows 1->Aa to change between numbers, uppercase letters, and lowercase letters. Whatever is shown to the left of the arrow is the type of character entered into the phone (i.e. a->1A will cause lowercase letters to be entered).
4. Press the**OK**softkey.
5. If the password is correct, the phone will reboot and restore factory default settings.  
---

text: 1. Press and hold**1, 4, 7**for about 5 seconds to obtain the IP address.
2. On a computer on the same network as the phone, open a web browser.The phone has to be on the same local network as the computer for this to work.
3. Navigate to https://[*device IP address*] (i.e.[https://10.1.10.127](https://10.1.10.127/)).  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3uH&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ovyu)
4. When prompted enter the password, by default, this is**456**.
5. Hover over**Utilities**and select**Phone Backup & Restore**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3uH&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002W3s2)
6. Click on **Global Settings**to expand the section.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3uH&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002W3yF)
7. Click the**Restore**button.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3uH&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002W3xm)
8. On the confirmation window that appears click**Yes**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3uH&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002W3zI)
9. Reprovision the phone using the steps found in[Poly VVX X50 Series - Provisioning Instructions](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Poly-VVX-X50-Provisioning-Instructions?r=43&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1).

Document 189: summary: How to factory reset a Poly soundpoint or soundstation series device.
text: The key combination to access the factory reset feature varies per model, please locate your model below for the correct keys to press on the keypad  
* For Soundpoint IP 300, 301, 500, 501, 550, 560, 600, 601, 650, 670, and 4000: 4, 6, 8 and \* dial pad keys.
* For Soundpoint IP 320, 321, 330, 331, 335, 430,450, 5000, and 7000: 1, 3, 5, and 7 dial pad keys.
* For the SoundStation IP 6000: 6, 8, and \* dial pad keys  
1. Unplug the phone and plug it back in to restart it.
2. When the screen says**Cancel**softkey.
3. Hold down '**Enter Password to Reset Settings**.
4. Enter the admin password.
* **Default Password:**456
* **NOTE:**If you do not know the password, you can also enter the MAC address of the device (with lowercase letters).
* Use the softkey that shows 1->Aa to change between numbers, uppercase letters, and lowercase letters. Whatever is shown to the left of the arrow is the type of character entered into the phone (i.e. a->1A will cause lowercase letters to be entered).
5. Press the**OK**softkey.
6. If the password is correct, the phone will reboot and restore factory default settings.
7. Reprovision the phone using the steps found in[Poly IP Series - Provisioning and Configuring](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Poly-IP-Series-Provisioning-and-Configuring).  
---

Document 184: summary: Steps to factory reset a Poly CCX series device.
text: 1. Unplug the phone and plug it back in to restart it.
2. Depending on the model do one of the following:
* **CCX 400** - Once the message waiting light turns red, press and hold all 4 corners of the screen simultaneously.
* **CCX 500 or CCX 600** - Once the Poly logo appears the second time, press and hold all 4 corners of the screen.
3. Once the mute key begins to cycle through several colors, release the screen.
4. The phone will restart and reset to factory.  
---

reference_context:

text: # Steps to factory reset a Poly CCX series device.

----------------------

Document 189: summary: How to factory reset a Poly soundpoint or soundstation series device.
text: The key combination to access the factory reset feature varies per model, please locate your model below for the correct keys to press on the keypad  
* For Soundpoint IP 300, 301, 500, 501, 550, 560, 600, 601, 650, 670, and 4000: 4, 6, 8 and \* dial pad keys.
* For Soundpoint IP 320, 321, 330, 331, 335, 430,450, 5000, and 7000: 1, 3, 5, and 7 dial pad keys.
* For the SoundStation IP 6000: 6, 8, and \* dial pad keys  
1. Unplug the phone and plug it back in to restart it.
2. When the screen says**Cancel**softkey.
3. Hold down '**Enter Password to Reset Settings**.
4. Enter the admin password.
* **Default Password:**456
* **NOTE:**If you do not know the password, you can also enter the MAC address of the device (with lowercase letters).
* Use the softkey that shows 1->Aa to change between numbers, uppercase letters, and lowercase letters. Whatever is shown to the left of the arrow is the type of character entered into the phone (i.e. a->1A will cause lowercase letters to be entered).
5. Press the**OK**softkey.
6. If the password is correct, the phone will reboot and restore factory default settings.
7. Reprovision the phone using the steps found in[Poly IP Series - Provisioning and Configuring](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Poly-IP-Series-Provisioning-and-Configuring).  
---

question: What are the default time increments for the Call Duration report?
reference_answer: The default time increments for the Call Duration report are 5-minute buckets.
reference_context:
Document 199: summary: How to read and configure the Call Duration report in Voice Analytics
text: # How to read and configure the Call Duration report in Voice Analytics

Overview
--------  
The Call Duration report is a [custom report](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Analytics-Creating-Custom-Reports?r=35&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1)that shows total, inbound, outbound, toll-free, and international calls broken down into buckets of 5-minute increments by default. This allows you to see how many of your calls were less than 5 minutes, how many were between 5 and 10 minutes, how many were between 10 and 15 minutes, how many were between 15 and 20 minutes, and how many were more than 20 minutes in duration. This is displayed as a pie chart as shown below. You can change the default buckets to [different values](#Bucket_Size).  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3av&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nurq)  
**NOTE:**These fields can change depending on the filters set (see Working with Filters below). To see the exact percentage for a given bucket, hover the cursor over the corresponding piece of the pie chart. A pop-up appears showing the exact number  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3av&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nus5)  
Change Bucket Size
------------------  
To change the bucket size, follow the instructions below.  
1. Click the**clock icon**at the top of the screen. A pop-up window appears showing the current buckets.
2. Enter the time range in the corresponding text boxes.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3av&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nusU)  
**NOTE:** It is also possible to delete a bucket by clicking the minus sign to the right of that bucket.
3. Click the green**Update**button at the top of the pop-up window.
4. After clicking**Update**, the charts update to reflect the new buckets.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3av&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nutS)

question: What should be disabled on iPhone settings to avoid issues when sending NextivaONE log files?
reference_answer: Disable Use 3rd Party Email
reference_context:
Document 208: summary: This article walks through how to send your NexitvaONE mobile application log files to support.
text: # This article walks through how to send your NexitvaONE mobile application log files to support.

When troubleshooting an issue with the mobile version of NextivaONE, the support team may need to review the log files to better understand what is causing an issue. Use these steps to send the log files to support by email:  
* [Android](#Android)
* [iPhone](#iPhone)  
Android
-------  
1. Tap your avatar in the upper-left-hand corner of the app to open the menu.
2. Tap the**Preferences** option.
3. Tap**Email Logs to Support**.
4. If necessary, choose the application to use when sending the log files.
5. Send the email.  
---  
iPhone
------  
Using a 3rd party application to send the email logs causes the logs to come in as plain text on an email, making it difficult for the support team to review the logs. The steps below will work to avoid that issue.  
1. Open the iPhone settings (not N1 settings.)
2. Locate the Nextiva App.
3. Disable**Use 3rd Party Email**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3Pd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000000SByD)
4. Open the Nextiva App.
5. Tap your avatar in the upper-left-hand corner of the app to open the menu.
6. Tap the**Preferences** option.
7. Tap**Email Logs to Support**.
8. Send the email.

question: How do you deregister a handset from a Panasonic TGP 500 and TGP 550 cordless phone system using the handset?
reference_answer:
1. Press and hold the All button until the registration tone sounds and the STATUS indicator flashes red.
2. Press and hold the handset number to deregister.
3. Once a confirmation tone sounds, release the number.
4. The handset is deregistered.
reference_context:
Document 201: summary: Register (pair) a handset to or deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 500 and TGP 550 cordless phone systems.
text: # Register (pair) a handset to or deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 500 and TGP 550 cordless phone systems.

Handset Registration
--------------------  
1. On the base unit hold the**All**button until the status light flashes red (approximately 4seconds).
2. On the handset, press and hold the**OK**softkey until the screen updates to say**Please Wait****...**(approximately 4 seconds).
3. The handset will then display**Registered**and will go to its home screen with the handset number in the upper left-hand corner of the screen.  
---  
Handset Deregistration
----------------------

Document 203: summary: Register (pair) a handset to or deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 500 and TGP 550 cordless phone systems.
text: 1. Press and hold the**All**button until the registration tone sounds and the**STATUS**indicator flashes red.
2. Press and hold the handset number to deregister.
3. Once a confirmation tone sounds, release the number.
4. The handset is deregistered.

Document 202: summary: Register (pair) a handset to or deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 500 and TGP 550 cordless phone systems.
text: 1. Press the Menu button.
2. Type #131
3. Type 335 and press**OK**.
4. Select the desired handset to deregister.
5. Select**Yes**.

question: What information is required to connect a Cisco 525 to a wireless network?
reference_answer: In order to connect to the wireless network you will need to know the SSID (network name), Security Mode (typically WPA2), Cypher Type (TKIP or AES), and password/security key for your network.
reference_context:
Document 205: summary: How to configure wireless (WiFi) settings for the Cisco 525.
text: # How to configure wireless (WiFi) settings for the Cisco 525.

From the WebUI
--------------  
In order to connect to the wireless network you will need to know the SSID (network name), Security Mode (typically WPA2), Cypher Type (TKIP or AES), and password/security key for your network. These can be found in your router settings.  
1. Plug the ethernet cord into the**SW**of the phone and the other end into their router, gateway, or switch.
2. Open the Web Application by entering the IP of the phone into a web browser.
3. Click on**Add New Wi-Fi Profile**
4. A new box will pop up requesting specific information.
5. You will need to get into their router or obtain the SSID, Security Mode (Typically will be WPA2), Cipher Type (TKIP or AES), and their shared key.  
**Note**: If their Security Mode is WEP you will need Transmit Key, Key Length, and the Key itself.
6. Enter all of the information gathered into the appropriate boxes
7. Press**Submit All Changes**
8. Click**Enable**to the right of your profile and hit**OK**.  
---  
From the Device
---------------  
In order to connect to the wireless network you will need to know the SSID (network name), Security Mode (typically WPA2), Cypher Type (TKIP or AES), and password/security key for your network. These can be found in your router settings.  
1. Disconnect the Ethernet cable from the SW port on the back of the phone.
2. Press the menu button on the phone. This is the one that looks like a piece of paper, with a folded corner.
3. Select Network Configuration on the menu that appears on the screen.
4. Make sure the**Wi-Fi**option is selected, and**press the left or right arrow key on the navigation pad on the phone to turn the Wi-Fi on**.
5. You will know when it is on because you will see a checkmark to the right of the Wi-Fi option.
6. Scroll down to the**Wi-Fi Configuration**option, and press the**right arrow key**on the navigation pad on the phone to go into the**Wi-Fi Configuration menu**.
7. Select**Wireless Profile**from the menu.
8. Press the**Scan soft key**at the bottom of the screen.
9. Scroll to**highlight your network**, then press the**Add soft key**at the bottom of the screen.
10. Make sure the**Security Mode option is highlighted**, and use the left and right arrow keys to select the security mode for your network.
11. Scroll down to the**Cipher Type option**, and use the left and right arrow keys to select the cipher type for your network.
12. Scroll down to the**Key option**. Use the keypad on your Cisco SPA525G phone to enter the**security key for your Wi-Fi network**.  
**NOTE:**Depending on the security mode and cipher type you selected previously, the field where you will enter the key for your Wi-Fi network may be labeled differently. As an example, for WPA2 Personal, with AES COMP encryption, this will say WPA Shared Key.
13. Press the**Save soft key**at the bottom of the screen.
14. Make sure the network you added is highlighted on the screen, and press the**Connect soft key at the bottom of the screen**.

question: How do you deregister a handset from the Panasonic TGP 500 and TGP 550 cordless phone systems using the Menu button?
reference_answer: 1. Press the Menu button. 2. Type #131 3. Type 335 and press OK. 4. Select the desired handset to deregister. 5. Select Yes.
reference_context:
Document 203: summary: Register (pair) a handset to or deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 500 and TGP 550 cordless phone systems.
text: 1. Press and hold the**All**button until the registration tone sounds and the**STATUS**indicator flashes red.
2. Press and hold the handset number to deregister.
3. Once a confirmation tone sounds, release the number.
4. The handset is deregistered.

Document 201: summary: Register (pair) a handset to or deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 500 and TGP 550 cordless phone systems.
text: # Register (pair) a handset to or deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 500 and TGP 550 cordless phone systems.

Handset Registration
--------------------  
1. On the base unit hold the**All**button until the status light flashes red (approximately 4seconds).
2. On the handset, press and hold the**OK**softkey until the screen updates to say**Please Wait****...**(approximately 4 seconds).
3. The handset will then display**Registered**and will go to its home screen with the handset number in the upper left-hand corner of the screen.  
---  
Handset Deregistration
----------------------

2. Type #131
3. Type 335 and press**OK**.
4. Select the desired handset to deregister.
5. Select**Yes**.

question: How can I remove a specific user from a custom report in the Nextiva Voice Analytics tool?
reference_answer: To remove a specific user from a custom report in the Nextiva Voice Analytics tool, scroll down to the list of users at the bottom of the screen, enter the name of the user you want to remove in the Search text box, and click the X to the right of the user’s name.
reference_context:
Document 209: summary: Add and remove users from custom reports in the Nextiva Voice Analytics tool.
text: # Add and remove users from custom reports in the Nextiva Voice Analytics tool.

Return to [Creating Custom Reports](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Analytics-Creating-Custom-Reports)  
Removing Users from a Report
----------------------------  
By default, all users are included in a custom report. To remove one or more users from the report, follow the instructions below.  
1. In your custom report, scroll down until the list of users at the bottom of the screen is visible.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3O1&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nvsR)
2. Enter the name of the user you want to remove in the Search text box.
3. Click the X to the right of the user’s name below the Search text box to remove them.  
**NOTE:**to remove all users from the report, click remove all at the bottom-right of the screen. You can then add users one at a time using the instructions below. This is helpful when you have a large number of users, but want to run a report on only a small group of them. After you have removed all users, you can add individual users back to the report using the instructions below.  
Return to [Creating Custom Reports](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Analytics-Creating-Custom-Reports)  
---  
Adding Users to a Report
------------------------  
1. In your custom report, scroll down until the list of users at the bottom of the screen is visible.
2. Click Users on the left side of the screen.
3. Scroll through the list of users, and click the names of the users you want to add to the report.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3O1&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nvzb)  
**NOTE:**if the list of users on your account is long, you can enter the user’s name in the Search filters text box then click their name in the list below to add them to the report.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3O1&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001nvzl)
4. Save or run the report.  
Return to [Creating Custom Reports](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Analytics-Creating-Custom-Reports)

question: What should be disabled on iPhone settings to avoid sending logs as plain text?
reference_answer: Disable Use 3rd Party Email
reference_context:
Document 208: summary: This article walks through how to send your NexitvaONE mobile application log files to support.
text: # This article walks through how to send your NexitvaONE mobile application log files to support.

When troubleshooting an issue with the mobile version of NextivaONE, the support team may need to review the log files to better understand what is causing an issue. Use these steps to send the log files to support by email:  
* [Android](#Android)
* [iPhone](#iPhone)  
Android
-------  
1. Tap your avatar in the upper-left-hand corner of the app to open the menu.
2. Tap the**Preferences** option.
3. Tap**Email Logs to Support**.
4. If necessary, choose the application to use when sending the log files.
5. Send the email.  
---  
iPhone
------  
Using a 3rd party application to send the email logs causes the logs to come in as plain text on an email, making it difficult for the support team to review the logs. The steps below will work to avoid that issue.  
1. Open the iPhone settings (not N1 settings.)
2. Locate the Nextiva App.
3. Disable**Use 3rd Party Email**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3Pd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000000SByD)
4. Open the Nextiva App.
5. Tap your avatar in the upper-left-hand corner of the app to open the menu.
6. Tap the**Preferences** option.
7. Tap**Email Logs to Support**.
8. Send the email.

question: What is the first step to join a session hosted by a Nextiva support agent?
reference_answer: Navigate to https://remotesupport.nextiva.com/
reference_context:
Document 212: summary: Utilize the ScreenConnect remote support software to assist with in-depth troubleshooting.
text: #### Newer MacOS Versions  
1. Have the client navigate to the **Apple Icon**, then click on **System Settings**.
2. On the left-hand side, scroll down and select**Privacy & Security**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3MP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000084xfT)
3. Select**Accessibility**.
4. Turn on **Nextiva Remote Support Client**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3MP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000084xfn)
5. If the Nextiva Remote Support Client is**NOT**present the client will need to click the + icon and find the downloaded application.  
---  
#### Older MacOS Versions  
1. Have the client navigate to the **Apple Icon**, then click on **System Preferences** > **Security & Privacy**.
2. Click on the **Privacy** tab.
3. Click **Accessibility** on the left. Unlock the tab to make changes. Customers will need to enter their password to continue.
4. Click the ScreenConnect checkbox to allow ScreenConnect to control the computer.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3MP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oJk6)

text: #### Newer MacOS Versions

4. Turn on**Nextiva Remote Support Client**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3MP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000084xfn)

---
