2. Click on the **Privacy** tab.
3. Click **Screen Recording** on the left. Unlock the tab to make changes. Customers will need to enter their password to continue.
4. Click the ScreenConnect checkbox to allow recording while using other apps.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3MP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oJjX)  
---

Document 210: summary: Utilize the ScreenConnect remote support software to assist with in-depth troubleshooting.
text: # Utilize the ScreenConnect remote support software to assist with in-depth troubleshooting.

| Table of Contents |
| --- |
| * [Joining A Session](#Join_Session) * [Troubleshooting Tips for macOS](#TS_MacOS)   + [Black Video](#Black_Video)     - [Newer MacOS Versions](#Black_Video_New)     - [Older MacOS Versions](#Black_Video_Old)   + [Unable to Control the Mouse/Keyboard](#Mouse_Keyboard)     - [Newer MacOS Versions](#Mouse_Keyboard_New)     - [Older MacOS Versions](#Mouse_Keyboard_Old) |  
Joining a Session
-----------------  
These steps should be followed to join a session hosted by a Nextiva support agent:  
1. Navigate to<https://remotesupport.nextiva.com/>
2. Enter the join code providedby the agent.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3MP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000001M8xd)
3. A file will be downloaded to your computer.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3MP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000001M4PN)
4. Run the file.
5. If need to run the file and it prompts for administrator credentials that you do not have, click the**Try Next Option**link in the Joining window  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3MP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000001M50T)

7. Repeat steps 5 and 6 until the file launches without admin access required.

9. Click**Consent to Control**to allow the Nextiva support agent to view and control your computer.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A3MP&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000001M0bu)

question: What are the fields that need to be updated when setting a static IP address on Cisco SPA series devices through the device settings?
reference_answer: IP Address, Subnet Mask, Default Router, DNS 1, DNS 2
reference_context:
Document 228: summary: Steps to set a static IP address on Cisco SPA series devices.
text: 1. Press the menu button and choose **Status**(option 10).  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A31R&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oOYP)
2. Select**Network****Status**(option 2).  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A31R&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oOYU)
3. Change address type to**Static.**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A31R&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oOYe)
4. Update the fields:
* IP Address
* Subnet Mask
* Default Router
* DNS 1
* DNS 2
5. Press**Save**.  
---  
Setting in the WebUI
--------------------  
1. Enter the current IP address into a browser.
2. Choose**Admin Login**in the upper right-hand corner.
3. Select**Advanced View**in the upper right-hand corner.
4. Select the**System**tab.
5. Set**Connection Type**to Static IP.
6. Fill out the Static IP settings.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A31R&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oOZn)
7. Click**Save**.

Document 227: summary: Steps to set a static IP address on Cisco SPA series devices.
text: 1. Press the **menu** button and choose **Network**(option 9)  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A31R&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oOXb)
2. Set option 1 to static instead of DHCP.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A31R&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oOXq)
3. Scroll down and set thefollowing
* **Non-DHCP IP Address**(Option 8)
* **Non-DHCP Subnet Mask**(Option 9)
* **Non-DHCP Default Route**(Option 10)
* **Non-DHCIP DNS 1**(Option 11)
* **Non-DHCP DNS 2**(Option 12)
4. Press**Save**.

question: How do you connect the Yealink WH62 base station to a PC?
reference_answer: Using the USB port to the right of the power port, connect the base station to the PC.
reference_context:
Document 223: summary: Set up the Yealink headsets sold by Nextiva.
text: 1. Plug the base into a power source using the AC adapter
2. Dock the headset to the base
3. The LED on the headset will glow green for 5 seconds, then will indicate the charging status of the headset, indicating the headset is now paired to the base.
4. Using the USB port to the right of the power port, connect the base station to the PC.![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A36H&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000008AumI)
5. On the PC download and install the [Yealink USB Connect](https://www.yealink.com/en/product-detail/usb-connect-management) application
6. By clicking on the WH62 base unit, you can confirm the device is connected successfully, manage settings,and update the device soft.

text: # Set up the Yealink headsets sold by Nextiva.

Before trying to configure a headset, check[Nextiva Headset and Device Compatibility](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Nextiva-Headset-and-Device-Compatibility)to confirm the headset will work with the device you are using.  
YHS36 Mono/Dual
---------------  
The YHS36 is a basic analog headset. As such, it has no call control. If the device supports it, all that is necessary is to locate the headset port on the back of the phone and plug the headset in. All call control will be through the device itself.

question: How can I remove speed dials from a Panasonic UTG 200B or 300B phone if they were set by custom tags?
reference_answer: Use custom tags to disable the flex key and use custom tags to save empty values for the speed dial number and label.
reference_context:
Document 229: summary: Common issues that come up with Panasonic UTG 200B and 300B phones.
text: # Common issues that come up with Panasonic UTG 200B and 300B phones.

| Table of Contents |
| --- |
| * [Device Auto Answers on Speaker](#Auto_Answer) * [Speed Dials Don't Disappear](#Speed_Dials_Dont_Disappear) |  
Device Auto Answers on Speaker
------------------------------  
This indicates the auto-answer feature on the phone was enabled on the device itself. By default, there is an auto-answer softkey visible to customers.  
1. Have the customer push the **AutoAns**softkey.
* If the customer is unable to disable auto answer themselves, the following custom tag can turn it off:
+ **Tag:**AUTO\_ANSWERX*(replace X with the user account on the phone)*
+ **Value:**N
2. After confirming auto-answer is disabled, hide the softkey. See[Panasonic UTG200B/300B - Softkey Custom Tags](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Panasonic-UTG200B-300B-Softkey-Custom-Tags?r=44&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1) for the custom tag to use.  
---  
Speed Dials Don't Disappear
---------------------------  
If the speed dials were set by custom tags, deleting the custom tags will not be sufficient to remove them. In order to remove a speed dial from the phone:  
* Use custom tags to disable the flex key
* Use custom tags to save empty values for the speed dial number and label  
See[Panasonic UTG200B/300B - Display and Line Key Custom Tags](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Panasonic-UTG200B-300B-Display-and-Line-Key-Custom-Tags?r=44&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1) for the tags and values.  
If the speed dials were set in the web interface or on the phone itself. The changes will have to be done in either the web interface or on the phone. If you want custom tags to influence the phone, the device will have to be factory reset in order for custom tags to correctly affect the speed dial options, see[Panasonic UTG200B/300B - Factory Reset Guide](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Panasonic-UTG200B-300B-Factory-Reset-Guide?r=44&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1) for steps on how to factory reset.

I see. Would you like to make changes to these settings?

You'll need to access the phone's settings menu. Let me guide you through the steps.

question: How do you access and control integrations in NextivaONE?
reference_answer: To access and control all integrations, click the Integrations button on the right-hand side of the window.
reference_context:
Document 225: summary: Manage integrations within the NextivaONE desktop and web application
text: # Manage integrations within the NextivaONE desktop and web application

Integrations for NextivaONE can be managed through the integrations button on the right-hand side of the application.  
| Table of Contents |
| --- |
| * [Accessing Integrations](#Accessing_Integrations) * [Adding New Integrations](#Adding_New_Integrations) * [Disconnecting Integrations](#Disconnect_Integrations) |  
Accessing Integrations
----------------------  
To access and control all integrations, click the**Integrations**button on the right-hand side of the window.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WFI9)  
The landing page for this shows all your current active integrations with NextivaONE  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000083ucU)  
---  
Adding New Integrations
-----------------------  
To add a new integration:  
1. Select the **Available integrations** tab.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000083udc)
1. If desired, select the type of service you are looking to connect using the buttons in the upper-middle portion of the page.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WGMM)
2. Hover over the service to integrate and click**Connect**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WGNA)
3. Click**Next**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WGOw)
4. In the pop-up window click**Import contacts**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WGRv)
5. Click the **Sign in**button to sign into your account.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WGS0)
6. Enter your account username and password.
7. Give NextivaONE access to your account information.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000083uZv)
8. NextivaONE will begin to sync calendar and contact information.  
---  
Disconnecting Integrations
--------------------------  
To disconnect an account from integrating with NextivaONE follow the following steps:  
1. Select the **Connected Accounts**tab if not already on it.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000083uea)
2. Locate the integration you want to disconnect from.
1. If desired, select the type of service you are looking to connect using the buttons in the upper-middle portion of the page.
3. Click the**Disconnect button**on the service you wish to disconnect from.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000083uf4)
4. Choose if you wish to keep the imported contacts or delete contacts that are still private, business contacts will remain.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000009Oao6)
5. Click **Disconnect**to disconnect the connected accounts.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A333&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000009OaoQ)
6. The account will be disconnected from NextivaONE

Sure, I can help with that. What specifically would you like to know?

You'll need to start by logging into your NextivaONE account. From there, you can navigate to the settings or integrations section to access and control them.

question: What are the default credentials for accessing the provisioning settings of the Vtech VSP650?
reference_answer: Username: admin, Password: admin
reference_context:
Document 224: summary: This article walks through how to provision a Vtech VSP650/VDP 650 or Nextiva X-650 using the Vtech VSP650 device profile.
text: # This article walks through how to provision a Vtech VSP650/VDP 650 or Nextiva X-650 using the Vtech VSP650 device profile.

| **This is for devices using the VTech VSP650 profile, if you are using the Nextiva X-650 profile see [this article](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Nextiva-X-650-Provisioning-Instructions)** |
| --- |  
To provision the X-650, a handset or deskset needs to be paired to the base. All X-650 base units come with one handset already paired to it. If the base does not have a handset paired to it, follow the instructions in the article[Nextiva X-650 - Handset Registration/Deregistration](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Nextiva-X-650-Handset-Registration-Deregistration)to pair a handset to the base.  
Provisioning Instructions
-------------------------  
1. Press the**Menu/Func.**button on the deskset (**Menu/Select**button on the cordless handset).
2. Navigate to**Status**.
3. Select**Network**.
4. The following screen will display the**IP Address**of the device.
* Before proceeding, ensure that the MAC Address has been added to the account and that the device has been assigned to a User.
5. Enter the IP Address in a browser on a computer connected to the same network as the base station.
6. If prompted, the default credentials are
* **Username:** admin
* **Password:** admin
7. Click**SERVICING**at the top-right.
8. Click**Provisioning**on the far-left side of the screen.
9. Remove the contents of the Server URL text box, then enter<http://dm.nextiva.com/dms/Nextiva_Service_Provider/VTech_VSP650/>
10. Scroll down, then click**Save**.
11. While still logged into the WebUI on the**Provisioning**screen, click**Reboot**on the upper left side of the screen.
12. Select the blue**Reboot**button in the middle of the screen. The phone should reboot and reach out to the provisioning server to download the configuration files created when the device was attached to the user.  
---  
Troubleshooting
---------------  
If the phone does not auto-provision check the following:  
1. Is the MAC address correct on the account?
2. Is the device type correct on the account?
3. Is the MAC address correct on the account?
4. Is the **Server Address** entered correctly?
* No typos
* No spaces at the beginning or end
5. Adjust the DNS Server.
* Nextiva recommends using Google's DNS servers: **8.8.8.8** and **8.8.4.4**.

question: What steps are required to disable auto-answer on Panasonic UTG 200B and 300B phones?
reference_answer: 1. Have the customer push the AutoAns softkey. If the customer is unable to disable auto answer themselves, use the custom tag AUTO_ANSWERX (replace X with the user account on the phone) with value N. 2. After confirming auto-answer is disabled, hide the softkey using the appropriate custom tag.
reference_context:
Document 229: summary: Common issues that come up with Panasonic UTG 200B and 300B phones.
text: # Common issues that come up with Panasonic UTG 200B and 300B phones.

| Table of Contents |
| --- |
| * [Device Auto Answers on Speaker](#Auto_Answer) * [Speed Dials Don't Disappear](#Speed_Dials_Dont_Disappear) |  
Device Auto Answers on Speaker
------------------------------  
This indicates the auto-answer feature on the phone was enabled on the device itself. By default, there is an auto-answer softkey visible to customers.  
1. Have the customer push the **AutoAns**softkey.
* If the customer is unable to disable auto answer themselves, the following custom tag can turn it off:
+ **Tag:**AUTO\_ANSWERX*(replace X with the user account on the phone)*
+ **Value:**N
2. After confirming auto-answer is disabled, hide the softkey. See[Panasonic UTG200B/300B - Softkey Custom Tags](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Panasonic-UTG200B-300B-Softkey-Custom-Tags?r=44&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1) for the custom tag to use.  
---  
Speed Dials Don't Disappear
---------------------------  
If the speed dials were set by custom tags, deleting the custom tags will not be sufficient to remove them. In order to remove a speed dial from the phone:  
* Use custom tags to disable the flex key
* Use custom tags to save empty values for the speed dial number and label  
See[Panasonic UTG200B/300B - Display and Line Key Custom Tags](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Panasonic-UTG200B-300B-Display-and-Line-Key-Custom-Tags?r=44&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1) for the tags and values.  
If the speed dials were set in the web interface or on the phone itself. The changes will have to be done in either the web interface or on the phone. If you want custom tags to influence the phone, the device will have to be factory reset in order for custom tags to correctly affect the speed dial options, see[Panasonic UTG200B/300B - Factory Reset Guide](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Panasonic-UTG200B-300B-Factory-Reset-Guide?r=44&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1) for steps on how to factory reset.

What do I need to do for that?
You'll need to access the settings menu. Let me guide you through the steps.

question: What are the default credentials for accessing the provisioning settings of the Vtech VSP650?
reference_answer: Username: admin, Password: admin
reference_context:
Document 224: summary: This article walks through how to provision a Vtech VSP650/VDP 650 or Nextiva X-650 using the Vtech VSP650 device profile.
text: # This article walks through how to provision a Vtech VSP650/VDP 650 or Nextiva X-650 using the Vtech VSP650 device profile.

| **This is for devices using the VTech VSP650 profile, if you are using the Nextiva X-650 profile see [this article](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Nextiva-X-650-Provisioning-Instructions)** |
| --- |  
To provision the X-650, a handset or deskset needs to be paired to the base. All X-650 base units come with one handset already paired to it. If the base does not have a handset paired to it, follow the instructions in the article[Nextiva X-650 - Handset Registration/Deregistration](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Nextiva-X-650-Handset-Registration-Deregistration)to pair a handset to the base.  
Provisioning Instructions
-------------------------  
1. Press the**Menu/Func.**button on the deskset (**Menu/Select**button on the cordless handset).
2. Navigate to**Status**.
3. Select**Network**.
4. The following screen will display the**IP Address**of the device.
* Before proceeding, ensure that the MAC Address has been added to the account and that the device has been assigned to a User.
5. Enter the IP Address in a browser on a computer connected to the same network as the base station.
6. If prompted, the default credentials are
* **Username:** admin
* **Password:** admin
7. Click**SERVICING**at the top-right.
8. Click**Provisioning**on the far-left side of the screen.
9. Remove the contents of the Server URL text box, then enter<http://dm.nextiva.com/dms/Nextiva_Service_Provider/VTech_VSP650/>
10. Scroll down, then click**Save**.
11. While still logged into the WebUI on the**Provisioning**screen, click**Reboot**on the upper left side of the screen.
12. Select the blue**Reboot**button in the middle of the screen. The phone should reboot and reach out to the provisioning server to download the configuration files created when the device was attached to the user.  
---  
Troubleshooting
---------------  
If the phone does not auto-provision check the following:  
1. Is the MAC address correct on the account?
2. Is the device type correct on the account?
3. Is the MAC address correct on the account?
4. Is the **Server Address** entered correctly?
* No typos
* No spaces at the beginning or end
5. Adjust the DNS Server.
* Nextiva recommends using Google's DNS servers: **8.8.8.8** and **8.8.4.4**.

question: How do you pair the WH62 headset to its base?
reference_answer: Dock the headset to the base, the LED on the headset will glow green for 5 seconds, then will indicate the charging status of the headset, indicating the headset is now paired to the base.
reference_context:
Document 221: summary: Set up the Yealink headsets sold by Nextiva.
text: # Set up the Yealink headsets sold by Nextiva.

Before trying to configure a headset, check[Nextiva Headset and Device Compatibility](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Nextiva-Headset-and-Device-Compatibility)to confirm the headset will work with the device you are using.  
YHS36 Mono/Dual
---------------  
The YHS36 is a basic analog headset. As such, it has no call control. If the device supports it, all that is necessary is to locate the headset port on the back of the phone and plug the headset in. All call control will be through the device itself.  
---  
WH62
----

Document 223: summary: Set up the Yealink headsets sold by Nextiva.
text: 1. Plug the base into a power source using the AC adapter
2. Dock the headset to the base
3. The LED on the headset will glow green for 5 seconds, then will indicate the charging status of the headset, indicating the headset is now paired to the base.
4. Using the USB port to the right of the power port, connect the base station to the PC.![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A36H&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000008AumI)
5. On the PC download and install the [Yealink USB Connect](https://www.yealink.com/en/product-detail/usb-connect-management) application
6. By clicking on the WH62 base unit, you can confirm the device is connected successfully, manage settings,and update the device soft.

Document 222: summary: Set up the Yealink headsets sold by Nextiva.

2. Dock the headset to the base
3. The LED on the headset will glow green for 5 seconds, then will indicate the charging status of the headset, indicating the headset is now paired to the base.
4. Using the USB port to the left of the power port, connect the base station to the phone.![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A36H&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000008AulK)

Document 235: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: 1. [Add the Device](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Add-a-Device) to the account and assign it to a user.
2. Check the firmware
1. From the main screen, select**Menu → Basic Settings → Other Option → Embedded Web → On**. The phone beeps indicating Embedded Web is now on.
2. Press the**Back**soft key (left soft key) twice to go back to the main menu.
3. Select**System Settings → Status → IPv4 Settings → IP Address**. Record the IP address that appears on the screen.
4. Use your**web browser**to navigate to the IP Address of the phone.**NOTE:**If you are unable to navigate to the IP address, add/?xto the end of the IP address.Example:192.168.1.210/?x.
5. When prompted enter the username and password
* **Username:** admin
* **Password:**adminpass
6. Verify the firmware version that displays on the screen is version**06.000 or higher**. If it is, [continue with provisioning the phone](#Enter_Provisioning_Server_NextOS) . If the firmware version is lower than 06.000, follow the instructions below to upgrade the firmware.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozEg)
7. Click the**Maintenance**tab at the top of the screen.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozEl)
8. Click**Firmware Maintenance**on the left side of the screen.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozEv)
9. Enter[http://dm.nextiva.com/dms/Nextiva\_Service\_Provider/KXHDV230/HDV230-07.200.fw](http://dm.nextiva.com/dms/Nextiva_Service_Provider/KXHDV130/HDV130-06.000_US.fw.part1)in the**Firmware File URL**text box.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozCw)
10. Click the**Save**button at the bottom of the screen. The phone should reboot. If it does not, manually reboot the phone by temporarily disconnecting the AC adapter from the back of the phone.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozF5)
3. Enter the provisioning server
1. Click the**Maintenance**tab at the top of the screen.
2. Enter[http://dm.nextiva.com/dms/Nextiva\_Service\_Provider/KXHDV230/HDV230-{mac}.cfg](http://dm.nextiva.com/dms/Nextiva_Service_Provider/KXHDV130/HDV130-%7Bmac%7D.cfg)in the**Standard File URL**text box.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozGX)
3. Click the**Save**button. The phone should reboot. If it does not, manually reboot the phone by temporarily disconnecting the AC adapter from the back of the phone.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oz3j)
4. The phone should then provision and register. If the phone displays**Registering...**on the screen after boot up, manually reboot the phone a second time.  
---

Document 239: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: For BLF on the Panasonic KX-HDV230, each line key used for BLF needs to be programmed to display the BLF.  
**Tag:**FLEX\_ACT# (*replace # with the number of the line key to adjust*)
**Value:**X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_BLF  
**NOTE:**Platform accounts may automatically add these tags, but double-check when helping a customer set up their BLF.  
For BLF on an SCA use the following tag  
**Tag:** BLF-USER-1
**Value:***BLF URI of the user*  
You do not need to add the domain.  
---

question: What is the first step to register a handset to a Panasonic TGP 600 base unit?
reference_answer: On the base unit hold the **Handset locator** button until the status light flashes red (approximately 5 seconds).
reference_context:
Document 231: summary: Steps to register (pair) a handset to and deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 600.  This article is valid for both the TPA60 handset and the TPA65 deskset.
text: # Steps to register (pair) a handset to and deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 600.  This article is valid for both the TPA60 handset and the TPA65 deskset.

Handset Registration
--------------------

Document 233: summary: Steps to register (pair) a handset to and deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 600.  This article is valid for both the TPA60 handset and the TPA65 deskset.
text: 1. On the base unit hold the**Handset locator**button until the status light flashes red (approximately 5 seconds).
2. On the handset, press the**Menu**button.
3. Select**Setting Handset**.
4. Select**System Option**.
5. Select**Register Handset**.
6. Select a base unit.
7. After**Registered**is displayed on the LCD, the registration is complete.  
---  
Handset Deregistration
----------------------  
1. On the handset to deregister, press the**Menu**button.
2. Select **Setting Handset**.
3. Select**System Option**.
4. Select **Cancel Base**.
5. Select the base unit to disconnect from.
6. Select**Yes**to confirm.

Document 232: summary: Steps to register (pair) a handset to and deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 600.  This article is valid for both the TPA60 handset and the TPA65 deskset.
text: 1. On the base unit hold the**Handset locator**button until the status light flashes red (approximately 5 seconds).
2. On the handset, press and hold the**OK**softkey until the screen updates to say**Please Wait****...**(approximately 4 seconds).
3. The handset will then display**Registered**and will go to its home screen with the handset number in the upper left-hand corner of the screen.  
---

question: What is the first step to register a handset to a Panasonic TGP 600 base unit?
reference_answer: On the base unit hold the Handset locator button until the status light flashes red (approximately 5 seconds).
reference_context:
Document 231: summary: Steps to register (pair) a handset to and deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 600.  This article is valid for both the TPA60 handset and the TPA65 deskset.
text: # Steps to register (pair) a handset to and deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 600.  This article is valid for both the TPA60 handset and the TPA65 deskset.

Handset Registration
--------------------

Document 233: summary: Steps to register (pair) a handset to and deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 600.  This article is valid for both the TPA60 handset and the TPA65 deskset.
text: 1. On the base unit hold the**Handset locator**button until the status light flashes red (approximately 5 seconds).
2. On the handset, press the**Menu**button.
3. Select**Setting Handset**.
4. Select**System Option**.
5. Select**Register Handset**.
6. Select a base unit.
7. After**Registered**is displayed on the LCD, the registration is complete.  
---  
Handset Deregistration
----------------------  
1. On the handset to deregister, press the**Menu**button.
2. Select **Setting Handset**.
3. Select**System Option**.
4. Select **Cancel Base**.
5. Select the base unit to disconnect from.
6. Select**Yes**to confirm.

Document 232: summary: Steps to register (pair) a handset to and deregister (unpair) a handset from the Panasonic TGP 600.  This article is valid for both the TPA60 handset and the TPA65 deskset.
text: 1. On the base unit hold the**Handset locator**button until the status light flashes red (approximately 5 seconds).
2. On the handset, press and hold the**OK**softkey until the screen updates to say**Please Wait****...**(approximately 4 seconds).
3. The handset will then display**Registered**and will go to its home screen with the handset number in the upper left-hand corner of the screen.  
---

question: How do I send a new SMS/MMS message using the Nextiva app on my phone?
reference_answer: To send a message (SMS/MMS) to a contact: 1. Tap on the Messaging tab at the bottom of the screen. 2. Select the blue New message button in the bottom right-hand corner. 3. Search contacts to send a message to, up to 10 contacts can be selected. 4. Type the message to send, using the paperclip icon to attach files. 5. Click the send icon to send the message.
reference_context:
Document 230: summary: How to send/receive SMS/MMS messages on the NextivaONE mobile application.
text: # How to send/receive SMS/MMS messages on the NextivaONE mobile application.

| Currently, NextivaONE mobile does not support internal chatting with other team members; however, if all team members have SMS enabled, they can send text messages to each other. |
| --- |  
Messages are accessed by tapping the**Messaging**tab at the bottom of the app.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2yD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000001cdCf)  
---  
Sending a new Message
---------------------  
To send a message (SMS/MMS) to a contact:  
1. Tap on the**Messaging**tab at the bottom of the screen.
2. Select the blue**New message**button in the bottom right-hand corner.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2yD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000001cdFt)
3. Search contacts to send a message to, up to 10 contacts can be selected.
4. Type the message to send, using the paperclip icon to attach files.
5. Click the send icon to send the message.  
---  
Replying to an Existing Message
-------------------------------  
To reply to an existing message chain, simply tap on the message chain to pull it up, type out your reply, and press the send button.

Document 236: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: This phone will have to be manually provisioned for Pactolus accounts.  
---  
Additional Setup Options
------------------------

Document 235: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: 1. [Add the Device](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Add-a-Device) to the account and assign it to a user.
2. Check the firmware
1. From the main screen, select**Menu → Basic Settings → Other Option → Embedded Web → On**. The phone beeps indicating Embedded Web is now on.
2. Press the**Back**soft key (left soft key) twice to go back to the main menu.
3. Select**System Settings → Status → IPv4 Settings → IP Address**. Record the IP address that appears on the screen.
4. Use your**web browser**to navigate to the IP Address of the phone.**NOTE:**If you are unable to navigate to the IP address, add/?xto the end of the IP address.Example:192.168.1.210/?x.
5. When prompted enter the username and password
* **Username:** admin
* **Password:**adminpass
6. Verify the firmware version that displays on the screen is version**06.000 or higher**. If it is, [continue with provisioning the phone](#Enter_Provisioning_Server_NextOS) . If the firmware version is lower than 06.000, follow the instructions below to upgrade the firmware.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozEg)
7. Click the**Maintenance**tab at the top of the screen.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozEl)
8. Click**Firmware Maintenance**on the left side of the screen.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozEv)
9. Enter[http://dm.nextiva.com/dms/Nextiva\_Service\_Provider/KXHDV230/HDV230-07.200.fw](http://dm.nextiva.com/dms/Nextiva_Service_Provider/KXHDV130/HDV130-06.000_US.fw.part1)in the**Firmware File URL**text box.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozCw)
10. Click the**Save**button at the bottom of the screen. The phone should reboot. If it does not, manually reboot the phone by temporarily disconnecting the AC adapter from the back of the phone.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozF5)
3. Enter the provisioning server
1. Click the**Maintenance**tab at the top of the screen.
2. Enter[http://dm.nextiva.com/dms/Nextiva\_Service\_Provider/KXHDV230/HDV230-{mac}.cfg](http://dm.nextiva.com/dms/Nextiva_Service_Provider/KXHDV130/HDV130-%7Bmac%7D.cfg)in the**Standard File URL**text box.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ozGX)
3. Click the**Save**button. The phone should reboot. If it does not, manually reboot the phone by temporarily disconnecting the AC adapter from the back of the phone.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2uz&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oz3j)
4. The phone should then provision and register. If the phone displays**Registering...**on the screen after boot up, manually reboot the phone a second time.  
---

question: Which custom tag is used to define the outbound proxy of the Panasonic KX-HDV230 desk phone?
reference_answer: OUTPROXY_ADDR
reference_context:
Document 240: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: Remote directories, such as Custom Contact Directories and the group Common Phone List, are not supported on the Panasonic KX-HDV230.  
---

Document 245: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: The HDV 230 has different custom tags to control the registration address and the outbound proxy, you may need to adjust these tags if having registration issues.  
The tag below defines the outbound proxy of the phone and should be set to the system-generated value of the SBC\_OBP tag.
**Tag:**OUTPROXY\_ADDR
**Value:***outbound proxy of phone*  
The tag below defines the basic registration address and should be set to prod.voipdnsservers.com; however, it is set to the OBP of the phone.
**Tag:**SBC\_OBP
**Value:**prod.voipdnsservers.com  
---

text: For Shared Call Appearance, you will need to use 2 custom tags.  
**Tag:**FLEX\_ACT# (*replace # with the number of the line key to adjust*)
**Value:**X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_LINE
**Tag:**FLEX\_ARG#(replace # with the number of the line key to adjust)
**Value:** 2

Document 243: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: The Panasonic KX-HDV230 supports phone integration with Nextiva Call Center Pro and Nextiva Call Center Enterprise’s ACD states, allowing the users to go available and sign out of a Call Center from their phone’s interface. To set up this feature, use the custom tags below:  
**Tag:** ACD\_LOGIN
**Value:**0
**Tag:** ACD\_LOGOUT
**Value:**0
**Tag:** ACD1
**Value:**Y
**Tag:** CALL\_CENTER1
**Value:**Y
**Tag:** FLEX\_ACT#(*replace # with the number of the line key to adjust*)
**Value****:**X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_ACD
**Tag:** FLEX\_ACT#(*replace # with the number of the line key to adjust*)
**Value:**X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_WRAPUP
**Tag:** FLEX\_ARG#(*replace # with the number of the line key to adjust , needs to match the X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_ACD*)
**Value:**1
**Tag:** FLEX\_ARG#(*replace # with the number of the line key to adjust , needs to match the X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_WRAPUP*)
**Value:**1
**Tag:** TCP
**Value:**1  
---

**Value:**prod.voipdnsservers.com

question: How do you enable or disable daylight savings time on the Panasonic KX-HDV130 phone?
reference_answer: To enable or disable daylight savings time on the Panasonic KX-HDV130 phone, you can use the custom tag DST_ENABLE. The default value is Y (enabled), and the possible values are Y (to enable) or N (to disable). For example, to disable daylight savings time, you would set Tag Name: DST_ENABLE – Tag Value: N.
reference_context:
Document 245: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: The HDV 230 has different custom tags to control the registration address and the outbound proxy, you may need to adjust these tags if having registration issues.  
The tag below defines the outbound proxy of the phone and should be set to the system-generated value of the SBC\_OBP tag.
**Tag:**OUTPROXY\_ADDR
**Value:***outbound proxy of phone*  
The tag below defines the basic registration address and should be set to prod.voipdnsservers.com; however, it is set to the OBP of the phone.
**Tag:**SBC\_OBP
**Value:**prod.voipdnsservers.com  
---

Document 246: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: Below are the custom tags which can be used with the Panasonic KX-HDV130.  
**CC\_DISP\_CODE**  
Enables or disables call center disposition codes on the phone.  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values:**Y**or**N**
* Example: Tag Name:**CC\_DISP\_CODE**– Tag Value:**N**  
**CC\_STATUS**  
Enables or disables call center status events.  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values:**Y**or**N**
* Example: Tag Name:**CC\_STATUS**– Tag Value:**N**  
**CC\_TRACE**  
Enables or disables customer-originated trace.  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values:**Y**or**N**
* Example: Tag Name:**CC\_TRACE**– Tag Value:**N**  
**DST\_ENABLE**  
Enables or disables daylight savings time on the phone.  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values:**Y**or**N**
* Example: Tag Name:**DST\_ENABLE**– Tag Value:**N**  
**NOTE:**with the Panasonic KX-HDV130 daylight savings time does not need to be enabled for the phone to register. This was an issue with other model Panasonics, but not the KX-HDV130.  
**BLF-USER-1**  
Set the BLF URI if the device is an SCA  
* Default Value:***blank***
* Possible Values:***BLF\_URI of the user***the domain is NOT needed
* Example: Tag Name:**BLF-USER-1**– Tag Value:**patinsley\_blf**  
**FLEX\_ACT#**  
Specifies whether the line/program key should be used as a line, one-touch, ACD, Wrap Up (facility action).  
* Default Value:**None**
* Possible Values:
+ **X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_LINE**
+ **X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_ONETOUCH**
+ **X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_ACD**
+ **X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_WRAPUP**
* Example: Tag Name:**FLEX\_ACT1**– Tag Value:**X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_LINE**  
**FLEX\_ARG#**  
Specifies an optional argument associated with the specified facility action for the flexible button.  
* Default Value:**None**
* Possible Values: ***Varies based on user accounts assigned to the phone***
* Example: Tag Name:**FLEX\_ARG1**– Tag Value:**1**  
**HOLD\_RECALL**  
Specifies the duration of the hold recall timer. If**0**, function is disabled.  
* Default Value:**0**
* Possible Values:**0**to**240**(in seconds)
* Example: Tag Name:**HOLD\_RECALL**– Tag Value:**30**  
**SOURCE\_PORT-1**  
Changes the Local Source (SIP) Port on the device.  
* Default Value:**5060**(line 1),**5070**(line 2)
* Possible Values:**5060 through 5089**
* Example: Tag Name:**SOURCE\_PORT-1**– Tag Value:**5084**  
**SSAF**  
Enables SSAF for all lines to prevent SIPVicious.  
* Default Value:**N**
* Possible Values:**Y**(to enable) or**N**(to disable)
* Example: Tag Name:**SSAF**– Tag Value:**Y**  
**LLDP**  
Controls LLDP on the HDV-230  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values: **Y/N**
* Example: Tag Name: **LLDP**–Tag Value: **N**  
**CDP\_ENABLE**  
Controls CDP on the HDV-230  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values: **Y/N**
* Example: Tag Name: **CDP\_ENABLE**–Tag Value: **N**  
**VLAN**  
Controls VLAN on the HDV-230  
* Default Value: **N**
* Possible Values: **Y/N**
* Example: Tag Name: **VLAN**–Tag Value: **Y**  
**VLAN\_ID\_PHONE**  
Sets the VLAN ID on the HDV-230  
* Default Value: **0**
* Possible Values: ***Desired VLAN ID***
* Example: Tag Name: **VLAN\_ID\_PHONE**–Tag Value: **10**  
**HOLD\_RECALL**  
Specifies the duration of the hold recall timer. If 0, the function is disabled.  
* Default Value: **0**
* Possible Values: **0 - 240 *(seconds)***
* Example: Tag Name: **HOLD\_RECALL**–Tag Value: **120**  
**AUTO\_ANS\_ON\_CALL**  
Enables or disables auto answer on the device  
* Default Value: **N**
* Possible Values: **Y/N**
* Example: Tag Name: **AUTO\_ANS\_ON\_CALL**– Tag Value: **Y**  
**HOTELING**  
Enables or disables hoteling on the device  
* Default Value: **N**
* Possible Values: **Y/N**
* Example: Tag Name: **HOTELING**– Tag Value: **Y**

question: Which port on the EHS Box should the RJ12 connector with tag 'EHS BOX' be connected to?
reference_answer: the side with the single port. NOT the same side as the 3.5mm port
reference_context:
Document 249: summary: Configure the CS540 with an X-885, X-835, or X-815 device with an EHS box.
text: # Configure the CS540 with an X-885, X-835, or X-815 device with an EHS box.

EHS Equipment
-------------  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2oX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000047rVQ)
A: EHS Box. One side has an RJ12 port, and the other side has an RJ-45 port and a 3.5mm port.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2oX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000047rVV)
B: Double-sided RJ-12 cable. The labels may read EXT and EHS box.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2oX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000047rVu)
C: Double-sided 3.5mm stereo cable  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2oX&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000047rW4)
D: Telephone Interface Cable  
---  
Instructions
------------  
1. Connect part (C) 3.5mm cable to EHS Box (A) 3.5mm port.
2. Connect the other side of part (C) 3.5mm cable to the middle 3.5mm port on the back of the CS540 base.
3. Connect part (B) RJ12 connector with tag "EHS BOX" to EHS Box (A) on the side with the single port. NOT the same side as the 3.5mm port.
4. Connect the other side of part (B) RJ12 connector with tag "EXT" to the back of the Nextiva X-8xx in the EHS port.
5. Take the Telephone Interface Cable (D) that came in the box with the CS540 headset and connect the larger end into the CS540 base.
6. Connect the small end of the Telephone Interface Cable (D) into the headset port on the back of the Nextiva X-8xx phone.
7. Make sure the switch on the bottom of the CS540 headset base is set to "A".
8. If your headset is already charged, put it on and press the Headset key on your Nextiva X-8xx desk phone and try making a test call.

question: How do you initiate a conference call using Nextiva Anywhere?
reference_answer: Once you have made or received a phone call using Nextiva Anywhere, mid-call, dial ## This will flash the call, which will put your primary conversation on hold. Dial another internal extension or external phone number. Once connected, dial ## again to initiate the conference call.
reference_context:
Document 248: summary: This article walks through how to transfer or conference using Nextiva Anywhere.
text: # This article walks through how to transfer or conference using Nextiva Anywhere.

In order to use this feature, it needs to be configured in your Nextiva Anywhere settings. Please contact Nextiva Support to set this feature up.  
Transferring Calls
------------------  
Once you have made or received a phone call usingNextiva Anywhere, mid-call, dial ##  
* This will flash the call, which will put your primary conversation on hold.
* Dial another internal extension or external phone number. Once connected, disconnecting the call will initiate the transfer.  
**NOTE:**To blind transfer the call, disconnect while the call to the third party is still ringing.  
---  
Conference Calls
----------------  
Once you have made or received a phone call usingNextiva Anywhere, mid-call, dial ##  
* This will flash the call, which will put your primary conversation on hold.
* Dial another internal extension or external phone number. Once connected, dial ## again to initiate the conference call.

question: What is the default PIN to register or deregister a handset or deskset?
reference_context:
Document 247: summary: This article walks through how to register (pair) or deregister (unpair) a Nextiva X-651 handset or Nextiva X-658 deskset to the Nextiva X-650 base unit.
text: # This article walks through how to register (pair) or deregister (unpair) a Nextiva X-651 handset or Nextiva X-658 deskset to the Nextiva X-650 base unit.

| Table of Contents |
| --- |
| * [Register a Handset/Deskset](#Register) * [Deregister a Handset/Deskset](#Deregister) |  
| **The default PIN to register or deregister a handset or deskset is 1592 or 0000** |
| --- |  
Register a Handset/Deskset
--------------------------  
The handset must be registered to the base station to make and receive calls.  
1. Make sure the handset has a charged battery before proceeding. Make sure the base station is connected to power.
2. If the handset is displaying the following message, go to step 7. Otherwise, go to step 3.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2tN&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WJXd)
3. Press**MENU**on the handset. The Main Menu appears.
4. Press**down**to scroll to**User settings**and press**SELECT**.
5. Press**down**to scroll to**Registration**and press**SELECT**.
6. With**This Handset**highlighted, press**SELECT**. The handset screen displays instructions.
7. On the base station, press the**HANDSET LOCATOR**button for at least four seconds, then release the button. Both LEDs on the base station begin to flash.
8. Press the**#**key on the handset to begin registration. The screen displays**Registering Please wait**. The process takes up to 10 seconds to complete. When registration is complete, the handset beeps and displays**Handset Registered**. If the handset doesn't register, please place it in the charger again for a few seconds, and then repeat the registration procedure.  
---  
Deregister a Handset/Deskset
----------------------------  
The handset ***may*** need to be in the range of the base in order for it to successfully deregister a handset or deskset.  
1. Press**MENU**on the handset. The Main Menu appears.
2. Press**down**to scroll to**User settings**and press**SELECT**.
3. Press**down**to scroll to**Registration**and press**SELECT**.
4. Press**down**to highlight**Deregistration**and press**SELECT**. The handset screen displays a list of devices registered to the base station.
5. Press**down**to highlight the name of the handset you want to deregister, then press**SELECT**.
6. Enter the PIN, and then press**SELECT**to begin deregistration. The default PIN is 1592 or 0000. The deregistration process takes up to 10 seconds to complete. When the handset deregisters, it beeps and the screen displays Handset is deregistered, followed by the installation instructions:  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2tN&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000002WJYM)  
**Note:** The handset enters an energy-saving charging mode after being deregistered. All cordless telephone functions except handset-battery charging are disabled. The energy-saving charging mode is deactivated after the handset registers to the base station.

Document 246: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: Below are the custom tags which can be used with the Panasonic KX-HDV130.  
**CC\_DISP\_CODE**  
Enables or disables call center disposition codes on the phone.  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values:**Y**or**N**
* Example: Tag Name:**CC\_DISP\_CODE**– Tag Value:**N**  
**CC\_STATUS**  
Enables or disables call center status events.  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values:**Y**or**N**
* Example: Tag Name:**CC\_STATUS**– Tag Value:**N**  
**CC\_TRACE**  
Enables or disables customer-originated trace.  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values:**Y**or**N**
* Example: Tag Name:**CC\_TRACE**– Tag Value:**N**  
**DST\_ENABLE**  
Enables or disables daylight savings time on the phone.  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values:**Y**or**N**
* Example: Tag Name:**DST\_ENABLE**– Tag Value:**N**  
**NOTE:**with the Panasonic KX-HDV130 daylight savings time does not need to be enabled for the phone to register. This was an issue with other model Panasonics, but not the KX-HDV130.  
**BLF-USER-1**  
Set the BLF URI if the device is an SCA  
* Default Value:***blank***
* Possible Values:***BLF\_URI of the user***the domain is NOT needed
* Example: Tag Name:**BLF-USER-1**– Tag Value:**patinsley\_blf**  
**FLEX\_ACT#**  
Specifies whether the line/program key should be used as a line, one-touch, ACD, Wrap Up (facility action).  
* Default Value:**None**
* Possible Values:
+ **X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_LINE**
+ **X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_ONETOUCH**
+ **X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_ACD**
+ **X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_WRAPUP**
* Example: Tag Name:**FLEX\_ACT1**– Tag Value:**X\_PANASONIC\_IPTEL\_LINE**  
**FLEX\_ARG#**  
Specifies an optional argument associated with the specified facility action for the flexible button.  
* Default Value:**None**
* Possible Values: ***Varies based on user accounts assigned to the phone***
* Example: Tag Name:**FLEX\_ARG1**– Tag Value:**1**  
**HOLD\_RECALL**  
Specifies the duration of the hold recall timer. If**0**, function is disabled.  
* Default Value:**0**
* Possible Values:**0**to**240**(in seconds)
* Example: Tag Name:**HOLD\_RECALL**– Tag Value:**30**  
**SOURCE\_PORT-1**  
Changes the Local Source (SIP) Port on the device.  
* Default Value:**5060**(line 1),**5070**(line 2)
* Possible Values:**5060 through 5089**
* Example: Tag Name:**SOURCE\_PORT-1**– Tag Value:**5084**  
**SSAF**  
Enables SSAF for all lines to prevent SIPVicious.  
* Default Value:**N**
* Possible Values:**Y**(to enable) or**N**(to disable)
* Example: Tag Name:**SSAF**– Tag Value:**Y**  
**LLDP**  
Controls LLDP on the HDV-230  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values: **Y/N**
* Example: Tag Name: **LLDP**–Tag Value: **N**  
**CDP\_ENABLE**  
Controls CDP on the HDV-230  
* Default Value:**Y**
* Possible Values: **Y/N**
* Example: Tag Name: **CDP\_ENABLE**–Tag Value: **N**  
**VLAN**  
Controls VLAN on the HDV-230  
* Default Value: **N**
* Possible Values: **Y/N**
* Example: Tag Name: **VLAN**–Tag Value: **Y**  
**VLAN\_ID\_PHONE**  
Sets the VLAN ID on the HDV-230  
* Default Value: **0**
* Possible Values: ***Desired VLAN ID***
* Example: Tag Name: **VLAN\_ID\_PHONE**–Tag Value: **10**  
**HOLD\_RECALL**  
Specifies the duration of the hold recall timer. If 0, the function is disabled.  
* Default Value: **0**
* Possible Values: **0 - 240 *(seconds)***
* Example: Tag Name: **HOLD\_RECALL**–Tag Value: **120**  
**AUTO\_ANS\_ON\_CALL**  
Enables or disables auto answer on the device  
* Default Value: **N**
* Possible Values: **Y/N**
* Example: Tag Name: **AUTO\_ANS\_ON\_CALL**– Tag Value: **Y**  
**HOTELING**  
Enables or disables hoteling on the device  
* Default Value: **N**
* Possible Values: **Y/N**
* Example: Tag Name: **HOTELING**– Tag Value: **Y**

Document 245: summary: Set up the Panasonic KX-HDV-230 desk phone.  This includes configuration changes through the use of custom tags.
text: The HDV 230 has different custom tags to control the registration address and the outbound proxy, you may need to adjust these tags if having registration issues.  
The tag below defines the outbound proxy of the phone and should be set to the system-generated value of the SBC\_OBP tag.
**Tag:**OUTPROXY\_ADDR
**Value:***outbound proxy of phone*  
The tag below defines the basic registration address and should be set to prod.voipdnsservers.com; however, it is set to the OBP of the phone.
**Tag:**SBC\_OBP
**Value:**prod.voipdnsservers.com

question: How much bandwidth is required for a high-definition call to another Nextiva customer?
reference_answer: 300kbps (0.3Mbps) upload & 300kbps (0.3Mbps) bandwidth
reference_context:
Document 256: summary: Basic bandwidth requirements for phone calls and video meetings.
text: #### Video Calling  
Video calling within NextivaONE will adapt based on network conditions. Below is the maximum bandwidth used during video calls  
* 1:1 Video Call - 650 kbps upload and download
* HD Video Call - 1400 kbps upload and download
* 3-4 people Video Call - 450 kbps upload and 400 kbps download per the number of participants minus 1 (i.e. a 4 person video meeting would require 400\*(4-1) or 1200 kbps download bandwidth and 450 kbps upload bandwidth)
* 5-16 people Video Call - 184 kbps upload and 134 kbps download per the number of participants minus 1 (i.e. a 6 person video meeting would require 134\*(6-1) or 670 kbps download bandwidth and 184 kbps upload bandwidth)  
#### Screen Sharing  
Screen sharing during a meeting requires the presenter to have 1200 kbps upload and those viewing to have 1200 kbps download for high quality. If the network does not have that much available bandwidth this will adapt down to 320 kbps.  
---  
Tools for testing
-----------------  
You can determine a the bandwidth availability on a network by visiting one of these sites:  
* <https://www.nextiva.com/resources/voip-speed-test.html>
* [http://www.speedtest.net](http://www.speedtest.net/)
* <https://speedof.me/>  
**Note:** If there isn't sufficient bandwidth on the network to handle the number of calls with other internet traffic for a business, your Internet Service Provider (ISP) will need to be contacted to increase the allocated bandwidth.

Document 255: summary: Basic bandwidth requirements for phone calls and video meetings.
text: All standard quality phone calls on the Nextiva network require 100kbps (0.1Mbps) upload & 100kbps (0.1Mbps) bandwidth per simultaneous call.For example, 4 Inbound calls and 5 Outbound calls all occurring at the same time would require 900Kbps (0.9Mbps) Upload and 900Kbps (0.9 Mbps) bandwidth. Nextiva also requires 0% packet loss and less than 20ms of jitter.  
High-definition calls, currently for calls to other Nextiva customers, require 300kbps (0.3Mbps) upload & 300kbps (0.3Mbps) bandwidth per simultaneous call, three times the bandwidth of a standard call.

Document 254: summary: Basic bandwidth requirements for phone calls and video meetings.
text: # Basic bandwidth requirements for phone calls and video meetings.

Requirements
------------

question: How do you perform a blind transfer on a Poly VVX phone?
reference_answer: 1. While on a call, press the **More** softkey at the bottom of the screen twice, and then press the **BlindX** softkey at the bottom of the screen. 2. Dial the phone number or extension of the party you want to transfer the call to, and press the **Enter** softkey at the bottom of the screen. If you dial the full 10 digit number of the party you want to call, the Poly VVX phone will automatically start dialing, so pressing the **Enter** softkey is not necessary.
reference_context:
Document 257: summary: There are two types of transfers; a warm transfer (attended), and a blind transfer (unattended). A warm transfer occurs when you speak with the party you are transferring the call to before you transfer the call to them. A blind transfer routes the call directly with no interaction
text: # There are two types of transfers; a warm transfer (attended), and a blind transfer (unattended). A warm transfer occurs when you speak with the party you are transferring the call to before you transfer the call to them. A blind transfer routes the call directly with no interaction

There are two types of transfers; a [warm transfer](#Warm_Transfer) (attended), and a [blind transfer](#Blind_Xfer) (unattended). A warm transfer occurs when you speak with the party you are transferring the call to before you transfer the call to them. A blind transfer routes the call directly with no interaction.  
Warm Transferring:
------------------  
1. While on a call, either press the physical transfer button or press the **Tsfr**softkey at the bottom of the screen. The party you were speaking with is put on hold, and you hear a dial tone.  
![transferimage1.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2gT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000000rEtE)
2. **Dial**the phone number or extension of the party you want to transfer the call to, and press the**Send**softkey at the bottom of the screen. Wait for the other party to answer so you can speak with them before transferring the call.  
![transferimage2.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2gT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000000rF2O)  
**NOTE:**To cancel the transfer and return to the original party, press the**Cncl**softkey at the bottom of the screen.  
![VVX_201-Transferring_Figure_1-3.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2gT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000000rF2T)
3. When the other party is ready to accept the call, either press the physical transfer button or press the **Tsfr**softkey at the bottom of the screen again.  
---  
Blind Transferring:
-------------------  
1. While on a call, press the**More**softkey at the bottom of the screen twice, and then press the**BlindX**softkey at the bottom of the screen.  
![VVX_201-Transferring_Figure_1-4.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2gT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000000rF2d)
2. **Dial**the phone number or extension of the party you want to transfer the call to, and press the**Enter**softkey at the bottom of the screen. If you dial the full 10 digit number of the party you want to call, the Poly VVX phone will automatically start dialing, so pressing the**Enter**softkey is not necessary.  
![VVX_201-Transferring_Figure_1-5.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2gT&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000000rF2s)  
**NOTE:**To cancel the transfer and return to the original party, press the**Cncl**softkey at the bottom of the screen.

question: How do you access the advanced settings on a Poly Edge Series device?
reference_answer: Access the Menu of the device. Scroll and select Settings. Select Advanced and enter the password, by default the password is 456.
reference_context:
Document 258: summary: This article walks through how to set a static IP address on a Poly device.
text: # This article walks through how to set a static IP address on a Poly device.

| Table of Contents |
| --- |
| * [Through the Device](#Device)   + [Through the Main Menu](#Main_Menu)   + [Through the Boot Menu](#Boot_Menu) * [Through the WebUI](#WebUI) |  
Through the Device
------------------

Document 259: summary: This article walks through how to set a static IP address on a Poly device.
text: | Edge Series | VVX Series |
| --- | --- |
| 1. Access the Menu of the device. 2. Scroll and select**Settings**. 3. Select**Advanced** and enter the password, by default the password is 456. 4. Select**Administration****Settings**. 5. Select**Network Configuration**. 6. Select**Network Interfaces**. 7. Select**Ethernet Menu**. 8. Select**IPv4 Configuration**. 9. Disable**DHCP** by selecting the option and pressing the **Edit** softkey. 10. Enter the static IP address information. 11. Press the **Exit** softkey 4 times. 12. Choose**Save Config**. 13. The phone will reboot and apply the change. | 1. Access the Menu of the device. 2. Scroll and select**Settings**. 3. Select**Advanced** and enter the password, by default the password is 456. 4. Select**Administration****Settings**. 5. Select**Network Configuration**. 6. Select**Ethernet Menu**. 7. Select**IPv4 Configuration**. 8. Disable**DHCP** by selecting the option and pressing the **Edit** softkey and selecting **Disabled**. 9. Enter the static IP address information. 10. Press the **Back** softkey 3 times. 11. Choose**Save Config**. 12. The phone will reboot and apply the change. |

question: What license is required to use the Pre-Alerting Announcement feature?
reference_answer: This feature requires an enterprise or ultimate license to use.
reference_context:
Document 250: summary: This feature allows the playing of an announcement for callers to hear before the call is routed to an available user.
text: # This feature allows the playing of an announcement for callers to hear before the call is routed to an available user.

| Pre-Alerting Announcement is used to play a message before a user's line begins to ring. This is often used to notify of call recording.This feature only works if the user is dialed directly and will not play for calls coming through a call group or call center.This featurerequires an enterprise or ultimate license to use. | |
| --- | --- |
| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| [image.png](#NP3) | [Platform Main page](#Platform) |  
---  
Setup
-----  
Ensure the message that you want to be played is uploaded to the account, see[Uploading Announcements and Greetings](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Uploading-Announcements-and-Greetings) for these steps.  
After uploading the greeting, [contact Nextiva support](https://help.nextiva.com/s/contactsupport) to finish setting up the feature. Include the name of the announcement, the user(s) the announcement should be applied to, your name, and your security PIN for faster resolution.  
![Platform Main Page](https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/assets.nextiva.com/sfkb/Platform+Main+Page.png "Platform Main Page")  
---  
Setup
-----  
Ensure the message that you want to be played is uploaded to the account, see[Uploading Announcements/Greetings for 3.0 Accounts](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Uploading-Announcements-Greetings-for-3-0-Accounts)for these steps.  
1. Navigate to the user's voice settings you want to configure
2. Scroll down and click on**Voicemail and Notification**to expand the section.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2mv&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000008AmNA)
3. Click on**Pre-Alerting Announcement**to modify the settings.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2mv&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000008AmNP)
4. Select the**Custom Audio File**radio button.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2mv&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000008AmNG)
5. Use the dropdown menu to select the audio file you want to be played.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2mv&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000008AmNo)
6. Click**Save**.
7. If the feature did not enable itself automatically, click the**ON/OFF**toggle.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2mv&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000008AmO3)

question: What should be done if a greeting, announcement, or music on hold file cannot be deleted?
reference_answer: If you are unable to delete a file, confirm it is not assigned anywhere and try again.
reference_context:
Document 253: summary: Steps to delete or remove greetings, announcements, or music on hold files from an account.
text: # Steps to delete or remove greetings, announcements, or music on hold files from an account.

| In order to delete a greeting, announcement, or music on hold file from your account, it cannot be in use. If you are unable to delete a file, confirm it is not assigned anywhere and try again. There is no easy way to check to see where a file is assigned.Deleted files cannot be recovered, take care when removing a file from your account. | |
| --- | --- |
| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| [image.png](#NP3) | [Platform Main Page](#Platform) |  
---  
Delete Greeting Files
---------------------  
1. Log into the voice portal as an administrator.
2. From the main admin page, click**Company & Locations** on the left-hand side of the page.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A22A&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000007GpXB)
3. For the location where the greeting is saved, click the vertical ellipses on the right-hand side of the page and select**Voice Settings**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A22A&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003kCqs)
4. Select**Audio Files**on the left-hand side of the page under voice settings.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A22A&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003kDzp)
5. Click the vertical ellipses and select the**Delete**option.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A22A&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003kECj)
6. Click**OK**in the confirmation box that appears on the screen.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A22A&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000003k82V)
7. The file will be deleted from your account.  
---  
Delete Greeting Files
---------------------

question: How much bandwidth is required for a high-definition call to another Nextiva customer?
reference_answer: 300kbps (0.3Mbps) upload & 300kbps (0.3Mbps) bandwidth
reference_context:
Document 256: summary: Basic bandwidth requirements for phone calls and video meetings.
text: #### Video Calling  
Video calling within NextivaONE will adapt based on network conditions. Below is the maximum bandwidth used during video calls  
* 1:1 Video Call - 650 kbps upload and download
* HD Video Call - 1400 kbps upload and download
* 3-4 people Video Call - 450 kbps upload and 400 kbps download per the number of participants minus 1 (i.e. a 4 person video meeting would require 400\*(4-1) or 1200 kbps download bandwidth and 450 kbps upload bandwidth)
* 5-16 people Video Call - 184 kbps upload and 134 kbps download per the number of participants minus 1 (i.e. a 6 person video meeting would require 134\*(6-1) or 670 kbps download bandwidth and 184 kbps upload bandwidth)  
#### Screen Sharing  
Screen sharing during a meeting requires the presenter to have 1200 kbps upload and those viewing to have 1200 kbps download for high quality. If the network does not have that much available bandwidth this will adapt down to 320 kbps.  
---  
Tools for testing
-----------------  
You can determine a the bandwidth availability on a network by visiting one of these sites:  
* <https://www.nextiva.com/resources/voip-speed-test.html>
* [http://www.speedtest.net](http://www.speedtest.net/)
* <https://speedof.me/>  
**Note:** If there isn't sufficient bandwidth on the network to handle the number of calls with other internet traffic for a business, your Internet Service Provider (ISP) will need to be contacted to increase the allocated bandwidth.

Document 255: summary: Basic bandwidth requirements for phone calls and video meetings.
text: All standard quality phone calls on the Nextiva network require 100kbps (0.1Mbps) upload & 100kbps (0.1Mbps) bandwidth per simultaneous call.For example, 4 Inbound calls and 5 Outbound calls all occurring at the same time would require 900Kbps (0.9Mbps) Upload and 900Kbps (0.9 Mbps) bandwidth. Nextiva also requires 0% packet loss and less than 20ms of jitter.  
High-definition calls, currently for calls to other Nextiva customers, require 300kbps (0.3Mbps) upload & 300kbps (0.3Mbps) bandwidth per simultaneous call, three times the bandwidth of a standard call.

Document 254: summary: Basic bandwidth requirements for phone calls and video meetings.
text: # Basic bandwidth requirements for phone calls and video meetings.

question: What is the maximum number of records that can be selected for a bulk action?
reference_answer: Currently, only 100 records can be selected for a bulk action.
reference_context:
Document 251: summary: How to bulk edit (delete, mark as red, mark as unred) conversations in the communications view.
text: # How to bulk edit (delete, mark as red, mark as unred) conversations in the communications view.

| Table of Contents |
| --- |
| * [Bulk Edit/Delete Steps](#Steps) * [Limitations](#Limits) |  
Bulk Edit/Delete Steps
----------------------  
1. Hover over thespecific message and make a selection via the checkbox OR bulk select messages via the checkbox onthe header.  
**NOTE:** you can select only messages that are loaded on the screen, scroll down to load and select more.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2lJ&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000002qTfv)
2. Select action on header: Mark as read, Mark as Unread, Delete.  
**NOTE:** Deleting messages from the All Communications page will delete ***ALL*** messages from the conversation with those contacts.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2lJ&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000002qQi2)
3. If Delete is selected, the confirmation dialog will be presented  
| image.png | image.png |
| --- | --- |
| Confirmation for voice calls | Confirmation for Text messages |
4. After confirming Delete, the process is initiated. For big operations, it may take a couple of seconds. Users will see an oscillating progress snackbar. When the operation is complete, a confirmation snackbar will appear.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2lJ&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000002qdfF)  
Please be aware that if you delete a message or call, it will still be visible to any other participants included in that conversation.  
---  
Limitations
-----------  
* Deleting messages from All communications will delete **ALL** messages from conversations with these contacts.
* Currently, only 100 records can be selected for a bulk action.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2lJ&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000002qeTF)
* Only one bulk operation can be performed at a time from one user. The user will not be able to initiate new operations while the previous one is still ongoing.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2lJ&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000002qeY5)

question: What is the default password to log in as an administrator on a Polycom device through the WebUI?
reference_context:
Document 260: summary: This article walks through how to set a static IP address on a Poly device.
text: 1. Reboot the device
2. Press the**Cancel**softkey.
3. Select the**Setup** softkey.
4. Enter the password
* Default Password: 456
5. Select**Ethernet**.
6. Select**IPv4 Configuration**.
7. On the**DHCP Client**option press the**Edit**softkey and scroll to**Disabled**.
8. Enter the **static IP**information.
9. Press the**Exit**softkey three times.
10. Choose**Save Config**.  
---  
Through the WebUI
-----------------  
It is also possible to set the Static IP through the WebUI. Please follow the steps below to access the WebUI and assign a Static IP Address to a Polycom Device:  
1. Locate the IP Address of the device by holding down 1,4,7 for 5 seconds.
2. Open a web browser and navigate to the IP address of the device. **NOTE:** It may be necessary to add https:// before the IP address to access the device.
3. Log in as an administrator.
* The default password is 456
4. Hover over **Settings** at the top, hover over **Network** about halfway down the list, then click **Ethernet**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2er&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oNrf)
5. Click the**+**sign next to**IPv4**.
6. Select the**Disable**radio button under**DHCP**to open up the options for IP address.
7. Enter the**Static IP Address, Gateway, and Subnet Mask**that the customer would like to use. We recommend using the IP address already in use. To find another IP Address, open a command prompt and enter**arp -a**.
8. Click the**+**sign next to 'General**and use the following settings.**DNS:**8.8.8.8 -**Alternate DNS:**8.8.4.4.**
9. Click**Save**to save the changes. The phone should reboot and come back online with the new information.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2er&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oNrk)

question: What steps are required to add a user to a customer's Akixi portal?
reference_answer: 1. Login to nextiva.akixi.com 2. Select Administration from the top banner 3. Select Devices 4. Select Add 5. Enter the users full 10-digit TN (e.g. 6029626234) or the Location TN x and the extension (e.g. 8002857995x2381) 6. Select the Partition the user belongs to. 7. Select Add. 8. After 1-2 minutes, select refresh, confirm the user synced pulling the user's First/Last name and extension.
reference_context:
Document 263: summary: Add or remove users from an account on Akixi.  Used to manage soft-sync accounts.
text: # Add or remove users from an account on Akixi.  Used to manage soft-sync accounts.

Axiki customers who pay for soft sync need to have their users in Akixi managed by Nextiva support. Akixi considers all users "devices." Below are the steps to add or remove a user from a customer's Akixi portal.  
Add a user
----------  
1. Login to nextiva.akixi.com
2. Select **Administration** from the top banner
3. Select **Devices**
4. Select **Add**
5. Enter the users full 10-digit TN (e.g. 6029626234) or the Location TN x and the extension (e.g. 8002857995x2381)
6. Select the **Partition** the user belongs to.
7. Select **Add**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2a1&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000007MTHa)
8. After 1-2 minutes, select **refresh**,confirm the user synced pulling the user's First/Last name and extension.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2a1&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000007MTHk)  
---  
Remove a User
-------------  
1. Login to nextiva.akixi.com
2. Select **Administration** from the top banner
3. Select **Devices**
4. Locate the user to remove.
5. Check the box by the user's name.
6. Select **Delete**.
