question: How do you assign a fax number to an existing tenant?
reference_answer: 1. Locate the account in ACE. 2. Go to Fax Number Maintenance. 3. Assign a fax number to an existing fax username. 4. Launch the fax portal from OKTA. 5. Navigate to SYTECH > Fax Routes. 6. Search for a fax number. 7. Left-click on a number to highlight it and on the top, go to select action… > Assign Manager > select > enter customer’s account number and hit FIND. 8. Double-click on a tenant to select it and hit Execute. 9. Managed By will change from Nextiva Customers to customer’s sub-tenant. 10. Go back to select action and switch from Assign Manager to Assign Owner, select customer’s sub-tenant > Execute. 11. Owned By will change from Nextiva Customers to customer’s sub-tenant too. 12. The customer should be able to see the number added in their fax portal under Admin > Routing Assignment.
reference_context:
Document 262: summary: Assign a fax number to a fax admin tenant
text: # Assign a fax number to a fax admin tenant

Fax Admin Tenant is a separate sub-tenant in the vFAX portal. Some enterprise customers have Admin rights and can manage their fax users. Fax Tenant is created manually in the portal, users and numbers are also added to the sub-tenant via fax portal, not ACE. We do not create fax users in ACE for these accounts. If you open the account in ACE and go to Fax Number Maintenance, you’ll see all fax numbers assigned to a single username. We should never delete this username.  
Assign a fax number to an existing tenant
-----------------------------------------  
1. Locate the account in ACE
2. Go to**Fax Number Maintenance**
3. Assign a fax number to an existing fax username. Usually, fax admin accounts have one fax username with multiple fax numbers assigned to it like on a screenshot.  
**NOTE:**We assign fax numbers to one username to keep it simple and don’t add multiple usernames and create more confusion, fax users need to be created manually in the portal.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2bd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mIMx)
4. Launch the fax portal from OKTA
5. Navigate to**SYTECH**>**Fax Routes**
6. Search for a fax number  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2bd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mINC)
7. Left-click on a number to highlight it and on the top, go to**select action…**>**Assign Manager**>**select**> enter customer’s account number and hit**FIND**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2bd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mINH)
8. Double-click on a tenant to select it and hit**Execute**.
9. Managed By will change from Nextiva Customers to customer’s sub-tenant.
10. Go back to**select action**and switch from**Assign Manager**to**Assign Owner**, select**customer’s sub-tenant**>**Execute**.
11. Owned By will change from Nextiva Customers to customer’s sub-tenant too.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2bd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mIOP)
12. The customer should be able to see the number added in their fax portal under**Admin > Routing Assignment**.  
---  
How to remove a fax number from sub-tenant
------------------------------------------  
1. Launch the fax portal from OKTA
2. Navigate to **SYTECH** > **Fax Routes**
3. Search for the fax number
4. Left-click on a number to highlight it and on the top, go to **select action…** > **Assign Manager** > **select** > find **Nextiva Customers** tenant on the list.
5. Double-click on the tenant’s name and hit **Execute**. **Managed By** will change from customer’s sub-tenant to Nextiva Customers.
6. Switch from **Assign Manager** to **Assign Owner** and set it also to **Nextiva Customers**.
7. Once both, **Managed By** and **Owned By** are set to Nextiva Customers, you may unassign a number from a user in ACE > **Fax Number Maintenance** and remove it from ACE account.

question: What are the steps for an administrator to reset a user's password through the administrator portal?
reference_answer:
1. Log in as an administrator.
2. Select the Users tab.
3. Hover over the desired user and click the dropdown menu on the far right titled Actions.
4. Select Edit Profile.
5. Click Reset password.
6. The user will receive an email at the email address on file for the user.
7. Follow the instructions in the email to reset the password.
reference_context:
Document 265: summary: How to reset a user's password for any Nextiva tool.
text: # How to reset a user's password for any Nextiva tool.

Any user can request their password reset through the Nextiva website or NextivaONE. From the main login page click the**Forgot Password?**link to reset your password.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Wn&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000001zuPk)  
An Administrator can also reset the password for a user through their administrator portal.  
| For instructions on how to reset a user's password as an administrator, choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| --- | --- |
| [image.png](#NP3) | [Platform Landing Page](#Platform) |  
---  
Reset Password
--------------  
1. Log in as an administrator.
2. Select the **Users** tab.
3. Hover over the desired user and click the dropdown menu on the far right titled **Actions**.
4. Select **Edit Profile**.
5. Click **Reset password**.
6. The user will receive an email at the email address on file for the user.
7. Follow the instructions in the email to reset the password.  
---  
Reset Password
--------------  
1. Log into the portal as an administrator.
2. Hover over **Users** on the top side of the page and select **Manage Users**.
3. Search for the desired user and click the pencil icon on the far right to **edit** the user.
4. Click the **Security Information** tab.
5. Click **Reset Password**.
6. The user will receive an email at the email address on file for the user.
7. Follow the instructions provided in the password reset email.

You'll need to follow these steps: Log in to the administrator portal, navigate to the user management section, select the user whose password you want to reset, and then follow the prompts to reset the password.

question: How do you assign a fax number to an existing tenant?
reference_answer: 1. Locate the account in ACE. 2. Go to Fax Number Maintenance. 3. Assign a fax number to an existing fax username. 4. Launch the fax portal from OKTA. 5. Navigate to SYTECH > Fax Routes. 6. Search for a fax number. 7. Left-click on a number to highlight it and on the top, go to select action… > Assign Manager > select > enter customer’s account number and hit FIND. 8. Double-click on a tenant to select it and hit Execute. 9. Managed By will change from Nextiva Customers to customer’s sub-tenant. 10. Go back to select action and switch from Assign Manager to Assign Owner, select customer’s sub-tenant > Execute. 11. Owned By will change from Nextiva Customers to customer’s sub-tenant too. 12. The customer should be able to see the number added in their fax portal under Admin > Routing Assignment.
reference_context:
Document 262: summary: Assign a fax number to a fax admin tenant
text: # Assign a fax number to a fax admin tenant

Fax Admin Tenant is a separate sub-tenant in the vFAX portal. Some enterprise customers have Admin rights and can manage their fax users. Fax Tenant is created manually in the portal, users and numbers are also added to the sub-tenant via fax portal, not ACE. We do not create fax users in ACE for these accounts. If you open the account in ACE and go to Fax Number Maintenance, you’ll see all fax numbers assigned to a single username. We should never delete this username.  
Assign a fax number to an existing tenant
-----------------------------------------  
1. Locate the account in ACE
2. Go to**Fax Number Maintenance**
3. Assign a fax number to an existing fax username. Usually, fax admin accounts have one fax username with multiple fax numbers assigned to it like on a screenshot.  
**NOTE:**We assign fax numbers to one username to keep it simple and don’t add multiple usernames and create more confusion, fax users need to be created manually in the portal.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2bd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mIMx)
4. Launch the fax portal from OKTA
5. Navigate to**SYTECH**>**Fax Routes**
6. Search for a fax number  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2bd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mINC)
7. Left-click on a number to highlight it and on the top, go to**select action…**>**Assign Manager**>**select**> enter customer’s account number and hit**FIND**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2bd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mINH)
8. Double-click on a tenant to select it and hit**Execute**.
9. Managed By will change from Nextiva Customers to customer’s sub-tenant.
10. Go back to**select action**and switch from**Assign Manager**to**Assign Owner**, select**customer’s sub-tenant**>**Execute**.
11. Owned By will change from Nextiva Customers to customer’s sub-tenant too.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2bd&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mIOP)
12. The customer should be able to see the number added in their fax portal under**Admin > Routing Assignment**.  
---  
How to remove a fax number from sub-tenant
------------------------------------------  
1. Launch the fax portal from OKTA
2. Navigate to **SYTECH** > **Fax Routes**
3. Search for the fax number
4. Left-click on a number to highlight it and on the top, go to **select action…** > **Assign Manager** > **select** > find **Nextiva Customers** tenant on the list.
5. Double-click on the tenant’s name and hit **Execute**. **Managed By** will change from customer’s sub-tenant to Nextiva Customers.
6. Switch from **Assign Manager** to **Assign Owner** and set it also to **Nextiva Customers**.
7. Once both, **Managed By** and **Owned By** are set to Nextiva Customers, you may unassign a number from a user in ACE > **Fax Number Maintenance** and remove it from ACE account.

You'll need to access the tenant's settings and update their contact information. Want me to guide you through the steps?

question: What should be done if the user creation task fails with the error 'Service usage Limit is Reached'?
reference_answer: If the user creation task fails with the error 'Service usage Limit is Reached', it indicates that one or more of the services allocated to the users has a limit set on it. These limits need to be removed. Go to the Group Level in CP, click on Resources, then Services, and ensure that the user services have no limit. Once all services are confirmed to have no limit, perform the user creation again.
reference_context:
Document 261: summary: Add additional phone numbers or DIDs to a trunking account.
text: # Add additional phone numbers or DIDs to a trunking account.

This article is for adding additional DIDs to a trunking account, if the customer purchased additional trunks, see the article[NextOS Trunking - Adding Trunks](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/NextOS-Trunking-Adding-Trunks).  
User Creation Steps
-------------------  
1. Check the phone numbers in ACE, and make sure that the number has the tag *-NextOS* after the carrier (i.e. Level3-NextOS).
2. Launch the**CP Portal**from**ACE**.
3. Navigate to the group level.
4. Increase the number of allowed users.
1. Click **Profile**under the Basic column.
2. In the**User Limits**section increase**Limited To** by the number of phone numbers to add.
* The **Limited To**number should total 1 + number of DIDs. If the customer has 10 phone numbers this value should be 11.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2dF&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004LxcT)
3. Click**OK**.
5. Assign the numbers to the group
1. Click**Resources**on the left-hand side of the page.
2. Click**Assign Numbers**under the Advanced column.
3. Select the numbers to add and move them to the right-most column.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2dF&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004Lxcs)
4. Click**OK**.
6. Create the Users
1. Click**Services**on the left-hand side of the page.
2. Click**Trunk Groups**under the advanced section.
3. Click on the trunk group the customer wants the users added on to.
4. Click on**Trunk Group User Creation**under the Advanced column.
5. Click**Add Using DNs**.
6. Complete the form based on the type of PBX.
* **Panasonic or Avaya**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2dF&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004Lxd2)
+ **Task Name**- Your initials and the date (mm/dd/yy)
+ **UserID Format**- National[DN@nextiva.com](mailto:DN@nextiva.com)
+ **Line/Port Format**- National[DN@pai.voipdnsservers.com](mailto:DN@pai.voipdnsservers.com)
+ **Contact Format**- National[DN@pai.voipdnsservers.com](mailto:DN@pai.voipdnsservers.com)
* **All Other PBX**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2dF&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004LxdC)
+ **Task Name**- Your initials and the date (mm/dd/yy)
+ **UserID Format**- National[DN@nextiva.com](mailto:DN@nextiva.com)
+ **Line/Port Format**- National[DN@bt.voipdnsservers.com](mailto:DN@bt.voipdnsservers.com)
+ **Contact Format**- National[DN@bt.voipdnsservers.com](mailto:DN@bt.voipdnsservers.com)
7. Move phone numbers assigned to the trunk group to the right-most column.
8. Add all services. Confirm the following services are added:
* Authentication
* Barge-in Exempt
* Basic Call Logs
* Call Waiting
* Calling Line ID Delivery Blocking
* Calling Name Delivery
* Calling Name Retrieval
* Calling Number Delivery
* Calling Party Category
* Charge Number
* Classmark
* Client Call Control
* Connected Line Identification Presentation
* Connected Line Identification Restriction
* Customer Originated Trace
* External Calling Line ID Delivery
* Intercept User
* Internal Calling Line ID Delivery
* Malicious Call Trace
* Privacy
9. Click**OK.**
10. Confirm creation by clicking**OK**in the popup window.
* User creation can take up to 5 minutes.
11. Refresh the page to confirm user creation was completed. If there were errors, see the [user creation errors](#User_Creation_Errors)section.  
---  
User Creation Errors
--------------------  
1. If the user creation task fails with errors we need to determine why.
2. Download the error log and open it up.
3. Review the log for the error reason
* **Service usage Limit is Reached**- This indicates that one or more of the services allocated to the users has a limit set on it these limits need to be removed.
1. Go to the**Group Level**in CP.
2. Click on**Resources**on the left-hand side.
3. Click on**Services**on the basic column.
4. Ensure that the user services have no limit. See the user creation section for the[list of services](#Service_list).
5. Once all services are confirmed to have no limit do the[user creation](#User_Creation)again.
* **The user may not be added because the group user limit has been reached**- This indicates the group limit was not properly adjusted to the number of users added.
1. Return to the group level and fix the[user limit](#User_Limits).
2. Once the user limit is set correctly, do the[user creation](#User_Creation) again.

question: How long does it take for a Caller ID update request to be completed?
reference_answer: about 10-15 business days
reference_context:
Document 266: summary: Define Caller ID and provide instructions on how to update Caller ID.
text: # Define Caller ID and provide instructions on how to update Caller ID.

What is Caller ID and How does it Work?
---------------------------------------  
To request an update see the [update Caller ID](#Update_Caller_ID) section.  
Caller ID is a phone feature that provides the name and number of a calling party, if available. Caller ID technically only supplies the phone number of the calling party, but its usage as a term has effectively made it synonymous with the calling name, too. The name of the calling party is actually provided by a service called CNAM.  
CNAM (“Calling NAMe”) is an outside telecom service that phone companies use to pair incoming numbers with names. Unlike phone numbers, CNAMs are not centralized databases. A carrier can choose from many different CNAMs. Each CNAM maintains its own private database on phone number/name pairs in the United States and abroad.  
No FCC guidelines regulate carrier accuracy,*carriers can maintain their caller ID databases as they see fit*.  
There are several interactions with caller ID in telephony today:  
1. **VOIP to VOIP**  
Calling from Nextiva (Voice over Internet Protocol) to another VoIP phone. Nextiva will offer both a Caller ID Name and a Caller ID Number on this call, whoever the carrier is for the other VoIP phone (for example Vonage) will pull in both the Caller ID Name and Number and will pass it along as is to their customer's phone. So any updates we make to your Caller ID will update right away in this scenario.
* For example, in Nextiva's records for the number (480) 555-1212 we have listed **ABC Inc.**, when this customer calls to someone who also uses VoIP, we are able to pass both the phone number and name along so the person receiving the call will see (480) 555-1212 ABC Inc.
2. **VOIP to a Cell phone or Landline (No Caller ID)**  
When calling from Nextiva to a non-Voip phone that doesn't have a caller ID service, Nextiva will offer both a Caller ID Name and a Caller ID Number on this call.The carrier will pull in only the number portion of what we offer, then the phone will try to look up in its list of saved contacts what name might go with that number. If there is no contact then the phone will either just show *unknown* or a location based on the phone number itself.
* For example, the 602 area code is in Arizona, while the next 3 digits of the phone number will specify the Telephone Exchange so 222 is for Phoneix specifically. Depending on the phone carrier, they will use some variant of this information (city and state) for the Caller ID Name. You can look up specifics about an area code and exchange [here](https://www.area-codes.com/search.asp).
3. **VOIP to a Cell phone or Landline (Caller ID)**  
When calling from Nextiva to a caller ID enabled phone, Nextiva will offer both a Caller ID Name and a Caller ID Number on this call. The carrier for the phone will pull only the number portion of what we offer, then that carrier will look up in ***its own*** Caller ID table to see what name should go along with the number it sees, then pass that on down the wire, formatted correctly for the analog phone that their customer is using.
* For example, Nextiva may update the phone number (480) 555-1212 to have a caller ID of**ABC Inc.**, but if Spectrum doesn't download that change to its caller ID table, anyone calling to a Spectrum line will see their entry of**Nextiva**.The third situation is the type of Caller ID update that takes time. Each of the local phone carriers has its own Caller ID table. Each company stays updated with through several managed Caller ID databases run by different companies. All of the different carriers will periodically update their own Caller ID tables based on these databases, however, they are charged each time they update their data. Large carriers have the funding to regularly update their records, while smaller carriers may not update their tables as often. What Nextiva does to address caller ID issues is to update one of the centrally managed databases to have the requested Caller ID Name go along with the Caller ID Number. It takes up to 15 business days for this request to process, after that, it is then up to the local carriers as to when they update their own records given the cost associated with doing so.  
---  
Update Caller ID
----------------  
**NOTE:**Nextiva cannot update the caller ID on toll-free and fax numbers.  
To request an update to your caller ID, [submit a case](https://help.nextiva.com/s/contactsupport) with the following information:  
* **Phone Number(s):**The phone number(s) that need a caller ID update.
* **Address:**Required by some carriers, but is NOT published.
* **New Caller ID:**Maximum 15 characters (alphanumeric only) including spaces.  
Nextiva will send the caller ID update request to their partnering carriers, who will update the national caller ID database. Nextiva will send an email to confirm the completion of the request (about 10-15 business days). Please allow time for the new caller ID to display on the recipients’ phones. Carriers dip the national caller ID database at different frequencies (e.g. some carriers dip weekly, while others dip monthly or quarterly), so times will vary.

question: What is the default PIN for accessing Nextiva voicemail for the first time?
reference_context:
Document 267: summary: Walk through how to configure and access voicemail for Nextiva voice accounts.
text: # Walk through how to configure and access voicemail for Nextiva voice accounts.

| Configure your voicemail greetings, notification settings, and number of rings before a call goes to voicemail for a user. These settings only affect calls that are direct to the user or are going to the user's specific voicemail box. | |
| --- | --- |
| Please be aware of the following limits for messages left in your voicemail box:     * A single message can be no longer than 10 minutes in length * Each mailbox has a total of 300 minutes of storage, once that storage limit has been reached messages will need to be deleted before new messages can be recorded. | |
| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| [image.png](#NP3) | [Platform Main Page](#Platform) |  
---  
Setup
-----  
These settings can be controlled by either an administrator or a user.  
| **Administrator**  1. Log into the voice portal 2. Select**Users**. 3. Hover over the user and select**Voice Settings**. 4. Select**Voicemail**.  **User**  1. Log into the voice application 2. Click your initials in the upper right-hand corner 3. Select**My Settings**. 4. Hover over calls and select**Voicemail**. |  |
| --- | --- |  
Within the voicemail settings, the following options can be controlled:  
**Basic Options**  
* **Greeting**- Select or record a new standard greeting.
* **Rings before voicemail greeting**- Select the number of rings before a call goes to voicemail, this only affects calls directly sent to your user.
* **Voicemail PIN**- Set a new PIN for accessing voicemail. The next time you call into the voicemail box, the system will prompt for a new PIN.
* **Voicemail to Email**- Email address to receive a copy of any voicemail left in the mailbox.
* **Alert for a new voicemail**- Email address to receive a notification when a new voicemail is left.  
**Advanced Options**  
* **Busy Greeting**- Select a greeting to use when you are busy (Do Not Disturb or Reject a call)
* **Select calls to go to Voicemail**- Control what calls route to voicemail.
* **Transfer on "0" to this number**- During the voicemail greeting, callers can press 0 to transfer to another phone number or extension.
* **Storage options**- Store messages on the Nextiva system or email the audio file to a specific email address.  
**NOTE:**The transcription features offered by Nextiva require voicemail to be stored on the Nextiva system to work.

Document 268: summary: Walk through how to configure and access voicemail for Nextiva voice accounts.
text: Users can listen to voicemail messages by accessing their Nextiva Voice mailbox from a Nextiva phone or external phone. If calling from the primary phone, dial \*86, otherwise if calling from any external phone, dial the phone number and press the \* key during the voicemail greeting. Press 1 to access the voice mailbox and listen to messages. The default PIN is 0000.  
Users can also access their voicemail messages through the NextivaONE application.  
---  
Setup
-----  
These settings can be controlled by either an administrator or a user.  
| **Administrator**  1. Log into the voice portal 2. At the top of the page hover over**Users** and select **Manage Users**. 3. Select the user to modify settings 4. Click**Voicemail and Notification**to expand the section. 5. Click**Voicemail**.  **User**  1. Log into the voice portal 2. Click**Features**at the top of the page. 3. Click**Voicemail and Notification**to expand the section. 4. Click**Voicemail**. |  |
| --- | --- |  
Within the voicemail settings, the following options can be controlled:  
**Basic Settings**  
* **Voicemail Greeting**- Select the main voicemail greeting
* **Busy Greeting**- Selecta greeting to use when you are busy (Do Not Disturb or Reject a call)
* **Voicemail to Email**
+ **Alert me of Voicemail**-Email address to receive a notification when a new voicemail is left.
+ **Sent Attachment of Message**-Email address to receive a copy of any voicemail left in the mailbox.  
**Advanced Settings**  
* **Select calls to go to Voicemail**- Control what calls route to voicemail.
* **Transfer on "0" to this number**- During the voicemail greeting, callers can press 0 to transfer to another phone number or extension.
* **Storage options**- Store messages on the Nextiva system or email the audio file to a specific email address.  
**NOTE:**The transcription features offered by Nextiva require voicemail to be stored on the Nextiva system to work.  
Users can listen to voicemail messages by accessing their Nextiva Voice mailbox from a Nextiva phone or external phone. If calling from the primary phone, dial \*86, otherwise if calling from any external phone, dial the phone number and press the \* key during the voicemail greeting. Press 1 to access the voice mailbox and listen to messages. The default PIN is 0000.  
Users can also access their voicemail messages through the NextivaONE application.

Document 269: summary: Walk through how to configure and access voicemail for Nextiva voice accounts.
text: If calling from the primary phone, dial \*86, otherwise, if calling from an external phone, dial the phone number and press the \* key during the voicemail greeting. Enter the PIN followed by the # key.  
**NOTE:** For initial setup, enter the default PIN 0000, then follow the prompts to change the PIN to a personalized 4-digit number and record a name.  
#### No Answer greeting  
The No Answer greeting plays for the callers when their call is not answered.  
Press 1 > 3 > 1 > start recording at the tone and press # to stop recording.  
#### Busy greeting  
The Busy greeting plays for callers when the user is already on a call.  
Press 1 > 2 > 1 > start recording at the tone and press # to stop recording.  
#### Extended Away Greeting  
The extended away greeting is only available by dialing into your voice portal.  
This greeting is useful when you are on vacation or away for an extended period.**Please note that enabling the Extended Away greeting will disable the voicemail box from recording voicemails. It will play the message and then disconnect.**  
Press 1 > 4 > 1 start recording and the tone and press # to stop recording. Press 1 to activate the Extended Away Greeting

Sure, I can help with that. What seems to be the issue?
What is the default one for that?
The default PIN is typically the last 4 digits of the phone number unless it has been changed.

question: What is the recommended file format for importing devices?
reference_answer: It is recommended to use the Microsoft Excel XLS template as the device type needs to match exactly what is in the Nextiva system and the XLS template has drop-down options to select with.
reference_context:
Document 271: summary: How to bulk import users and devices to your account
text: 1. Log into the voice portal as an administrator
2. Click **Users**.

text: 1. Log in to the voice portal as an adminstrator.
2. Hover over**Devices**at the top of the page and click**Add Devices**.
3. Select the option to **Import Multiple Devices**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Rx&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mPzw)
4. Click the blue**Download XLS Template**button or the blue**Download CSV Template**button to download the template device file. XLS is a Microsoft® Excel® file format, while CSV (Comma Separated Value) is an alternate file format that Microsoft Excel and other programs can utilize.

7. In the NextOS portal, click the**Upload****complete template**button.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Rx&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mQ1Y)
8. Select the file from your computer.
9. The devices will be uploaded to the account and will need to be [assigned to a user](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Assign-a-Device-3-0?r=34&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1).

question: How can I change my CommPilot Express status in the Nextiva Unity client?
reference_answer: To set your CommPilot Express status in the unity client: 1. Click on the My Status section on the client. 2. Select your desired preference: Available In Office, Available Out of Office, Busy, Unavailable, None.
reference_context:

text: # Control the CommPilot express settings using the Nextiva Unity client.

| CommPilot Express is a legacy feature that is no longer included in accounts. | |
| --- | --- |  
Setting Status
--------------  
To set your CommPilot Express status in the unity client:  
1. Click on the**My Status**section on the client.
2. **Select your desired preference:**
* Available In Office
* Available Out of Office
* Busy
* Unavailable
* None  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Oj&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001oSQ5)  
---  
Adjusting CommPilot Express settings
------------------------------------  
The CommPolot Express settings can be adjusted through the services tab of Unity settings. See[Unity - Services and Settings](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Unity-Services-and-Settings?r=34&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1)for more configuration information.

question: What type of license is required for agents to use the Keep My Place in Queue feature?
reference_answer: Nextiva Call Center Enterprise or Nextiva Call Center Professional
reference_context:
Document 277: summary: Describe the Keep my Place in Queue feature with Unity.
text: # Describe the Keep my Place in Queue feature with Unity.

Description
-----------  
Keep My Place in Queue (KMPIQ) is an add-on to Unity for the Nextiva call center feature that allows queued callers to request a call-back when their place in the queue reaches the front. This feature uses the inbound caller's caller ID number to hold their place and make the callback, so unknown or private numbers will NOT receive the option for a callback.  
This feature requires either the Nextiva Call Center Enterprise or Nextiva Call Center Professional licensing for agents, a Unity Agent or Unity Supervisor license, and a Unity KMPIQ add-on license.  
---  
How it Works
------------  
When a caller requests a callback, Unity keeps track of where they are in the queue. When their position reaches the front, Unity forces the next agent into an unavailable state and presents them with the callback. Once the agent completes the call, Unity will place them available to take calls from the queue again after a customer-defined wrap-up time.

question: What is the first step in configuring the Dial Plan Policy in the Broadsoft Configuration Portal?
reference_answer: Before configuring the Dial Plan Policy, ensure the dial plans on the customers' devices are set up to support 12-digit dialing.
reference_context:
Document 278: summary: How to configure a dial plan policy in the Broadsoft Configuration Portal (CP), including setting up an access code to require dialing a digit before placing an outbound call.
text: # How to configure a dial plan policy in the Broadsoft Configuration Portal (CP), including setting up an access code to require dialing a digit before placing an outbound call.

Description
-----------  
This feature is used to configure a group’s Dial Plan policy for digit collection and outside access code processing. This includes public and private dial plans simultaneously on a per-group basis. The Dial Plan policy allows integrated and consistent control of digit collection and external digit processing policies. One of the commonly used applications that require configuring this policy is to provide the capability to allow the “dial 9 to access an outside line” feature common in many PBX systems.  
**Be aware, that this feature is a Group level feature and cannot be altered by department or user policies. This expectation must be set before configuring the service for the customer.**  
---  
Setup Procedure
---------------  
1. Before configuring the Dial Plan Policy, ensure the dial plans on the customers' devices are set up to support 12-digit dialing.
* Below is an example of the default Polycom dial plan:
+ [9]11|[0-1][2-9]11|0T|01[2-9]xx.T|#xx|\*xx|011x.T|[0-1]xxxxxxxT|[0-1][2-9]xxxxxxxxx|[2-9]xxxxxxxxx|[2-9]xxxxxxT|101xxxx.T|[2-9]x.T
* And an update dial plan to support 12-digit dialing:
+ [9]11|[0-1][2-9]11|0T|01[2-9]xx.T|#xx|\*xx|011x.T|[0-1]xxxxxxxT|[0-1][2-9]xxxxxxxxxx|[2-9]xxxxxxxxxx|[2-9]xxxxxxT|101xxxx.T|[2-9]x.T
* The dial plan can be updated on supported devices by going to the device's Template file, pulling the associated Broadworks tag to adjust the value of the parameter, going to the repository, updating the existing dial plan, and updating the value of the parameter with the Broadworks tag.
2. After updating the phones to support the new dial plan, the customer should be able to process a 12-digit call, even if the call won't complete it is important to ensure that we are seeing 12 digits pass from the phone to our services.
3. Next, go to the Group level of CP for the account you want to set this setup, click **Profile**, and then select **Dial Plan Policy**
4. Update the following settings as follows:  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2LV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000047k3Z)
1. Dial Plan Policy Settings For This Group: Change this from **System Settings**to **Group Settings**
2. Check the box that says **Requires Access Code for Public Calls**
3. Update the Public Digit Map to: [9]11|[0-1][2-9]11|0T|01[2-9]xx.T|#xx|\*xx|011x.T|[0-1]xxxxxxxT|[0-1][2-9]xxxxxxxxx|[2-9]xxxxxxxxx|[2-9]xxxxxxT|101xxxx.T|[2-9]x.T
4. **Apply** these settings
5. After applying the settings, select "**Add**" to apply an Access Code and Description and Save.
6. Once complete, the customer will be required to dial the Access Code specified to complete calls.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2LV&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y0000047k43)  
Example:  
If the Access Code is set to 9, the customer will need to dial 9Nxxxxxxxxxx for a call to complete. If not, they will receive an error message informing them they must dial the access code to complete an outside call.

question: What is the maximum file size that can be attached to a message in NextivaONE?
reference_answer: 1MB
reference_context:
Document 288: summary: Configure and use the Message Pro (Team SMS/Group SMS Messaging) feature within NextivaONE, allowing a team of people to text on a single phone number.
text: | You can send an outbound message to a maximum of 10 phone numbers or contacts.When attaching a file to send, there is a maximum file size of 1MB. | |
| --- | --- |  
After enabling team messaging, you can view all the conversations using your team's primary phone number in NextivaONE under the **Messaging** tab.  
NextivaONE displays all incoming and outgoing team messages, providing complete visibility on who sent the text and which team member replied.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AQ0ul)
To view all team messages, simply click on the team phone number. You can also respond directly from this view by opening the conversation and typing your message in the space provided.  
To send a message from your team's phone number, select **Send a message** from the top right menu. Enter the recipient's name or number, and type in your message.  
You can add a maximum of ten people per conversation and attach a maximum of 1MB file to a message.  
Click the **ellipses** to the left and select the number you want to send the message from. Hit **enter** when ready to send the message.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AQ0v5)  
---

Document 289: summary: Configure and use the Message Pro (Team SMS/Group SMS Messaging) feature within NextivaONE, allowing a team of people to text on a single phone number.
text: Like the desktop version, team messages will show up under the message tab of the application. Users can filter messages for a specific team by selecting the team in the filter dropdown.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000006mgsj)  
To send a message from the team, click the vertical ellipses to the left of the text field and select the team you wish to send from.  
|  |  |
| --- | --- |  
When you select a different team, a prompt will appear asking to move the conversation to include the correct contacts. Click**Yes,** **move conversation** to move the conversation to the team and send the message.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000006mW2A)

Document 287: summary: Configure and use the Message Pro (Team SMS/Group SMS Messaging) feature within NextivaONE, allowing a team of people to text on a single phone number.
text: | *Each* member of the team needs a Message Pro license assigned to them for this feature to work. | |
| --- | --- |  
The steps below walk through how to enable Message Pro for a team.If you need instructions on creating a team[click here](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Teams).  
1. Log into your account as an administrator.
2. Navigate to**Teams**.
3. Hover over the team we are configuring to use Message Pro.
4. Click the**Actions** button.
5. Select**Messaging**.
6. Ensure a**Primary Number**is assigned to the team already. This number will be used for both texting and making phone calls.  
![A screenshot of a computer  Description automatically generated](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AQ0uq)
7. Toggle the**Team Text Messaging**feature**On**.
8. In the side panel that appears, select the users on the account that will be using the team text feature.
9. Click**Save**.
10. Under additional settings, you can choose to display or not display the first name and last initial of the user that is sending a message from the team.  
---  
Currently, this feature is NOT supported for this account layout.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AQ0uM)  
---  
Sending and responding
----------------------  
Message pro can be utilized for users on the [desktop](#Send_Respond_Desktop), [web](#Send_Respond_Desktop), and [mobile](#Send_Respond_Mobile) versions of NextivaONE.

Document 286: summary: Configure and use the Message Pro (Team SMS/Group SMS Messaging) feature within NextivaONE, allowing a team of people to text on a single phone number.
text: # Configure and use the Message Pro (Team SMS/Group SMS Messaging) feature within NextivaONE, allowing a team of people to text on a single phone number.

With Message Pro, you can send a text message from and to a team's primary phone number, which **all** team members will receive. Message Pro is included with our Engage or Power Suite packages; or, you can purchase a separate license to be assigned to each member utilizing team SMS. If a team member does not have a Message Pro license, they will NOT be able to send or receive messages on that phone number.  
| In order for texting to be enabled, the phone number needs to be part of your texting campaign, [click here](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/10DLC-Verification-Process-SMS-Registration-Steps)for instructions on how to register a phone number for texting. | |
| --- | --- |  
To jump to instructions on how to send and respond, [click here](#Sending_and_Responding).  
Setting Up Message Pro
----------------------  
| Message Pro cannot be configured for toll-free or fax numbers. |
| --- |  
| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| --- | --- |
| [NP3 Admin Dashboard](#NP3) | [Platform Main Page](#Platform) |  
---

question: What are the default administrator credentials for accessing the Yealink Txx device's WebUI?
reference_answer: The default credentials are: Username: admin, Password: admin
reference_context:
Document 280: summary: Instructions to configure a static IP address for Yealink Txx devices.
text: # Instructions to configure a static IP address for Yealink Txx devices.

From the Device
---------------  
1. Open the Menu
2. Select**Advanced**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026Lzt)
3. Enter the admin password.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026D9W)
4. Select**Network**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026MBB)
5. Select **WAN** port.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026MO5)
6. Select**IPv4**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV00000269vW)
7. With**Type**selected, press the**Switch**softkey to select**Static IP**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026Jja)
8. Fill out each of the fields
* IP Address
* Subnet Mask
* Default Gateway
* Primary DNIS
* Secondary DNS
9. Press**Save** to apply the changes. If needed, the phone will reboot.  
---  
From the WebUI
--------------  
1. On the device press**OK**to obtain the IP address.
2. On computer on the same network as the phone, open a browser.
3. Enter the device IP address into the address bar of the browser.
4. Log in with administrator credentials. The default credentials are:
* **Username:**admin
* **Password:**admin
5. On the left-hand side select **Network** to expand the section.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026O3J)
6. Click**Basic**to access basic network settings.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026OOH)
7. On the screen select the**Static IP**option.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026OT7)
8. Fill out the static IP information
* IP Address
* Subnet Mask
* Default Gateway
* Primary DNIS
* Secondary DNS
9. Click**Save**.
10. Click the **Apply**button at the top of the screen to immediately apply the changes.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026P4D)

conversation_history.content: I need to access the WebUI of a Yealink Txx device.
Sure, I can help with that. What specific information do you need?
What are the defaults for getting in?
For Yealink Txx devices, the default administrator username is 'admin' and the password is also 'admin'.

question: What is the default admin password for a Poly phone before provisioning?
reference_context:
Document 281: summary: How to update firmware on a Poly phone from the WebUI or boot menu.
text: # How to update firmware on a Poly phone from the WebUI or boot menu.

From the WebUI
--------------  
1. Press and hold**1, 4, 7**for about 5 seconds to obtain the IP address, MAC address and firmware version.
2. On a computer on the same network as the phone, open a web browser.The phone has to be on the same local network as the computer for this to work.
* **You may also need to turn on Web Server Configuration in the phone:**
1. Press the**Home**button.
2. Select **Settings**
3. Scroll down and select **Advanced**. The admin password by default is 456.  
**NOTE:** After provisioning, the password will change to nextiva2008.
4. Select**Admin Settings**
5. Scroll down to **Web Server configuration**
6. Set it to**Enabled** and set **Web Config Mode** to **HTTP/HTTPS**.
7. Press the back softkey and choose **Save Config**. The phone may reboot.
3. Navigate to https://[*device IP address*] (i.e. https://10.1.10.127).  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2F3&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001ovyu)
4. When prompted enter the password, by default, this is **456**.
5. Hover over**Utilities** and select**Software Upgrade**.
6. On the software upgrade page  
![pasted image 0.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2F3&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000008BAXT)
1. Select**Poly Hosted Server**.
2. Click**Check for Updates**.
3. Select the desired firmware from the dropdown menu.
4. Click **Install**.

question: What are the default administrator credentials for accessing the WebUI of a Yealink Txx device?
reference_answer: The default credentials are: Username: admin Password: admin
reference_context:
Document 280: summary: Instructions to configure a static IP address for Yealink Txx devices.
text: # Instructions to configure a static IP address for Yealink Txx devices.

From the Device
---------------  
1. Open the Menu
2. Select**Advanced**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026Lzt)
3. Enter the admin password.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026D9W)
4. Select**Network**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026MBB)
5. Select **WAN** port.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026MO5)
6. Select**IPv4**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV00000269vW)
7. With**Type**selected, press the**Switch**softkey to select**Static IP**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026Jja)
8. Fill out each of the fields
* IP Address
* Subnet Mask
* Default Gateway
* Primary DNIS
* Secondary DNS
9. Press**Save** to apply the changes. If needed, the phone will reboot.  
---  
From the WebUI
--------------  
1. On the device press**OK**to obtain the IP address.
2. On computer on the same network as the phone, open a browser.
3. Enter the device IP address into the address bar of the browser.
4. Log in with administrator credentials. The default credentials are:
* **Username:**admin
* **Password:**admin
5. On the left-hand side select **Network** to expand the section.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026O3J)
6. Click**Basic**to access basic network settings.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026OOH)
7. On the screen select the**Static IP**option.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026OT7)
8. Fill out the static IP information
* IP Address
* Subnet Mask
* Default Gateway
* Primary DNIS
* Secondary DNS
9. Click**Save**.
10. Click the **Apply**button at the top of the screen to immediately apply the changes.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2Gf&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV0000026P4D)

For the defaults, you typically use 'admin' for the username and 'admin' for the password.

question: What is the maximum file size that can be attached to a message in Message Pro?
reference_answer: 1MB
reference_context:
Document 287: summary: Configure and use the Message Pro (Team SMS/Group SMS Messaging) feature within NextivaONE, allowing a team of people to text on a single phone number.
text: | *Each* member of the team needs a Message Pro license assigned to them for this feature to work. | |
| --- | --- |  
The steps below walk through how to enable Message Pro for a team.If you need instructions on creating a team[click here](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Teams).  
1. Log into your account as an administrator.
2. Navigate to**Teams**.
3. Hover over the team we are configuring to use Message Pro.
4. Click the**Actions** button.
5. Select**Messaging**.
6. Ensure a**Primary Number**is assigned to the team already. This number will be used for both texting and making phone calls.  
![A screenshot of a computer  Description automatically generated](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AQ0uq)
7. Toggle the**Team Text Messaging**feature**On**.
8. In the side panel that appears, select the users on the account that will be using the team text feature.
9. Click**Save**.
10. Under additional settings, you can choose to display or not display the first name and last initial of the user that is sending a message from the team.  
---  
Currently, this feature is NOT supported for this account layout.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AQ0uM)  
---  
Sending and responding
----------------------  
Message pro can be utilized for users on the [desktop](#Send_Respond_Desktop), [web](#Send_Respond_Desktop), and [mobile](#Send_Respond_Mobile) versions of NextivaONE.

Document 286: summary: Configure and use the Message Pro (Team SMS/Group SMS Messaging) feature within NextivaONE, allowing a team of people to text on a single phone number.
text: # Configure and use the Message Pro (Team SMS/Group SMS Messaging) feature within NextivaONE, allowing a team of people to text on a single phone number.

With Message Pro, you can send a text message from and to a team's primary phone number, which **all** team members will receive. Message Pro is included with our Engage or Power Suite packages; or, you can purchase a separate license to be assigned to each member utilizing team SMS. If a team member does not have a Message Pro license, they will NOT be able to send or receive messages on that phone number.  
| In order for texting to be enabled, the phone number needs to be part of your texting campaign, [click here](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/10DLC-Verification-Process-SMS-Registration-Steps)for instructions on how to register a phone number for texting. | |
| --- | --- |  
To jump to instructions on how to send and respond, [click here](#Sending_and_Responding).  
Setting Up Message Pro
----------------------  
| Message Pro cannot be configured for toll-free or fax numbers. |
| --- |  
| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| --- | --- |
| [NP3 Admin Dashboard](#NP3) | [Platform Main Page](#Platform) |  
---

Document 288: summary: Configure and use the Message Pro (Team SMS/Group SMS Messaging) feature within NextivaONE, allowing a team of people to text on a single phone number.
text: | You can send an outbound message to a maximum of 10 phone numbers or contacts.When attaching a file to send, there is a maximum file size of 1MB. | |
| --- | --- |  
After enabling team messaging, you can view all the conversations using your team's primary phone number in NextivaONE under the **Messaging** tab.  
NextivaONE displays all incoming and outgoing team messages, providing complete visibility on who sent the text and which team member replied.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AQ0ul)
To view all team messages, simply click on the team phone number. You can also respond directly from this view by opening the conversation and typing your message in the space provided.  
To send a message from your team's phone number, select **Send a message** from the top right menu. Enter the recipient's name or number, and type in your message.  
You can add a maximum of ten people per conversation and attach a maximum of 1MB file to a message.  
Click the **ellipses** to the left and select the number you want to send the message from. Hit **enter** when ready to send the message.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y00000AQ0v5)  
---

Document 289: summary: Configure and use the Message Pro (Team SMS/Group SMS Messaging) feature within NextivaONE, allowing a team of people to text on a single phone number.
text: Like the desktop version, team messages will show up under the message tab of the application. Users can filter messages for a specific team by selecting the team in the filter dropdown.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000006mgsj)  
To send a message from the team, click the vertical ellipses to the left of the text field and select the team you wish to send from.  
|  |  |
| --- | --- |  
When you select a different team, a prompt will appear asking to move the conversation to include the correct contacts. Click**Yes,** **move conversation** to move the conversation to the team and send the message.  
![](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2AD&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000006mW2A)

question: How can I create a sub-department in the Broadsoft configuration portal?
reference_answer: To create a sub-department, navigate to the 'Departments' section under the 'Basic' column in the group level of CP. Click 'Add', then fill out the fields. In the 'Parent Department' field, choose the parent department from the drop-down menu.
reference_context:
Document 282: summary: What departments can be used for and how to create them in the Broadsoft configuration portal (CP).
text: # What departments can be used for and how to create them in the Broadsoft configuration portal (CP).

Definition
----------  
Departments are used to sub-categorize users within a group/location Users in a department can have different [music on hold](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Music-on-Hold-CP?r=45&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1)and can show a different [outbound phone number](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Outbound-Caller-ID-Settings?r=45&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1) when dialing out from other members of the group, though the outbound numbers in question need to be on the group location.  
Setup
-----  
1. Launch CP from ACE.
2. Navigate to the **group** level in CP.
3. Click**Departments**under theBasic column.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2DR&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001obkO)
4. Click**Add**.
5. Fill out the fields:  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2DR&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001obkd)
* **Department Name -**The name for the department
* **Parent Department**- If making a sub-department, can choose from the drop-down menu.
* **Department Calling Line ID Name -**Set a caller ID for calls to other locations in the enterprise or to other Nextiva customers.
* **Department Calling Line ID Number -**Set a phone number to show for calls outside the enterprise.
6. Click**OK**.
7. Navigate to the User to assign to the department.
8. Click**Profile**under the basic column.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2DR&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001obQU)
9. Select the **department** from the drop-down menu.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A2DR&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001obmK)
10. Click**Apply**.  
**NOTE:**If you wish to use the department phone number for outbound calls, please follow the steps to update the [outbound phone number](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Outbound-Caller-ID-Settings?r=45&ui-knowledge-components-aura-actions.KnowledgeArticleVersionCreateDraftFromOnlineAction.createDraftFromOnlineArticle=1).

question: How do you create a department in the Broadsoft configuration portal?
reference_answer: 1. Launch CP from ACE. 2. Navigate to the group level in CP. 3. Click Departments under the Basic column. 4. Click Add. 5. Fill out the fields for Department Name, Parent Department, Department Calling Line ID Name, and Department Calling Line ID Number. 6. Click OK. 7. Navigate to the User to assign to the department. 8. Click Profile under the basic column. 9. Select the department from the drop-down menu. 10. Click Apply.

reference_context:
Document 285: summary: Common issues with the auto attendant dial-by-name and dial-by-number options.
text: Users' privacy settings can be adjusted to block calls coming from an auto attendant using dial-by name or dial-by number. Use the articles below to adjust privacy settings.  
* [Privacy Settings](/articles/en_US/Knowledge/Privacy-Settings)

Document 283: summary: Common issues with the auto attendant dial-by-name and dial-by-number options.
text: # Common issues with the auto attendant dial-by-name and dial-by-number options.

Below are some common issues with the Dial by Name and Dial by Number options in the Auto Attendant.  
| Table of Contents |
| --- |
| * [Wrong Name Played](#Wrong_Name) * [Not a Valid Extension or Your Party Could Not be Identified](#Invalid_Ext_Party_Not_Identified)   + [Change the Scope](#Change_Scope)   + [Privacy Settings](#Privacy) |  
Wrong Name Played
-----------------  
When using these features, the system will play a message *Transferring To [recorded name]*. Occasionally, the recorded name does not match the name of the user.  
This occurs when the name of a user is changed instead of deleting/deactivating a user and building a new one. To fix this problem a new name greeting needs to be recorded.  
1. From the user's phone dial 9999.  
**NOTE:**Dialing \*86 will take you to the wrong menu in the voice portal.
2. Enter the voicemail PIN of the user. The default is 0000.
3. Select option 3 to access the greetings menu.
4. Select option 1 to record a new name.
5. Record just the name of the user.
6. Press # to end recording.  
---  
Not a Valid Extension or Your Party Could Not be Identified
-----------------------------------------------------------  
When using dial by number and encountering the message *that is not a validextension* for an extension that does exist on the account, it means that either the [scope](#Change_Scope) of the auto-attendant is not set correctly, or the extension has [privacy settings](#Privacy) keeping it from being reached with dial by number.  
When using dial by name and receiving the message*Your Party Could Not be Identified* for a user that does exist on the account,it means that either the [scope](#Change_Scope) of the auto-attendant is not set correctly, the user's name is spelled wrong in the portal, or the extension has [privacy settings](#Privacy) keeping it from being reached with dial by name.  
---

question: What types of calls does the 'Call Forward No Answer' feature apply to?
reference_answer: This feature only forwards direct calls to the user, it will not forward distributed calls (i.e. calls from call center or call group).
reference_context:
Document 298: summary: How to configure Call Forward no Answer
text: # How to configure Call Forward no Answer

| Call forward no answer is used to send calls to a different extension or phone number if a user's direct line isn't answered within a set number of rings.This feature only forwards direct calls to the user, it will not forward distributed calls (i.e. calls from call center or call group). | |
| --- | --- |
| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| [NP3 Admin Dashboard](#NP3) | [Platform Main Page](#Platform) |  
---  
Setup
-----  
1. Login to the voice portal as an administrator.
2. Click on the**Users**button.
3. Hover over the user to adjust and click on**Actions**then select**Voice Settings**from the dropdown menu.
4. Select**Forwarding**on the left.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A229&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lyLm)
5. Click on**Call forwarding (unanswered) to expand the section.**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A229&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lyLr)
6. Enter a phone number or extension to configure forwarding on and choose the number of rings from the dropdown menu.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A229&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lyM6)
7. Click**Save**at the bottom of the screen.  
---  
Setup
-----  
1. Login to the voice portal as an administrator.
2. Hover over**Users**at the top of the page and select**Manage Users**.
3. Select the user to configure.
4. Scroll down and expand the**Forwarding**section by click on it.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A229&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lyNx)
5. Click on**Call Forwarding when Unanswered**to expand the section.
6. Enter a phone number or extension and set the number of rings.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A229&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lyO7)
7. Click**Save**.

question: What is the default setting for the warning tone in silent monitoring?
reference_answer: disabled
reference_context:
Document 291: summary: This article walks through how to disable barge-in exempt, allowing other users to both silent monitor and barge-in on their calls.  It also covers how to enable or disable the warning tone for both barge-in and silent monitor.
text: # This article walks through how to disable barge-in exempt, allowing other users to both silent monitor and barge-in on their calls.  It also covers how to enable or disable the warning tone for both barge-in and silent monitor.

Disable Barge-In Exempt
-----------------------  
By default all users have barge-in exempt enabled, blocking both barge-in and silent monitoring from happening. Follow these steps to turn it off.  
1. Login to CP.
2. Navigate to the user that needs its settings modified.
3. Click**Call Control**on the left-hand side.
4. Click**Barge-In Exempt**under the Basic column  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A26z&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001m1KS)
5. Select**Off**and click**Apply**.  
---  
Disable Warning Tones
---------------------  
| The warning tone is played by the user who is initiating the Barge or Silent monitor. To have a silent barge, disable the warning tone on the user who will be dialing \*33 + extension |
| --- |  
The default settings have a warning tone enabled for barge-in but disabled for silent monitoring. To adjust this follow these steps.  
1. Login to CP.
2. Navigate to the user that needs its settings modified.
3. Click**Call Control**on the left-hand side.
4. Click**Directed Call Pickup with Barge-In**under the Basic column  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A26z&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001m1Lp)
5. Adjust the settings to enable or disable the tones desired.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A26z&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001m1ME)
6. Click**Apply**.

question: What are the steps to set up a conference bridge for a user?
reference_answer: 1. Access the user to set up the conference by clicking on Users. 2. Hover over the user, click the vertical ellipses, and click Voice Settings. 3. Click on Conferencing. 4. Click on Location conference numbers to expand the section. 5. Click Add conference bridge to create a new conference for the user. 6. Fill out the fields: Enter a description for the conference, Choose a conference number from the dropdown menu, Select an option for when attendees join or leave (Play Tone, Play their recorded name, No Notification). 7. Click Save.
reference_context:
Document 294: summary: How to set up conference bridges and conferences.
text: Before a conference call can be created, a conference bridge needs to be built on the user's location. See the [section above](#Conference_Bridge_Platform) for instructions on how to set up a conference bridge.  
1. Access the user to set up the conference by clicking on**Users**.
2. Hover over the user, click the vertical ellipses**,**and click**Voice Settings**.
3. Click on Conferencing.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mSEU)
4. Click on**Location conference numbers**to expand the section.
5. Click**Add conference bridge**to create a new conference for the user.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mSEe)
6. Fill out the fields
* Enter a description for the conference.
* Choose a conference number from the dropdown menu.
* Select an option for when attendees join or leave:
+ **Play Tone**- Will play a tone when someone joins or leaves.
+ **Play their recorded name**- Will prompt a caller to record their name when they join and play it when they join and leave
+ **No Notification**- No name or tone will play when someone joins or leaves.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mSEo)
7. Click**Save**.  
To access the conference ID and moderator PIN, click on the created conference.  
---  
Setup
-----  
Before a conference can be created, a conference bridge must first be built on the location.  
* [Conference Bridge Setup](#Conference_Bridge_NP3)
* [Conference Call Setup](#Conference_Call_NP3)

Document 296: summary: How to set up conference bridges and conferences.
text: Before a conference call can be created, a conference bridge needs to be built on the user's location. See the [section above](#Conference_Bridge_NP3) for instructions on how to set up a conference bridge.  
1. Access the users' section by hovering over**Users**at the top of the page and choosing**Manage Users**
2. Click on the user to set up a conference.
3. Scroll down and click on the**Conferencing**section to expand it.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004MJbY)
4. Click the**Conference Bridge +**button.
5. Fill out the fields:
* Enter a Name.
* Choose a conference number from the dropdown menu.
* Select an option for when attendees join or leave:
+ **Play Tone**- Will play a tone when someone joins or leaves.
+ **Play their recorded name**- Will prompt a caller to record their name when they join and play it when they join and leave
+ **No Notification**- No name or tone will play when someone joins or leaves.
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004MJbs)
6. Click**Save**.  
To access the conference ID and moderator PIN, click on the created conference.

Document 293: summary: How to set up conference bridges and conferences.
text: Each location hosts its own conference bridge, each bridge can host multiple conference calls. The steps to create a bridge are below:  
1. Navigate to locations by clicking**Account Info**on the left, then selecting the**Locations**tab.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lrhl)
2. Hover over the location to set up on, click the vertical ellipses**,**and click**Voice Settings**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV00000468v3)
3. Click**Conferencing**.
4. Click**Add Conference Number**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lri5)
5. Fill out the fields:
* Enter a description
* Choose a phone number for the bridge
* Select users that can use the conference bridge.
* Click**Save**.![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lriF)
6. The system will automatically allocate the appropriate number of ports to the bridge based on group limits.
7. Once the bridge is set up, a conference will need to be created at the [user level](#User_Setup_NP3).  
---

* Enter a Name for the bridge
* Choose a phone number for the bridge.

* Enter an extension for the bridge.
* Select users to be hosts using this bridge.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lrj3)
7. Click**Save**.

question: How many people can participate in an N-Way conference call?
reference_answer: A user can create ad-hoc conferences with up to 5 other people, for a total of 6 users on one conference call.
reference_context:
Document 290: summary: What is and how to make an N-Way Call
text: # What is and how to make an N-Way Call

Description
-----------  
N-Way Calling is a feature available to customers that allows a user to create ad-hoc conferences with up to 5 other people, for a total of 6 users on one conference call. This feature may be limited by the number of lines of service on an account.  
---  
How to Make a Call
------------------  
To make an N-way call, your account has to be configured by the Nextiva support team. [Click here to submit a case](https://help.nextiva.com/s/contactsupport), listing the users that need N-Way calling configured. Once this is done, follow the steps below.  
**NOTE:**Due to how Nextiva processes N-Way calls, once the host ends the call, all other parties will be disconnected.  
1. Dial the first party. When the first party answers, you can start to add more participants.
2. Press theConferencekey on your phone. This puts the active call on hold and provides you with a dial tone. You may need to press more to see the Conference key
3. Call the next party.
4. When the second party answers, pressConference.This action initiates the N-Way Calling feature. (Your phone’s display will now read “To: Conference”.)
5. PressConference. You receive a dial tone. The other two parties remain connected. Call the third party. When the third party answers, pressConferenceagain to add yourself and this party to the call.
6. Repeat step 5 until you have called all parties (up to 6). All parties remain connected and can speak with one another while you are calling the others.
7. When all parties have been contacted, pressConferenceagain to connect yourself and the last called party to the others. You can now begin your conference.

question: What is the maximum number of participants that can join a single conference call?
reference_context:
Document 292: summary: How to set up conference bridges and conferences.
text: # How to set up conference bridges and conferences.

| Conference bridges allow for conference calls to be hosted by users on a location. Each bridge can support a maximum number of callers based on your account type. There is a maximum of 250 participants in a single conference call.The first time you configure a conference bridge, you may need to contact Nextiva support to be able to enable this feature. | |
| --- | --- |
| Choose the image that looks most like your screen once logged in: | |
| [NP3 Admin Dashboard](#NP3) | [Platform Main Page](#Platform) |  
---  
Setup
-----  
Before a conference can be created, a conference bridge must first be built on the location.  
* [Conference Bridge Setup](#Conference_Bridge_Platform)
* [Conference Call Setup](#Conference_Call_Platform)

Document 294: summary: How to set up conference bridges and conferences.
text: Before a conference call can be created, a conference bridge needs to be built on the user's location. See the [section above](#Conference_Bridge_Platform) for instructions on how to set up a conference bridge.  
1. Access the user to set up the conference by clicking on**Users**.
2. Hover over the user, click the vertical ellipses**,**and click**Voice Settings**.
3. Click on Conferencing.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mSEU)
4. Click on**Location conference numbers**to expand the section.
5. Click**Add conference bridge**to create a new conference for the user.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mSEe)
6. Fill out the fields
* Enter a description for the conference.
* Choose a conference number from the dropdown menu.
* Select an option for when attendees join or leave:
+ **Play Tone**- Will play a tone when someone joins or leaves.
+ **Play their recorded name**- Will prompt a caller to record their name when they join and play it when they join and leave
+ **No Notification**- No name or tone will play when someone joins or leaves.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001mSEo)
7. Click**Save**.  
To access the conference ID and moderator PIN, click on the created conference.  
---  
Setup
-----  
Before a conference can be created, a conference bridge must first be built on the location.  
* [Conference Bridge Setup](#Conference_Bridge_NP3)
* [Conference Call Setup](#Conference_Call_NP3)

Document 293: summary: How to set up conference bridges and conferences.
text: Each location hosts its own conference bridge, each bridge can host multiple conference calls. The steps to create a bridge are below:  
1. Navigate to locations by clicking**Account Info**on the left, then selecting the**Locations**tab.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lrhl)
2. Hover over the location to set up on, click the vertical ellipses**,**and click**Voice Settings**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV00000468v3)
3. Click**Conferencing**.
4. Click**Add Conference Number**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lri5)
5. Fill out the fields:
* Enter a description
* Choose a phone number for the bridge
* Select users that can use the conference bridge.
* Click**Save**.![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lriF)
6. The system will automatically allocate the appropriate number of ports to the bridge based on group limits.
7. Once the bridge is set up, a conference will need to be created at the [user level](#User_Setup_NP3).  
---

Document 296: summary: How to set up conference bridges and conferences.
text: Before a conference call can be created, a conference bridge needs to be built on the user's location. See the [section above](#Conference_Bridge_NP3) for instructions on how to set up a conference bridge.  
1. Access the users' section by hovering over**Users**at the top of the page and choosing**Manage Users**
2. Click on the user to set up a conference.
3. Scroll down and click on the**Conferencing**section to expand it.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004MJbY)
4. Click the**Conference Bridge +**button.
5. Fill out the fields:
* Enter a Name.
* Choose a conference number from the dropdown menu.
* Select an option for when attendees join or leave:
+ **Play Tone**- Will play a tone when someone joins or leaves.
+ **Play their recorded name**- Will prompt a caller to record their name when they join and play it when they join and leave
+ **No Notification**- No name or tone will play when someone joins or leaves.
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004MJbs)
6. Click**Save**.  
To access the conference ID and moderator PIN, click on the created conference.

question: What are the hardware versions of the GXW 4200 series devices?
reference_answer: V1 and V2
reference_context:
Document 297: summary: Guide to supported firmware for the GXW 4200 series devices.
text: # Guide to supported firmware for the GXW 4200 series devices.

Hardware Version
----------------  
The GXW series has **TWO** hardware versions. V1 is the original version. The V2 version is newer and supports more features.  
***Nextiva will only support the V2 hardware version.***  
You can tell the difference between the 2 hardware versions by looking at the Serial number on the bottom/back of the device. It will have a V2 next to the GXW42xx model number. The V1 does not have any notation at all.  
Firmware Version
----------------  
| Nextiva does not support GXW 4200 devices running firmware version 1.0.1.4 or older. Customers who have a devicewith older FW will have to upgrade the firmware from the[Grandstream Site](https://www.grandstream.com/support/firmware). |
| --- |  
You can determine the Firmware version by logging into the web interface and navigating to the **System Info** page. There, you can check either the Prog # or Version #.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A23l&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV000000TuZt)

2. Click on the user to set up a conference.
3. Scroll down and click on the**Conferencing**section to expand it.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004MJbY)
4. Click the**Conference Bridge +**button.
5. Fill out the fields:
* Enter a Name.
* Choose a conference number from the dropdown menu.
* Select an option for when attendees join or leave:
+ **Play Tone**- Will play a tone when someone joins or leaves.
+ **Play their recorded name**- Will prompt a caller to record their name when they join and play it when they join and leave
+ **No Notification**- No name or tone will play when someone joins or leaves.
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM8Y000004MJbs)
6. Click**Save**.  
To access the conference ID and moderator PIN, click on the created conference.

Document 293: summary: How to set up conference bridges and conferences.
text: Each location hosts its own conference bridge, each bridge can host multiple conference calls. The steps to create a bridge are below:  
1. Navigate to locations by clicking**Account Info**on the left, then selecting the**Locations**tab.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lrhl)
2. Hover over the location to set up on, click the vertical ellipses**,**and click**Voice Settings**.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EMUV00000468v3)
3. Click**Conferencing**.
4. Click**Add Conference Number**  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lri5)
5. Fill out the fields:
* Enter a description
* Choose a phone number for the bridge
* Select users that can use the conference bridge.
* Click**Save**.![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lriF)
6. The system will automatically allocate the appropriate number of ports to the bridge based on group limits.
7. Once the bridge is set up, a conference will need to be created at the [user level](#User_Setup_NP3).  
---

2. Click on the location to set up the conference bridge.
3. Scroll down and expand the**Location Features**section by clicking on it.
4. Click on the Conferencing section to open it up.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lrio)
5. Click**Conference Number +**to create a new conference bridge.
6. Fill out the fields:
* Enter a Name for the bridge
* Choose a phone number for the bridge.  
**NOTE:**If you need an additional phone number please contact Nextiva Support.
* Enter an extension for the bridge.
* Select users to be hosts using this bridge.  
![image.png](https://nextiva2021.file.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka0UV000000A25N&feoid=00N4x00000Qr0kx&refid=0EM4x000001lrj3)
7. Click**Save**.
